loans.name: Mapartar Group

texts.en:
Salamatu is 40 years old and married with four children. The Maparta group leader started her food business three years ago and was able to expand it with a previous loan from SMT. She is happy that the business allows her to meet some of the family’s expenses and supplement her husband’s meager income.

The group members are very cooperative and also operate a savings club. The savings are currently being kept by the leader as collateral; in the event that a member fails to pay the Kiva loan installment on time, the group will pay from the savings. The members would like to expand their businesses and are therefore requesting a loan of $1,475.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, palm oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana M. is a person with focus, she is enterprising and active. She is married with two children: Amayrany is 9 years old and is currently attending primary school; and Brandon is 2 years old. She started her business to have a second income from her husband's, so that she can provide her children a better life and become a success. She started in April 2002 sellnig sweets outside her house located in front of two schools, where many students pass by. She wanted to take advantage of that fact and it was going very well, so well that her husband decided to join her and set up a larger stand. Today they can depend on their stand, and always continue to work hard to make it through.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 US that will be repaid in a term of 3 months to purchase more merchandise that is in great demand and to have a better selection to offer her clients. With your help all of this can be made possible.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Juana Martínez es una persona seria, emprendedora y activa. S casada y tiene 2 hijos: Amayrany de 9 años, estudiante de primaria y Brandon de 2 años. Inició el negocio para tener otro ingreso aparte de lo que percibe su esposo y poder darles a sus hijos una vida mejor y salir adelante. Comenzó en Abril de 2002 vendiendo dulces afuera de su casa ya que tiene casi enfrente dos escuelas y pasan muchos estudiantes, por lo cual quiso aprovechar, y como me empezó a ir muy bien con la venta de dulces su esposo se animó a poner un negocio un poco mas grande lo cual hicieron. En la actualidad ya cuentan con su miscelánea y les va muy bien, están esforzándonos por salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para poder comprar mercancía que tiene mayor demanda y tener un mejor surtido para atender a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda esto será posible.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Ligia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ligia has a small business selling clothing from her home. She lives in the Ticuantepe municipality. She is 39 years old, is married and has two children who are in school. Her husband helps support the family from the income he obtains as a commercial carrier. Ligia has had her business for seven years and she carries it out with a lot of effort and dedication because with her business she helps her husband so that all the burden is not on him. Also, her husband has allowed her to grow as a small businesswoman and in turn to feel useful to society and her family. With the loan she is requesting, her business selling women’s clothes will improve since she currently relies on a small inventory of these products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Ligia tiene una pequeña venta de ropa en su casa de habitación, con la cual surte a los vecinos de su barrio. Habita en el Municipio de Ticuantepe, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos estudiantes. Su esposo la apoya en la manutención del hogar con los ingresos obtenidos de su actividad que es transportista. Ligia tiene 7 años de tener el negocio, lo cual lo desarrolla con gran esfuerzo y dedicación porque con éste apoya a su marido y no le deja toda la carga a él. Además que le ha permitido desarrollarse como mujer microempresaria y también sentirse más útil a la sociedad y a su familia. Con el préstamo solicitado aumentará su negocio en ropa para dama ya que actualmente cuenta con poco inventario de este producto.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to stock business.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Gloria Maria tiene 46 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah de la ciudad de Managua, es viuda, y no tuvo hijos. Gloria Maria es una pequeña comerciante que tiene un cafetín en un hospital de la ciudad de Managua, en su cafetín ofrece diversos productos como gaseosas y golosinas. Hace 5 años puso ese cafetín y a través del tiempo lo ha mejorado tanto en infraestructura como en atención. Este cafetín lo inició con ahorros que ella había hechos por algunos años, y a través de créditos a AFODENIC, ha podido crecer poco a poco. Su sueño siempre fue terminar de construir su casa ya que a ésta le hace falta algunos detalles, como por ejemplo el techo del porche de su vivienda el que instalará con el dinero de este préstamo.
texts.en:
Gloria Maria is 46 years old and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua. She is a widow and doesn't have any children. She is a small businesswoman, running a snack bar at a local hospital and offering diverse products such as soft drinks and snacks.She has been doing this for five years, and over time has improved its infrastructure and customer service. She started the snack bar with savings she had from a number years, and with loans from Kiva partner AFODENIC, she has been able to make it grow little by little. Her dream always has been to finish building her home, since it still lacks some details, for example the porch roof she plans on building from this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put a roof on her porch

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Mrs. Lon S., 44, lives in Preak Thom village in Kandal province with her husband, Mr. Khieng Sovannara, and their two children. She is a vegetable seller in the local market and her husband is a construction worker who makes a small income to support the family. Their youngest child is one year old and the older child is employed in a garment factory.

Since her first child's work place is far from home, Mrs. Lon S. spends a lot of money on transportation. In order to save money on transportation, Mrs. Lon S. has been saving to buy a motorbike for her child to go to work. She is requesting a loan to add to her savings.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child to go to work.

loans.name: Nasriniso

texts.en: Nasriniso has sold fabrics for women's clothing at the market for many years. Her fabrics are some of the best at the market. By now she has many clients. She knows her business very well. She is a mother of 5 kids. Her husband works as a cook. She wants to borrow money for purchasing more goods for selling and thus make more profit with which she can provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: Purchasing more fabrics and expanding her business

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam es soltera, vive con sus hermanas y su padre. Tiene más de 7 años de experiencia en la crianza de animales, principalmente ovejas, a las cuales cuida con mucho cariño. También tiene cultivos de quinua y papa, que vende en el mercado principal de la ciudad Jauja, ahora tiene planes para mejorar y producir más. Adicionalmente Miriam trabaja en la municipalidad de su localidad, como asesora de  proyectos, ella es docente de profesión y lo combina con sus labores agrícolas. Es la quinta vez que Miriam solicita un préstamo en MFP, y es una de las clientes más cumplidora de su banco comunal. En esta oportunidad desea invertir en la compra de sacos de abono y fertilizantes, a fin de preparara su tierra para la época de siembra.
texts.en:
Miriam is single and lives with her sisters and father. She has more than 7 years of experience raising animals, mainly sheep, which she raises with much care. She also has quinoa and potato crops that she sells in the main market in the city of Jauja; now she has plans to improve and produce more. Additionally, Miriam works for the municipality of her area, as a project adviser. She is a teacher by profession, which she combines with her agricultural work. This is the fifth time that Miriam is requesting a loan from MFP, and is one of the most dependable clients of her communal bank. With this loan she would like to invest in the purchase of sacs of manure and chemical fertilizer, so that she can prepare her fields for the planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacs of fertilizer

loans.name: Emilina Antonia

texts.es: La Sra. Emelina tiene 40 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Memorial Sandino, estado civil casada su esposo es albañil, tiene dos hijas de 12 y 17 años de edad, sus planes para su familia es brindarle un patrimonio seguro y con mayor protección. Doña Emelina tiene su pequeño negocio de variedades desde hace dos años, sus objetivos en el ámbito económico es aumentar el volumen de venta a través de nuevos clientes y ofreciéndole nuevos productos. Con la solicitud del préstamo de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cementos, bloques y ladrillos para terminar de construir su casa, y poder gozar de una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Señora Emelina is 40 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She is married, and her husband is a builder. She has two children, who are 12 and 17 years old. Her plan for her family is to provide them with a safe, more protected future. For the past two years, Doña Emelina has had a small business, where she sells a variety of items. Her economic objectives are to increase her sales volume through gaining new clients and by offering new products. With this loan from Afodenic, she will be able to buy construction materials, like cement, concrete blocks, and bricks, to finish building her house so that she can enjoy a proper home.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to finish building her house

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 36-year-old married man with three children, living in Jnah in Beirut. He has worked as a plumber since he was 18 years old. He inherited the plumbing business from his father. Ali wants to borrow $1200 to purchase new and improved tools for his plumbing business.

loans.use: Buy new plumbing tools

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, junto a su mamá, empezó desde cero a aprender a manejar una tienda, y le parece que todavía puede ‘crecer’ en su conocimiento del negocio. La idea de comenzar con su tienda de helados, gaseosas, dulces, jugos y salchipapas nació de la necesidad de ayudar a su mamá y proveerla de algún ingreso.
Anteriormente María trabajaba como contadora en una empresa. Se dedicó a esta ocupación durante cinco años tras haber conseguido su título en contabilidad. No obstante, cuando implementó el negocio de la tienda con su madre terminó por manejarla ella misma.
Su negocio tiene casi tres años, y está ubicado en un local que es parte de la casa de sus padres y ella lo alquila a ellos. Mientras que antes tuvo ayuda de un par de primas en el trabajo de la tienda ahora ella trabaja sola, y a veces recibe ayuda económica de su hermana. Por esto, hace cinco meses se juntó a EDAPROSPO y los préstamos la ayudan a llevar para adelante su comercio.
Sin embargo, a sus treinta y tres años María planea trabajar solo un par de meses más con la tienda, y luego a dedicarse a algo diferente por ella misma, ya que ni está casada ni tiene hijos.
texts.en:
María, together with her mother, started from nothing to learn how to run a store and she believes that she can still increase her knowledge of the business. The idea of starting a store for ice cream, soft drinks, candy, juices and salchipapas (a fast food dish of sliced pan-fried beef hot dogs and french fries) came out of the need to help her mother and have some income. María used to work as an accountant for a company. She worked at this occupation for five years after she graduated with her degree. However, after she started up the store with her mother she ended up running it herself. The business is almost three years old and is located in part of her parents´ home, which she rents from them. Before, she was helped in the store by a few of her cousins but now she works by herself and sometimes gets financial help from her sister. For this reason, five months ago she came to EDAPROSPO and receive a loan to help out her business. At her 33 years, María plans to work just a few more months in the store and then look for something different for herself since she is neither married nor has children.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ice cream, drinks and candy for her store.

loans.name: Chadulu O Group

texts.en:
Hadija has been a charcoal seller in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for 10 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $25. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Hadija is married and has four children between the ages of 2 and 13. She also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members: Raila, Kuruthum and Tune. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Sabzbahor

texts.ru: Набиева Сабзбахор проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 32 года , замужем и имеет пятерых детей.Домохозяйка. Занимается фермерской деятельностью.Имеет небольшое хозяйство , где разводит крупно рогатый скот. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы получать молоко.Молоко она сможет реализовывать своим соседям, а часть оставит своим детям. Погашать кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sabzbahor N. lives in Vahdat. She is 32 years old, married and has five children. She is a homemaker and involved in an agricultural business. She has a small farm where she raises livestock. Sabzbahor plans to obtain this loan to purchase a dairy cow and have milk. She could sell the milk to her neighbors and leave some for her children. She can repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Valeriu

texts.en:
Valeriu has two greenhouses on a surface of 776 m. p. He works growing tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, and eggplants. Business is profitable because Valeriu has experience in business and knows how to use technology for increasing vegetable production. He also has 1. 5 hectares of arable land where he grows cabbages and onions. 

Valeriu sells his vegetables at the wholesale market in his district. Valeriu used to grow vegetables mostly in the field, but now he grows them in the greenhouses. He has taken out a loan from Microinvest to purchase film to build another greenhouse.

loans.use: construction of a new greenhouse

loans.name: Dodo

texts.ru:
Абдуллоев Додо Нарзуллоевич 1962 года рождения ,таджик ,женат, имеет 6 детей. 
 Жена Азизова Равшан проживает с мужем и детьми в г.Истаравшане.
 Клиент уже около 10 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Ему помогает сын Иззатулло.
 Клиент берёт займ 1200 сомони сроком на  10 месяцев.
 Дополнительный семейный доход он получает за счет реализации помидоров и огурцов, которые он выращевает вместе со своей семьей.
texts.en:
Dodo A. was born in 1962. He is Tajik. He and his wife, Ravshan Azizova, have 6 children and reside in Istaravshan. Dodo has been working in agriculture for over 10 years. is son Izzatullo assists him in this business. The family earns extra cash by planting cucumbers and tomatoes. Dodo is applying for a 10-month loan of 1200 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to grow vegetables

loans.name: Zanab

texts.en:
Zanab is 50 years old and is married with four children. She cooks and sells beef to earn a living. She is hoping to obtain a loan in the amount of N100,000 in order to purchase more beef to cook and sell.

She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to cook and sell

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El centro focal Germán Buch esta ubicado en la  ciudad de El Alto, a este pertenece la asociación "Renacer”, trabajan hace un año junto a la familia de Pro-mujer, con mucha responsabilidad en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas.
Diferentes son los negocios que existen en este grupo, algunas se dedican a la costura; otras realizan confección de calzados; tejido a mano de chompas y mantillas, una de ellas tiene su taller de cerrajería. Actualmente desean aumentar su producción para vender sus productos a tiendas comerciales, por lo que necesitan mayor capital, para la adquisición de materia prima. Tienen la seguridad  de mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera mejorar también la calidad de vida de sus familias
texts.en:
The central focus of German Buch is located in the city of El Alto, which pertains to the “Renacer” [Reborn] association. They have worked together over the last year with the “Pro-Mujer” [Pro-Woman] group and have been very responsible when it comes to their loan payments and internal activities. The businesses in this group are diverse, some are dedicated to sewing, others make shoes, or hand woven sweaters and shawls. One of the women has her own locksmith shop. Currently, they want to increase their production of sellable goods to increase profits in order to buy more primary materials. This will surely increase their profits and therefore improve their families’ quality of life as well.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase primary materials

loans.name: Fadicou

texts.fr: fadicou W. est une vendeuse de poissons,elle est parent beneficiaire depuis 1999.elle habite dans la localite de cambereneet capitalise une experience d'une dizaine d'annees dans son activite.pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientele elle se trouve dans l'obligation d'augmenter son fond de roulement.par consequent elle demande un pret de cent mille frs.
texts.en:
Fadicou W. is a fishmonger. She has been a client parent since 1999. She lives in the town of Camberene and capitalizes on about ten years of experience in her business. To satisfy customer demand, she finds herself obliged to boost her working capital. Consequently, she is asking for a loan of 100,000 francs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a businesswoman in Sefwi. She trades in Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials. She is 48 years old, married and lives with her husband. She has nine children who are currently in school. She is very supportive to her family through her trading business. She has been selling for the past 10 years but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds. She hopes the loan will enable her to revive the business and make a more viable profit. She wants to purchase Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials in bulk to increase her inventory. It is her desire to rent a store in the community market. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Viola's Group

texts.en: Viola K. is the leader of Suubilyamukama group in Lugazi. She is a married mother of 3 children ages 1-4 and she cares for 3 orphans. Viola is a fish monger who started with silverfish but 2 years ago started dealing in dried fish and as a result, she was able to make more money. She says that she is able to earn a profit of 160,000 UGX a month because of the quality of her fish, and also she provides good customer care.  She hopes to use her savings in the future to build a house for her family, as well as expand her business further. Viola will use the loan to buy more fish for resale.

loans.use: Buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Hilda Luz

texts.es:
La señora Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal “21 de Febrero”, en el distrito de de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y es madre de 1 hijo, ella pudo estudiar la secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Yaurima.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 años, ella posee una tienda para la venta de abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto con el cual pudo adquirir mercadería para su tienda.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder adquirir productos de la Región como papa, ocas, chuño, tunta, quinua, etc. Los compra en Ilave y los vende en Juliaca, este trabajo lo realiza semanalmente en día de feria.

Su deseo es poder comprarse un tractor para la agricultura.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros de Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda is a member of the community bank “21 de Febrero”, (21st of February) in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 25 years old, married, and the mother of 1 son. She completed high school and lives in the Yaurima neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 5 years, and she owns a grocery store. Her first loan was for 300 soles, with which she was able to purchase merchandise for her store. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 800 soles, which will allow her to purchase products from the region, such as potatoes, ocas (yams), chuño or tunta (dried potatoes), and quinoa, etc. She buys them in Ilave and sells them in Juliaca, which she does weekly on the day of the market. Her wish is to be able to buy herself a tractor for agriculture. She enjoys saving and the community bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes, ocas (yams), chuño or tunta (dried potatoes), quinoa, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Theressa

texts.en:
“Be patient and be industrious to have a brighter future” is the statement shared by Ma.Theresa B. who is commonly called “Thess” at Barangay Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is a loving housewife of Clarito B., a Barangay Councilor in their village. They are blessed with three female children namely Clarissa, Shiella, and Carlota. Their eldest child is already graduated from college while the two younger children are currently in tertiary and secondary level of education. They are striving hard to earn income and to satisfy their daily needs especially in providing the education of their two children. 
	Her husband cultivates their farm twice a year. They used to plant rice and vegetables while Theresa is engage in selling cook viand and snacks in their Barangay. She wanted to borrow additional farming and vending capital from Kiva lenders that is amounting to PHP14, 000. Their PHP15, 000 gross incomes in farming every harvest season usually is not enough because of the big interests they put to their debts. Theresa is very thankful that with Kiva loans, her family and other farmers in their village will somehow lessen their credits, debts from traders. She is just hoping that through wise farming management and patience, they will able to uplift their living condition.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Oswalda

texts.es:
Oswalda tiene 46 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y amigable, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja y sus dos hijos por quienes tiene el deseo de progresar. Desde que comienza el día, la tienda de Oswalda abre las puertas para atender la demanda de las madres de familia de su barrio, por lo que procura ofrecer productos frescos y de calidad. Lo que más le agrada de su negocio son las horas que pasa dialogando con sus clientes y entablando lazos de amistad, quienes no dudan en retornar por el buen trato que reciben. Sin embargo, las doce horas continuas atendiendo su tienda son pesadas, sobre todo los fines de semana cuando hay mayor venta de bebidas. Hace diez años que tiene este negocio y ahora ha empezado a elaborar chompas para exportación, con lo que obtiene dinero adicional para incrementar su capital, pues Oswalda se proyecta para ampliar su tienda en un futuro cercano.
Este es su séptimo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está segura de seguir formando parte de su banco comunal, pues siempre fue una persona muy puntual en sus pagos y es considerada como una de las socias más colaboradoras. Con los mil quinientos soles solicitados comprará mercadería para surtir su bodega con productos nuevos.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria O. is from the village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Victoria is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Victoria owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising and selling pigs. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns about 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Victoria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her standard of living and be able to engage in business activities. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to purchase livestock, feed, and other supplies. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more livestock, feed, and other supplies. This loan will be the third one taken out by Victoria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher people, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock, feed, and other supplies.

loans.name: Florentina Matilde

texts.es:
La socia Florentina; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; UBICADOS EN EL DISTRITO DE Andahuaylillas a 5 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 27 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, la socia se dedica al comercio minorista; ella vende pollipapas y salchipapas (papas fritas con pollo frito o con salchichas fritas, a esto le acompaña, salsas diversas y algunas veces un poco de spaghetti) desde hace 2 años; nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su carreta de freidora y así mismo poder comprar los accesorios indispensables, así como los platos, los tenedores, las bebidas para acompañar este plato.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The member Florentina belongs to the Las Triunfadoras Community Bank, located in the Andahuaylillas District, 5 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Florentina is 27 years old, living with someone and has 2 children. For 2 years, she has been involved in retail sales of fried potatoes and fried chicken, or fried sausages, with diverse sauces and, sometimes, some spaghetti.

Florentina wishes to better better equip her frying cart by buying indispensable accessories, such as plates and forks, and drinks to accompany these dishes.

She appreciates and values the loan and is committed to comply with the repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BETTER EQUIP HER FRYING CART.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen has a retail shop selling home products to all kinds of people. She is a 50-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 24 and 34 years. Helen also takes care of additional family members. None of her children go to school. She rents a two-room house where she lives with four people. Her family has access to electricity and piped water.

Helen works seven days a week. She serves an average of 25 customers a day. She buys her merchandise from Nakawa market and incurs extra transport costs to and from her suppliers using public transportation. Her monthly challenges include rent for her business and residence, school fees and medication. She has been in her business for 20 years and with MCDT for four years – now on her tenth loan working with the same group mates. Helen joined MCDT because it is near her home. She hopes to see her business grow and to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Awaou

texts.fr: D. Awaou est née en 1955 à Agbato au  Bénin. Awaou vit depuis 54 ans au quartier Agbato à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à DOHOU Patrice, Awaou est mère de six enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Awaou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Awaou n’a pas été à l’école. Pour aider son mari dans les charges de la maison, Awaou vend  des condiments de sauce (tomate, oignons, piment, etc.) de l’huile d’arachide, ainsi que de bois de chauffage à son domicile. Awaou a trente ans d’expérience dans ce domaine. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Awaou s’approvisionne. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. C’est pour développer davantage son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle que Awaou sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un cinquième crédit.
texts.en:
Madame D. was born in 1955 in Agbato in Benin. For 54 years she has lived in the Agbato neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Patrice Dohou and has six children, some of whom attend school. She lives together with her husband and children. Together, the couple manages the family expenses. Madame D. did not go to school. From her home she sells condiments for sauce (tomatoes, onions, peppers etc.), as well as peanut oil and firewood in order to help her husband with the household expenses. She has 30 years' experience in this field. She stocks up in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She is a former client of Kiva Field Partner, ALIDé, and she repays her loans without difficulty. Madame D. is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé in order to further develop her business and better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments for sauce (baskets of tomatoes and peppers), cans of peanut oil and a truckload of firewood

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El señor David Gonzáles vive en casa en anticretico, en la zona  de las Lomas, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y sus tres hijos.
El señor David es empleado en la administración pública de esta ciudad y su esposa realiza transcripciones en una oficina particular, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de una computadora que le permita a su esposa trabajar en su domicilio para así poder cuidar a sus hijos y mantener sus ingresos familiares.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
David Gonzáles lives with his wife and three children in a house under the "anticrético" (Anticretico is a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) modality in the Las Lomas area which is on the hillsides to the east of La Paz. David is a municipal employee and his wife does transcriptions in a private office. Their combined incomes are what supports the family. He is requesting financing to buy a computer so that his wife can work from home and therby be able to care for their children and still earn her income. This is their third loan request and the socioeconomic analysis done on them indicates that they qualify for and can manage this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer so that his wife can work doing transcriptions from home and care for her children at the same time.

loans.name: Biova

texts.en: Mr. A. is a trained electrician. Currently he sells cell phones and accessories. He has been running this business since 2007.  He is single and has no children. This will be Mr. A.’s second loan with WAGES. He will use the loan to expand his supply of cell phones and accessories. Specifically, he plans to purchase several Nokia cell phones, Blue Tooth supplies, cell phone batteries, and chargers. With this loan, Mr. A. will continue to benefit from this increasingly popular market.

loans.use: To purchase cell phones and accessories

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La Sra. Benita, es una cliente que se dedica a la venta de sombreros, mantas y joyas para las señoras de pollera (las Cholitas), es cliente antigua, tiene cuatro hijos varones, quienes ya trabajan independientemente, ella por ahora se encuetra dedicada a la crianza de su pequeño nieto de un año, quien quedo huérfano de madre, es una persona muy trabajadora, ya que desde que se separo del esposo ella controla a sus hijos, quienes trabajan en las movilidades que les dejó el Papá y la que compraron con el trabajo de la Mamá y de ellos, la Sra. Benita es una persona muy responsable y puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Benita sells hats, shawls, and jewelry for the “Cholitas” (women who wear typical regional skirts). She is a long time client. She has four sons who work independently. She also is now raising her small one year old grandson who was left without his mother. She is a hard-working person. Since she separated from her husband, she has been in charge of her sons. They work in the vehicles their father left them and the one they bought through their work and their mother’s work. Benita is a very responsible person who is punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Mohamad Nizar

texts.en: Mohamad Nizar is a 20-year-old single man who lives with his parents and two unemployed brothers. In 2007, he decided to help his father support the family by working as an electrician. Today, Mohamad Nizar is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy additionA. electric tools and equipment in order to expand his business and increase productivity.

loans.use: buy additional electric tools and equipment

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthy S. is 28 years old and lives in Damnak Reachea Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land for cultivating rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chanarak Sen, is a mechanic. However hard this family tries to work in their careers, they do not earn enough income. Thus, in order to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Chanthy S. decided to ask for a loan to start a new business buying groceries to re-sell in the local village. She is the mother of two children who are both too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy groceries to re-sell in the local village

loans.name: Keelin Ibeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Keelin Ibeth M. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de Ropa y calzado nuevo; actividad en la que cuenta con seis años de experiencia.
Doña Keelin, anteriormente se dedicaba a vender su producto se manera ambulante en diferentes colonias de la ciudad de Danlí, pero ahora ella tiene seis meses de estar ubicada en un puesto que alquila en el Bulevar y dice que sus ventas han mejorado.
Cabe mencionar, que donde se encuentra ubicado su negocio, es una de las calles mas transitadas por la población de este municipio, especialmente por las personas de las zonas rurales ya que esta calle es la que conduce al centro de la ciudad.
En la actualidad la Sra. Keelin M., no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir mas su negocio y en especial de todo lo que se necesita para esta época escolar, razón por la cual nos esta solicitando el credito.
texts.en:
Señora Keelin Ibeth M. is dedicated to commerce and her main activity is the sale of clothes and new footwear, an activity in which she has six years of experience. Señora Keelin was previously dedicated to selling her product on foot in different colonies of the city of Danlí, but now she is located in a stall that she has rented on the Boulevard for six months and she says that her sales have improved. It should be mentioned that the location where her business is found is one of the streets that is most traveled by the population of this municipality, especially by the people of the rural zones, since this street is the one that leads to the center of the city. Currently Señora Keelin M. does not have sufficient working capital to supply her business with more merchandise, especially everything that is needed for this school term, which is the reason she is requesting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and shoes for resale, especially for the new school term

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice O. is 49 years old, married, and has 6 children - 4 boys and 2 girls - who all excel in school. Eunice's husband is a civil servant and also helps with the household work. Eunice herself is a trader, selling foodstuffs like garri (cassava flakes), beans, cooking oil, and fish at retail prices as well as drinks at both retail and wholesale prices. Eunice hopes to see her business expand so that she can support her husband in covering the family's expenses. To this end, Eunice hopes to obtain a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase additional foodstuffs and drinks for sale. She is thankful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Favour

texts.en:
Favour is business a woman who sells groceries and drinks at retail prices.  She has been in business for four years. She hopes to improve and expansion her business.

She is requesting the sum of NGN 100,000 as a loan to purchase more groceries, food stuff and drinks to sell. This will attract more customers, reduce costs per item on the wholesale level and increase her profits. 

Favour, 43, is hard worker, married with 2 children.  They are 15 and 17 years old.  She hopes to support their education. They live in Lagos State, Nigeria.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries, food stuff and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Monzer

texts.en:
Monzer is a 28-year-old married man. He's owned a phone sales shop in his town since 2007. His wife helps him manage the household with her work income. He buys all models of mobile phones in addition to buying rechargeable cards. This couple is like the majority of Lebanese couples – they work hard and they collaborate to have a good life and to raise a family.  

Today, Monzer is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy additional rechargeable cards and the latest collections of mobile phones to increase his sales during the summer season. His region is known for its tourist trade and he needs to be ready.

loans.use: To buy additional rechargeable cards and the latest collections of mobile phones

loans.name: Huguette Aurore

texts.fr: S. Huguette Aurore est née le 24 Octobre 1973 et est mariée à HOUNTONDJI Josée Jules, un technicien. Le couple a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille s'est installée depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Vêdoko à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Huguette Aurore assure avec son mari les différentes charges familiales. Huguette Aurore n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Depuis sept ans, Huguette Aurore mène comme activité la vente de produits divers (lait, papier hygiénique, savons, conserves de tomates, eau de javel, etc.). Parallèlement à cette activité, Huguette Aurore vend également des boissons et de la glace à son domicile. Huguette Aurore est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui effectue bien ses remboursements. Dans l'optique d'agrandir son activité et pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Huguette Aurore sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Huguette Aurore S. was born on 24 October 1973 and is married to Josée Jules HOUNTONDJI, a technician. The couple has three children who all attend school. The family settled down ten years ago in the Vêdoko district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Huguette Aurore shares responsibility with her husband for the various family expenses. She went to primary school only. For the past seven years she has had an activity selling various products (milk, toilet paper, soaps, tinned tomatoes, bleach, etc.) At the same time Huguette Aurore sells drinks and ice-cream from her home. She is an old customer of ALIDé who makes her repayments on time. With the aim of expanding her activity and in order to satisfy customer demand more readily, she is requesting another loan.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drinks and various products

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma , de 29 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos.Ella reside en una comunidad ubicada en la selva cuzqueña, donde tiene su casa que es propia.Siempre se caracterizó porque quería  salir adelante, recuerda que desde hace 12 años se dedica a la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo de cacao . Por factores externos no le fue bien, como deseaba. Además se había descuidado en sus estudios, y por un momento pensó en dejar todo, pero el apoyo de sus padres fue fundamental. En la actualidad tiene su propio restaurante,y tiene muy buenas ganancias económicas .Trabaja junto con su esposo , y su negocio ya tiene casi 3 años funcionando . El dia de Vilma empieza desde muy temprano y junto con su esposo preparan los pendientes, y de esa manera satisface  las necesidades de sus comensales, además cuenta con  un ayudante que brinda una buena atención al público . Su plan a futuro es volver a incursionar en la actividad agrícola, para obtener mayores ganancias.Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y  se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus cuotas puntualmente , además está conforme por la buena organización  de su banco comunal.Vilma tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de  víveres de todo tipo, con el propósito de cubrir las necesidades de sus comensales.
texts.en:
Vilma is 29 years old and has three children. She lives in a community located within the “Cuzqueña” jungle, where she has her own home. She has always wanted to get ahead and recalls that she had been dedicated to agriculture, specifically to raising cacao, for the past 12 years. Because of circumstances beyond her control, things did not go as well as she had hoped. She had also not paid attention to her studies and for a time thought about giving up altogether. But her parents’ support was important. Now she has her own restaurant and a good income. She works alongside her husband and she has been in business for nearly three years. She and her husband begin working very early to complete their tasks so they are able to meet their requirements. They also have a helper who provides good customer service. In the future she would like to return to farming in order to increase her earnings. This will be her second loan through MFP and she is committed to continuing to make her payments on time. She is also happy with her communal bank’s organization. Vilma will use the money from this loan to buy supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married women with five children, 3 girls and 2 boys. They all go to school. She has been in her business for the past 12 years. Her previous occupation was selling vegetables. Her other sources of incomes are the grocery, mobile charging, and she also owns rental houses. She sells her products to neighbours.

Constance faces the challenges of high competition since many people have ventured into the same business. Her aspiration is to build a small well to get more water. She decided to join Yehu after obtaining business training skills offered by the Yehu staff to prospective clients. Constance has electricity and piped water in her house. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: G.s Piedra Viva Group

texts.es: La señora Maria del Carmen tiene 62 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, los cuales todos son mayores de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo.  Otro integrante de este grupo es don Néstor Javier tiene 40 años de edad, El señor obtiene ingresos de la venta de frutas, las cuales vende en el mercado oriental. El señor solicito este crédito con el propósito de invertirlo en la compra de cosecha de naranjas y aguacates, que es lo que se está vendiendo mas ahora .El último integrante de este grupo es don Javier, tiene 25 años de edad, es casado y tiene una hija de seis meses de edad. El señor se dedica a la compra y venta de cosechas, las cuales vende en el mercado desde hace 14 años que se dedica a esta actividad pues juntos se han unido para fortalecer sus negocios.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen is 62, married and has 5 children, all of whom are grown. She sells pig meat. Another group member is Nestor Javier, age 40. He makes his living from selling fruits, which he sells in the eastern market. He is requesting this loan with the intention of investing it in the purchase of a crop of oranges and avocados, which is what he sells the most at the moment. The final member of the group is Javier, 25, who is married and has a 6-month-old daughter. He buys and sells crops in the market. He has done this for 14 years. They joined together to strengthen their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working cpaital

loans.name: Juan Cancio

texts.es:
Al visitar al banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca” entrevistamos al señor Juan Cancio. Las reunionés del banco comunal se hacen cada treinta días en la comunidad de Rumichaca en la casa del socio Paulino. La ciudad de Rumichaca se encuentra ubicada a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco, como quien va hacia las ruinas Incas de Ollantaytambo.
    
El socio Juan Cancio, tiene 42 años, es divorciado, tiene tres hijos y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Su actividad económica de Juan Cancio es la fabricación de muebles de metal como por ejemplo sillas, puertas, ventanas y muchas cosas más. Ya son varios años que Juan Cancio se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien, el requiere el préstamo para comprar una maquinaria.

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
During a visit with the Communal Bank “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca” (New Vision of Rumichaca), staff members from Asociación Arariwa had the chance to interview Sr. Juan Cancio, one of its members. The Communal Bank meetings are held every thirty days in the community of Rumichaca at the house of Paulino, one of the other members. The city of Rumichaca is located an hour and ten minutes away from the city of Cusco, which is where one can find the Incan ruins of Ollantaytambo.

Juan Cancio is 42 years old, divorced, and has three children. He lives in the community of Rumichaca in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco. Juan Cancio manufactures furniture pieces made of metal such as chairs, doors, window frames, and many other items. He has worked several years in this business and has done very well. Juan Cancio needs a loan to buy machinery.

Juan Cancio is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided. Therefore, he promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase machinery

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Mr. Ry O. 53 years old and she is a villager who lives in Trapeang Tonle village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Nin Noun, are farmers who own 1.60-hectares of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farmers, they are also having a rice mill machine at home for hire to the villager for the profit and they are also rice wine maker at home. With their occupations, they are able to earn a small income to hold up their family. In order to increase income to improve the family living, Mr. Ry O. decided to ask for a loan to buy seven piglets for breeding and pig food. This couple has four children, one is a staff of MFI and the other three are students in the local school and also support their parent businesses.

loans.use: To buy seven piglets for breeding and pig food.

loans.name: Serekbai

texts.en: Serekbai S. is a 40 year old widow who lives with her five children in Bayan-Ulgiy province, in western Mongolia in their own ger-a traditional nomadic housing tent. Her elder two children are students while the younger three children attend a local middle school. Serekbai currently operates a meat retailing business in her town. She began her business in 1994 and has gained much experience. In 2008, her husband passed away so she was left to raise her children alone. Serekbai is a very hardworking woman who has a great business mind. She is optimistic about the future and has been making plans to expand her business. She says, "My only wish is to raise healthy children and to help them become well educated, good people in the future". Serekbai is requesting a 750,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her meat retailing business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice O. is 47 years old and is married to Rosemary Auma and they have four children who are all school-going and are under 18 years of age. They live in a rural area called Ngiya. 

Maurice is a farmer and normally sells his farm produce to earn a living. He is applying for a loan from Kadet Ltd to buy “My Sunshine Box” which will help him in lighting his home. Jacob’s children use lanterns for lighting and this is too cumbersome for them. They struggle a lot when doing their homework at night. Jacob has serviced a loan before with Kadet Ltd and he paid it well without any difficulties.

He hopes and waits for the day when electricity will be installed in his rural home.

loans.use: To buy "My Sunshine Box"

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane P. is from the village of Brgy. Lactawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 27 years old. Mary Jane is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Mary Jane operates a family member's specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling clothing & shoe products in the local community. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2007, Mary Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand the business's product offerings. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Mary Jane from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisher-folk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette G. is a married woman who lives in Purok Paho, Barangay Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, fishing, and food-vending. Her husband, Nestor G., who is 47 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living. They have four children who are from 8 to 18 years old, with their oldest child already working and helping support the education of her three brothers.

Janette joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, uplifting her family's standard of living.

This time, for her 6th loan, Janette is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save for the future education of her children.

Janette is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.


About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Mary Njeri

texts.en:
Mary Njeri is 48 years-old and a green grocer business lady. She is married to David, a businessman. They have two children aged 15 and 13 years-old. Mary has been operating a green grocery business for the past year and her monthly income is Kshs. 25,000. She uses her income to support four members of her family.

With the loan she has applied for, Mary plans to increase the stock of her business through purchasing one bag of tomatoes, a half bag of onions, carrots and other type of vegetables. Mary intends to save the profit expected from the business and hopes to eventually operate a large well known grocery shop in Matuu village.

loans.use: To buy onions, tomatoes and other vegetables.

loans.name: Tiburcia

texts.es:
Tiburcia tiene 41 años y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Tiburcia vive en la ciudad Andahuaylillas provincia de Quispicanchis del Departamento del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de Justina es la venta de carne y choclo. 
 
Tiburcia desde hace mucho tiempo participa en el banco comunal “La Triunfadoras”. Con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 2000 soles, ella invertirá en comprar carne y choclo.   

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Tiburcia is 41 years old and has two children. At present, Tiburcia lives in the city of Andahuaylillas province of Quispicanchis in Cusco department. Tiburcia works selling meat and corn.

Tiburcia for a long time has been a part of “La Triunfadoras” (The Winners) communal bank. With her next loan of S/. 2000 soles she will buy meat and corn.

The member is thankful for the opportunity given to her through this medium and is committed to meet the payments on their due dates.

loans.use: To buy meat and corn.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Originally from Vietnam, Anh moved to the United States with her husband 18 years ago.  After working for years in nail salons throughout northern California, Anh made a bold decision to pursue her dream and became her own boss. Anna Kim Chi Beauty Salon has now been in business in downtown Redwood City, California for six years.  

Her parents doubted her decision to go into business for herself. “My mother and father were worried and tried to convince me to give this up. I’m glad I didn’t listen. I was confident and determined to make my salon a success. The more effort you put in, and the braver you are in your life, the more success you will have.”

In addition to haircuts, Anh’s salon also provides nails, waxing, and skin-care services. Her salon attracts foot traffic from around the neighborhood, and with her low priced quality services, customers keep coming back. It’s a simple formula, explains Anh. “Good haircuts, good service, and low prices!” On a recent day, Anh proudly wore her “I Voted” sticker from the November 2nd elections as she cut her client’s hair and she proudly boasts, “This country has been so good for my family. I love to vote!”

When Anh needed financing to make improvements to her salon, she turned to Opportunity Fund - her local microfinance institution (MFI) - for a small business loan.  Anh learned about Opportunity Fund years ago when her eldest daughter opened a savings account through the non-profit MFI. With a $3,500 loan she will be able to make electrical renovations and bring her salon into compliance with fire codes.  Anh is also excited to have the chance to use a microloan to build her credit.  “I don’t need a lot of money at once, so this is very good. Then, once Opportunity Fund knows me and that I can repay, I’ll be able to get another loan to help with a bigger remodeling job.”

loans.use: Electrical renovations to bring the salon into compliance with fire codes; build business credit

loans.name: Xiomara Deyanira

texts.es: Xiomara Deyanira tiene 30 años, está felizmente casada. El matrimonio tiene 1 hijo, tiene muchas energías para mantener este negocio activo que todos los días es visitado por una gran variedad de clientes ya que su negocio está en su vivienda y de manera ambulante. Se inicio con la venta de mercaderías varias como bolsos, calzado y perfumes. Pues poco a poco fue que invirtió el dinero y sacando mayor utilidad del mismo. 	Xiomara solicita el crédito para comprar de más mercaderías, ya que tiene una gran cantidad de pedidos de ropa por lo que se acerca la temporada navideña. Como sueño personal quiere seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en: Xiomara Deyanira is 30 years old and is happily married. The couple has one son.  She has a lot of energy for keeping this active business that is visited daily by a variety of clients.  The business is in her home and she also sells on the streets. She began by selling various merchandise such as handbags, shoes and perfumes. Then little by little she invested the money, making better use of it. Xiomara is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise, as she has a lot of clothing orders as the holiday season approaches. As a personal dream, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yaser

texts.ar:
ياسر في عمر 28 سنة يعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية اعزب له في عمله 5 سنوات ياسر طموح يحب عمله
يرغب في تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي له ولعائلته يلقى دائما الدعم من العائلة والمحيط الاجتماعي يريد من خلال طلب قرض من
المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة للمحل مواد غذائية وحبوب وسكاكر انه يعاني من منافسة شديدة في محيطه العملي
texts.en: Yaser is a 28-year-old single man who is very impassioned about his work and who wants to improve his financial situation and that of his loving family. Yaser has been working at a market for the past five years and is now seeking a loan from Al Majmoua to buy food items to sell such as candy and grain products for his store in order to be able to stay afloat against tough competition.

loans.use: Purchase foodwares for shop

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Azucena Hernández C. vivr en la comunidad de Tlayecac, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, Ella tiene 19 años de edad, estudio hasta la preparatoria tiene su certificado, ella es casada tiene 1 hijo se llama Bernardo Israel y tiene 1 año de edad. Ella y su esposo tienen un taller de hojalatería y ella solicitó su préstamo para aumentar el negocio, van a comprar pintura, tinner, aceite, primer, lijas, estopa. Los productos que ofrecen son pintura de autos, arreglo golpes, etc., además de eso también venden miel, jalea real, piloncillo. Su negocio se llama "taller de hojalatería las mieles", su negocio lo inicio hace 5 años el negocio de la miel y hace 4 años el taller de hojalatería, el negocio es de familia, sus papás le enseñaron a trabajar el negocio de la miel y la jalea real, su negocio es una herencia de sus papás. 
Para ella y su familia es muy importante su negocio porque tiene ingresos y es su fuente de trabajo, la parte favorita de trabajar su negocio es vender miel y arreglar las canastas las decora le pone encaje, ella está orgullosa porque le enseñan a trabajar más para superarse, en tiempo de vacaciones en el mes de abril y diciembre es cuando más se vende sus clientes son los turista, ya que su negocio está a la orilla de la carretera y los turistas se detienen a comprar los productos de la miel, los desafíos que enfrenta el negocio son el clima, ya que en tiempos de lluvias no se puede sacar la mercancía porque se moja.  Las ganancias las utiliza para volver a invertir. Su negocio le ha ayudado a que ya no sea empleada, sino que tenga su propio negocio y así puede cuidar a su hijo, sus sueños son tener su casa propia por que vive con sus papás, tener un taller de costura propio y tener una economía estable y este préstamo le va a ayudar a agranda y crecer en su negocio, ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundacion Realidad “gracias por darnos la oportunidad de crecer en los negocios.” Tlayecac es un lugar muy tranquilo de clima caluroso.
texts.en:
Azucena Hernández C. lives in the community of Tlayecac, Ayala in the state of Morelos, Mexico.  She is 19 years old, and has a high school degree.  She is married and has a son named Bernardo Israel who is 1 years old.  She and her husband have an auto body and requests a loan to increase her business.  She will buy paint, thinner, oil, primer, sandpaper.  She offers services of auto painting, fixing dents, etc.  In addition, she also sells honey, royal jelly (dietary supplement made from bees) and brown sugar.  Her business is called "The Honey Auto Body Shop."  She started this business 5 years ago, and she started selling honey in her body shop 4 years ago.  Her business is a family business; her parents taught her the honey  and royal jelly business, and she inherited the business from them.  

Her favorite part of the work is selling honey and decorating the containers with lace that she puts on them.  She is proud because she was taught to work hard to succeed.  She sells the most during the vacation periods of April and December. Her customers are tourists, since her business is at the side of a highway and the tourists stop to buy the honey products.  The challenge she faces with her business is the climate, since during the rainy season she cannot get the merchandise because it gets wet. She will use her earnings to invest in the business.  Her business has helped her, because she is not employed, but has her own business and in this way is able to support her son.  She dreams of having her own home because she lives with her parents, and she dreams of having her own dressmaking workshop so that she could have stable finances.  This loan will help her to enlarge and grow her business.  She wants to say to Kiva and to the Fundacion Realidad "thanks for giving us the opportunity to grow our businesses."  Tlayecac is a very tranquil place with a warm climate.

loans.use: to buy paint, thinner, oil, and sandpaper for her autobody shop

loans.name: Lam's Group

texts.en:
Anlong Slat village, Kandal province, is the location of this four member group loan, led by Mrs. Lam P.. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living conditions. 

Mrs. Lam P. is a white wine maker and pig breeder who is able to earn some money to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. Mrs. Lam P. is, therefore, applying for a loan to buy more rice for making white wine. She will use the rest of the loan to buy more pig food. 

Her husband, Mr. Sung Toem, is a farmer who owns 2-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support his family. He is also a fisherman. Through these activities, they support four children, two of whom are attending the local public school, while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more rice for making white wine

loans.name: Los Amigos Victoriosos Group

texts.es:
el grupo Los Amigos Victoriosos lo integran 5 personas y todos residentes de la aldea Agua Fria en el sector de Nacaome, Valle. a continuacion se detalla lo que ellos relizan para ganarse la vida diariamente:
La joven Sandra Lizeth A. se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y venta de tortillas, la señora Leonarda García se dedica a la venta de cuajada, queso y leche, tiene su ganando del cual saca la leche para fabricar sus productos.
el sr. Lazaro Antonio D. y el sr. Jose David E. se dedican a la fabricacion de ladrillos, producen en cantidades grandes para vender al por mayor.
el sr. Jose Santos M. se dedica a la venta de rosquillas, quesadillas y queso 
Todos ellos son personas muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, sus negocios son muy conocidos por los pobladores del sector y de los lugares vecinos.
el credito lo utilizaran para la compra de fardos de ropa usada, tierra, arena, leña, queso, pastillas de cuajo, cal, agua, manteca, maiz, queso. 

el sr. Lazaro y Jose E. necesitan reparar el horno en donde hacen la produccion de ladrillos.

el mayor anhelo de todos es que sus negocios crezcan mas y que puedan aperturar nuevos mercados.

las ganancias las necesitan para salir adelante con sus familias.
texts.en:
The Los Amigos Victoriosos ["The Victorious Friends"] group is made up of five people, all residents of the Agua Fria hamlet in the Nacaome, Valle sector. The following is a description of what they do to earn their daily bread:

Young Sandra Lizeth A. sells used clothing and tortillas. Mrs. Leonarda G. sells curds, cheese and milk. She has livestock and gets her milk from these animals to make her products.

Mr. Lazaro Antonio D. and Mr. Jose David E. make bricks, producing large quantities to be sold wholesale.
Mr. Jose Santos M. sells doughnuts, quesadillas and cheese.

They are all very hard-working people. Their business are very well-known by the people in their sector and in the neighbouring areas.
They will use this loan for the purchase of bundles of used clothing, earth, sand, firewood, cheese, rennet tablets, lime, water, butter, corn and cheese.

Mr. Lazaro and Jose E. need to repair the oven where they make the bricks.

The greatest wish of each group member is for their businesses to grow more, and to be able to enter into new markets.

They need their income in order to get their families ahead.

loans.use: the purchase of soil, sand, firewood, used clothing, cheese, rennet tablets,  lime, water, butter, corn, and cheese.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El Sr. Mario F. es de Carapeguá, compañía Tajy Loma, tiene 44 años, vive en pareja, cuenta con casa propia y tiene 5 hijos.
El Sr. Mario se dedica al comercio ambulante de ropa (macatero) hace más de 10 años; aprendió este trabajo con sus padres ya que ellos se dedicaban al mismo trabajo.
Fue así que se independizó y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia. Hoy día cuenta con más de 45 clientes activos y gracias a eso cuenta con un ingreso bastante bueno para su familia.
Comercializa sus productos por la zona de Gran Asunción.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de más mercaderías viendo la demanda existente de su clientela.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario F. is from Carapeguá, the company of Tajy Loma.  He is 44 years old, owns his own home, has a live-in partner and five children.

Mr. Mario has been a door-to-door clothing salesman for over ten years.  He learned his trade from his parents who ran the same business.

Through his work he was able become independent and have his own income.  Today he has over 45 active customers and is able to provide a decent living for his family.

He sells his products in the Gran Asunción area.  He plans to use the loan to buy more merchandise because of the increasing orders he is receiving from customers.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, shorts, jeans, pants, shirts, towels, etc.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 53 years old, married and has four children. 

Mohamad grew up in a family which owns a farm. In 2002, he established his own cattle farm. He has an excellent reputation in his area.

Mohamad is requesting $2400 loan to renovate the cowshed and buy a cow. He is planning to extend his business and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate the cowshed and buy a cow

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is a forty-eight-year-old married woman with four children living in her own house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been operating a retail shop for three years. She started with a capital of 500,000 UGX and now has working capital of 1,800,000 UGX. Her hardship is bad debtors. Her vision for the future is to run a wholesale business and have a well educated family.  Rehema needs the loan to renovate her shop.

loans.use: Renovation of her shop

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily G. is from Malaubang Ozamiz City. She is 47 years old. Lily is widowed and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Lily plants and harvests flowers for sale. Lily has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lily joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  Lily is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase flower pots and new varieties of flowers to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Lily from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase flower pots and new varieties of flowers to sell

loans.name: Wilner Jesus

texts.es:
Wilner tiene 21 años de edad y nació en la comunidad de Cotowincho. Actualmente, Wilner vive en la comunidad donde nació. Wilder trabaja como albañil de forma independiente, él trabajó con su padre desde muy joven en la construcción ayudándole y ahora que es mayor de edad trabaja por su propia cuenta. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este oficio y le va muy bien. Wilder en esta oportunidad requiere el micro crédito para comprar una maquina llamada amoladora y algunas herramientas como por ejemplo martillos, serruchos y otras cosa más. 

Wilner pertenece al banco comunal “Kuska Llankasun de Rumichaca” de la Asociación Arariwa  y trabaja con sus compañeras del banco comunal desde hace varios años. (La comunidad Cotowincho se encuentra ubicada a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Urubamba donde los socios se reúnen cada treinta días para realizar sus actividades correspondientes.)
texts.en:
Wilner is 21 years old and was born in the community of Cotowincho. He currently lives in the community where he was born. 

Wilner works as a freelance construction worker. From a very young age, he helped his father with construction work, and now that he is an adult he works for himself. He has been doing this type of work for 15 years now, and it is going very well for him. Wilner needs this microloan to buy a machine called a grinder and some tools like hammers, saws and some other things.

Wilner belongs to the “Kuska Llankasun de Rumichaca” communal bank of Asociación Arariwa and has worked with his fellow bank members for several years. (The community of Cotowincho is located 10 minutes from the city of Urubamba where the members meet every 30 days to carry out their banking activities.)

loans.use: to buy a machine called a grinder and some tools such as hammers, saws and some other things.

loans.name: Mercidia

texts.es: La señora Mercidia tiene 59 años su estado tiene 6 hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad. Su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general, el cual lo inicio como una forma de vida para sufragar, después con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio pudo establecerse ella sola y salía a vender en diferentes lugares para ofrecer. Actualmente ya tiene 26 años de trabajar sola, pues la mayoría de sus clientes siempre les ofrece una gran variedad de productos. Ella solicita este préstamo con el único objetivo de invertirlo en el negocio y comprar perfumes, cosméticos, colonias, cremas, polvos, ropa en general entre otros productos. Su sueño es que Dios le brinde salud para seguir trabajando y de esta manera ganarse el pan de cada día, además de esto desea realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señora Mercidia is 59 years of age and has six grown children. Her business is the sale of general merchandise which she began as a means of covering her expenses. Eventually with much effort and sacrifice she was able to establish herself on her own and would go out to offer her products in various places. Currently she has been working on her own for 26 years as she generally offers her customers a wide variety of merchandise. 

She is seeking this loan with the sole objective of investing it in her business and buying perfumes, cosmetics, colognes, creams, powders, clothing in general and other products. Her dream is that God will grant her good health in order to keep on working and by these means earn her daily bread. In addition she would like to make some improvements to her living quarters.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, cosmetics, colognes, creams, powders, clothing in general and other products.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Maria Eugenia de 55 años, es una mujer trabajadora que inicio su actividad hace 6 años. Ella trabaja en su negocio desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, ya que la mayoría de sus clientes saben muy bien la atención tan esmerada que ofrece, se siente agradecida por como su negocio ha progresado notablemente a su edad, siente que este negocio le ha brindado una gran ayuda. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar granos básicos, sopas, enlatados, detergentes, pan, refrescos, jugos y leche. Lo que más anhela es tener su negocio más grande y terminar su vivienda para darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Maria is a 55-year-old hard-working woman who started her business about six years ago. She works at her store from 6 a.m. until 9 p.m., and most of her customers are very aware of the painstaking attention she provides. She is grateful for how noticeably her business has progressed at her age and feels that it has provided her with a lot of help. With the loan, she plans to purchase basic grains, soups, canned goods, detergents, bread, soft drinks, juices and milk. Her biggest goal is to have a bigger store and to finish her home in order to provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, soups, canned goods, detergents, bread, soft drinks, juices and milk.

loans.name: Cristo La Solucion 1, 5 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Sonia is the coordinator of her group, Cristo L. Solucion (Christ the Soluction)1, 5 & 7. Her group is located in the areas surrounding L. Romana, an area economically dominated by the sugarcane harvest. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their 7 children.

Sonia is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She runs a beauty salon and a miscellaneous store. She will buy some products, such as beauty and cosmetic products, clothes, accessories and many other items for both economic activities. She will use the profits to save and reinvest in her business.

She said that her most difficult challenge has been to start her business, after she had learned how to work as a beautician. Her dream is to have an improved general store. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, cosmetics, clothes, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to convert his taxi to run on natural gas instead of gasoline

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a thirty year old married man with two children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is the sole bread winner of the family and his desire is to educate his children up to the university level. He has been running a restaurant for four years after saving money from motorcycle riding. He has challenges of high labour turnover and his desire is to employe skilled waitresses. Julius needs the money to buy land and build a hotel.

loans.use: To buy land to build a hotel

loans.name: Nasil

texts.en: Nasil has two children, one of whom attends school. She owns a restaurant in which she sells different kinds of foodstuffs. She has done this for three months. She has used the income to feed her family. She is requesting a loan to buy plates, saucepans, and charcoal stoves. With the profits she plans to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase utensils.

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.ru:
Василий женат, у него 11-летняя дочь и годовалый сын. Василий живет и работает в Ивано-Франковске. Он занимается пассажирскими перевозками по Украине. Василий – бывший военный. После сокращения военного штата Василий начал работать в такси. Он предоставляет свои услуги уже на протяжении 12 лет. Его ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 гривен.  

Этот бизнес – основной источник дохода для семьи заемщика. Василий собирается использовать 11,000 гривен на капитальный ремонт кузова авто и полную его покраску. Это поможет подготовить его автомобиль к дальнейшей работе на длительный период времени. Более того, Василий надеется обустроить квартиру, в которой живет вместе с семьей. Совсем недавно у него родился второй ребенок.  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
