Her husband, Rodrigo C., who is 52 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have nine children who are 11 to  29 years old. 

Marrieta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marrieta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 14,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $214, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 7th cycle loan, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy feed for the pigs and inventory for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Marrieta C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu K., age 52, established a business in 2000 selling gara lappers, bedding, and other such items. She began her business to increase her income, raise her profit, and improve her family's standard of living. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

She would like to obtain a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to add more stock and to buy raw materials for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Kadiatu K. plans to establish a savings account and educate her children to university level. She also wants to use part of her profit to support her husband, with whom she has six children, aged 10, 15, 17, 20, 23, and 25. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because she educates her.

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add more stock and to buy more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 77 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposa Yolanda de 64 años; y juntos buscan para salir adelante. Desde hace 15 años, este emprendedor hombre se dedica a la atención en su puesto  de comestibles, que tiene en el  mercado de su zona. Esta muy satisfecho pues el negocio es tranquilo y lo desempeña con la ayuda de su esposa; quien atiende cuando él debe salir; además las ganancias son regulares. Manifiesta que esta labor le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos; y ahora que ellos tienen sus propias familias; su esposa y él pasan sus días trabajando y entreteniéndose en el negocio de venta de comestibles. Esta muy contento pues el tiempo que tiene en el mercado le ha permitido ganar buenos clientes que lo prefieren por la frescura y buenos precios de sus productos. Como es muy trabajador para el futuro tiene planeado aumentar la cantidad de mercadería que ofrece y de esta manera continuar adelante. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. José tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de mercadería que necesita para surtir mejor su negocio y de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en: Jose, 77, lives in a home he owns with his wife Yolanda who is 64, together they hope to get ahead. 15 years ago this entrepreneur started working in his grocery store, located in the market of the area.  He is happy because it's a steady business and his wife helps him with it when he has to be out, the income is steady.  This business has allowed him to get his children ahead, and now they have their own families, he and his wife spend the day working at the business of grocery sales.  He is very happy because the time he has been at the market has allowed him to make good clients that prefer his products for their freshness and good prices.  He is very hardworking and plans to increase the amount of merchandise offered to continue ahead.  This is the third loan with MFP and he promises to make his payments punctually because he doesn't want to disappoint the people that made possible this loan that will allow him to continue working in search of progress.  Jose plans to invest the loan in buying M. merchandise to stock the business.

loans.use: Buy several products to stock his store.

loans.name: El Gran Esfuerzo 3, 5 Group

texts.en:
Yanet P. is one of the members of the El gran esfuerzo ("the great effort") 3 & 5 Group located in the city of Hato Mayor, a primarily agricultural region. It is one of the most rural cities in the Dominican Republic where there are often drinking water and electricity shortages. The population of this area is comprised of Dominicans and Haitian immigrants. She operates a little underwear store.

Yanet is a single mom of one child and she lives with her parents. She tells us that her biggest challenge is to have her own house. Her favorite activity is tending to her business and work.

Yanet is very excited to receive her fourth loan through Esperanza Internacional, after having successfully repaid her previous loan. This was a step toward making her business grow. She has had her business for about two years. She started with a small amount of savings she had. She plans to invest this new loan into purchasing various types of underwear. She plans to use her profits to invest in her business and save to build her house and buy a car as soon as her business improves. Her dream is to have a house and to live quietly in it with her family.

loans.use: To buy more underwear to sell

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun S. is 37 years old.  Her husband, Mr. Ay Norng, is 47 years old (pictured together).  They have been married since 1991 and have four children – three sons and one daughter, two have full-time employment and other two are in school. They are living living along National Road Number 1, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. 

Savoeun has been operating a laundry business at her home for three years. Her husband has been a construction worker for two years. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her children to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children to get to work

loans.name: René

texts.es:
El señor René M. K., trabaja como colector de impuesto, cobrándoles a los comerciantes del Mercado Oriental de Managua desde hace 3 años.
Es casado con 3 personas a su cargo que dependen de él lleva 4 crédito en CEPRODEL los que ha pagado en tiempo y forma, este crédito lo solicita para los gastos de medicina de una hija que tiene 26 años de edad y padece de Leucemia y otra hija que tiene Diabetes, ambas tienen que tomar medicamentos costosos y alimentos especiales permanentemente, y por otro lado tiene incurrir en gastos de colegiatura para el período 2011.
texts.en:
Mr. René M. K. has worked as a tax collector at the Eastern Market of Mangua for three years.

He is married with three dependents, and he has had four loans from CEPRODEL which he has paid on time and in full. He will use this loans to cover medical expenses for two of his daughters. One daughter, 26, has Lukemia and another suffers from diabetes. They both require expensive medicine to treat their illnesses as well as special diets. Additionally, Mr. M. K. must pay high school enrollment fees for the 2011 school year for his dependents.

loans.use: Medical expenses and school fees

loans.name: Maria Delia

texts.es: Maria Delia tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos y solamente uno está a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de repostería. La ubicación es en su casa de habitación, por lo que sus inicios fueron con muy pocos productos y poco a poco fue que comenzó a cocinar y así fue que obtuvo este medio de vida. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de huevos, harina, mantequilla, queso entre otras cosas necesarias para la elaboración. Ella sueña con mantener siempre su negocio y obteniendo más clientes.
texts.en: Maria Delia is 43 years old.  She is a single mother and has 2 children, only one of whom is still in her care.  Her business is baking and selling pastries and desserts from her home.  When she started out, she had very few products but she gradually started baking and settled in this line of business.  She will use her loan to buy eggs, flour, butter, cheese and other supplies that she needs to make her products.  She dreams of always having her business and attracting more customers.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 58-year-old married man and the father of two school-aged children. He is from Lebanon. He has worked in a local food company since 2002. He cooperates with his wife who owns an accessories shop to satisfy the family needs.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay for his children's education. In that way, he will avoid facing financial problems with the school management and permit his children to pursue their education peacefully.

loans.use: to pay for his children's education

loans.name: Conny Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Conny Isabel D. L. ella es trabajadora activa de la entidad estatal, desempeñándose como Técnico en Laboratorio  tiene Veinte y un   años  de trabajar para esta institución  es casada actualmente, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  siete créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Conny Isabel D. L. is currently employed by a state agency as a lab technician. She has been working for this institution for 21 years. Conny is married and currently has two children in school.

She has received seven loans from CEPRODEL and each one was used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks and other items to expand and improve her home. The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit because they have enabled her to improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for home improvements

loans.name: Doan's Group

texts.en:
Doan T. C. is 48 years old with three children who are in high school.  Growing up in Tam Giang commune where rice growing culture is very popular, she has a lot of experience in doing farming especially in growing rice and tomatoes. Every year, she can  get 8 millions VND profit from selling these agricultural products. Her  business has  strongly developed since she  began having loans from our  credit program  in 2008. Her loan size has gotten bigger over the years. Now she wants to have  a loan  of 7,392,000 VND to buy five more pigs to raise

 Pha T. N.  is  a 34-year-old farmer. She has run VAC form  which is a mixed farming activity including growing rice, raising chickens, catching fish and has made considerable profit  for many years. She wants to borrow  7,392,000 VND to buy  feed for chickens.

 De T. N. is 28 years old. She is raising  12 pigs for meat. She needs to have  a loan of 7,392,000 VND to improve her pigpen.

 Be T. N. is 44 years old. She also is raising 10 pigs for meat. She wants to  borrow 6,496,000 VND to buy  feed for them.

 Gia T. N. is 48 year old. She is growing corn and vegetables in a paddy of 3,600 square meters. She needs to have a loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy five more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda nació en el departamento del Cusco y tiene 28 años de edad. Actualmente,  Nilda vive en la ciudad imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú), ella es una madre responsable que se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella nos cuenta que viaja a la ciudad de desaguadero para comprar ropa y después en la ciudad del cusco distribuye su ropa a la vendedoras de diferentes mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo ropa para  niños, damas y caballeros. 

Nilda es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Ana Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Nilda was born in the department of Cusco and is 28 years old. Currently, Nilda lives in the Imperial City of the Incas (Cusco, Peru). She is a responsible mother who works selling clothing. She says that she travels to the city of Desaguadero to buy merchandise and then to the city of Cusco to distribute her clothing to different merchants across Cusco's various markets.

At this time, Nilda needs a loan to increase her business' capital. She would like to buy more merchandise, such as clothing for men, women, and children.

Nilda is a responsible person who belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "Ana Jarvis III" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, such as clothing for men, women, and children

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es: El sr. José, vive la zona de Molle Molle, vive en casa propia, su esposa tiene una tienda de barrio donde ofrece variedad de productos es una tienda muy surtida, tienen 4 hijos que están en el colegio, el sr. José es muy conocido en su trabajo el es transportista de una  línea de minibús de sacaba,  trabaja de lunes a sábado los domingos se dedica a su familia, es una familia muy trabajadora y muy unida, el préstamo lo destinara para el tapizado de asientos de su minibús , ya e están muy gastados y hará el cambio de todos los asientos, el deseo del Sr. José es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales,   esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
José lives in his own home in Molle Molle district.  His wife has a neighborhood store where she sells a variety of products.  It is a very well-stocked store.  They have four children who are all in school.  José is very well known in his work.  He is a driver on a Sacaba minibus line.  He works from Monday to Saturday and devotes Sundays to his family.  His is a very hard-working and united family.  

José will use his loan to upholster the seats in his minibus since they are very worn.  He will change all the seats.  José's wish is to see his children become professionals.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support they have given him.

loans.use: to upholster the seats in his minibus

loans.name: Bonifacia Teodolinda

texts.es: La señora Bonifacia  Teodolinda R. de 40 años,  casada con cuatro hijos, tres de ellos estudian.  Se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos como leche y queso todos los días reparte sus productos desde muy temprano ella se encarga de repartir en la aldea donde viven mientras que su esposo sale en su bicicleta a repartir sus productos en los pueblos cercanos como  Santiago y San Lucas  por lo cual no genera gastos adicionales de transporte. Ahora cuenta con doce vacas y dos crías trabaja en conjunto con su esposo que le ayuda a ordeñar las vacas y a darles de comer todos los días, no se preocupan por el espacio para sus animales ya que cuentan con un amplio terreno que está en la parte trasera de su  casa para poder cuidarlas  mejor , viene desempeñando esta labor  ya un poco mas de 10 años por lo cual  cuenta con amplio conocimiento de su labor, ahora necesita otro crédito para comprar otro ganado para extender la producción de la leche y queso ya que como ella cuenta gracias a Dios ya tienen una clientela a la que le surte sus productos,  ella desea seguir ayudando económica mente en su hogar y darle estudio a sus hijos porque es lo más importante asegura ella
texts.en: Señora Bonifacia  Teodolinda R. is 40 years of age.  She is married with four children, three of whom are students.  She is dedicated to the sale of milk products such as milk and cheese.  Every day she distributes her products from very early in the morning.  She takes charge of distributing in the village where they live while her husband leaves on his bicycle to distribute their products in the nearby towns such as Santiago and San Lucas.  In this way he does not generate additional expenses for transportation.  Now she relies on twelve cows and two young calves.  She works as a group with her husband who helps to milk the cows and to feed them every day.  They do not worry about the space for their animals since they have an extensive plot of land that is at the rear part of their house in order to be able to take care of their stock better.  She has been performing this work already for a little over 10 years, by which she has developed an extensive knowledge of the work.  Now she needs another loan to buy another cow to extend the production of milk and cheese, since, as she says, thanks to God they already have a clientele to which they supply their products.  She desires to continue helping economically in her home and to give her children the opportunity to study because she assures us that is most important.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 37 años, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rogelio de 39 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Son ya 2 años, los que Carmen se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, Enseña su mercadería  a sus clientes a través del catalogo y le gusta mucho su labor, pues la realiza durante sus ratos libres lo que  le permite seguir con las labores de su hogar. Todos los días sale a ofrecer sus productos a sus conocidos y nuevos clientes, camina durante largas horas bajo las constantes inclemencias del tiempo, pero esto no la desanima pues obtiene regulares  ganancias con las que puede ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces existen clientes que se atrasan en el pago de los productos lo que no le permite cancelar a tiempo sus boletas y le atrasa su capital de trabajo. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de comestibles en su casa. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy comprometida con pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible que pudiera obtener este crédito. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería de productos de belleza pues quiere obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Carmen, who is 37 years old, is a humble and hardworknig woman.  She lives in her own home together with her husband, 39-year old Rogelio, and their 2 dear children, to whom she wants to offer a better future.  Carmen has been making her living selling beauty products for 2 years now.  She shows her customers the merchandise from a catalog.  She likes her work a lot, since she is able to do it in her free time, which allows her to keep up with her housework.  She goes out to sell her products every day, selling both to people she knows and to new customers.  She walks long hours under the constant inclemency of the weather, but it doesn't get her down.  When she works, she has regular income, with which she can help her husband pay the household expenses.  What Carmen doesn't like is that often there are customers who are late in their paying for their products, which keeps Carmen from paying her invoices on time, and that causes a decrease in her working capital.  As an enterprising woman, Carmen has plans for the future to set up  a small grocery store in her home.  This is Carmen's second loan with MFP.  She is very determined to make her payments on time, since she doesn't want to make a bad impression on the people who made it possible for her to obtain the  loan.  With the five-hundred "nuevos soles" ($200 USD) that she has requested, Carmen will purchase a greater quantity of merchandise, (beauty products) because she wants to have better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase seeds

loans.name: Benjelyn

texts.en: Benjelyn is 36 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, Benjelyn runs a restaurant. She earns about 5,000 PHP each month. Benjelyn joined PMPC this year and is requesting a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya where she has been doing mixed farming for the last 10 years. She has employed five farmhands who help her produce maize, beans, bananas, watermelons and French beans. She is married with one child aged 11. She gets additional income from employment as a field officer by a local non-governmental organization.

Monicah has made a loan request amounting to 50,000 KES to enable her to purchase a dairy cow. She adds that her focus is to save her income to buy more land and expand her farming activities further. These, she says, will enable her to put up a good house for her family.

Monicah says failure of rain and an unreliable labor force are the greatest undoing to farming in the area.

loans.use: To pay for a dairy cow

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en: Virgie is 52 years old and lives in New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 8 children. Virgie has a general store and earns approximately 3000 each month. She has requested a loan of 7000 to purchase more stock for her store. Virgie has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, she hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

location.town: Liloy-New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Massamba

texts.fr:
il est un  cultivateur qui habite dans le village de darou dia situé à soixante dix km de DAKARla capitale du senegal. il est expérimenté dans son activité à savoir le maraichage, il dispose d'un grand champ maraicher qu'il a héritié de son pere. avec ce financement il souhaite acheter de semences et une machine pour  le forage d'un puits 
il va voir son revenu augmenter qui lui permettra de mieux intervenir dans le champs et de pouvoir satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: This man is a farmer who lives in the village of Darou Dia, located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. He is experienced in his business, namely market gardening. He has a large field for market gardening that he inherited from his father. With this financing, he would like to buy some seeds and a machine for drilling wells. He is going to see his revenues increase, and this will enable him to manage his fields and to satisfy the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy a machine for pumping water and some seeds

loans.name: Mary Mae

texts.en:
Mary Mae is from Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is only 19 years old and married. She has one child to attend to now. At a very young age, Mary Mae had proven her capability in handling a business. She cultivates fruit trees and harvests mango for sale. It was five years ago when she started dealing in this. She makes a monthly income of approximately 3,000 PHP.

Mary Mae has been a GDMPC member since 2010. For the second time around, Mary Mae is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP from the cooperative. This will be used to purchase fruit seeds/seedlings to grow and trade soon. She hopes for a big hit on the market on the next cycle of trading and a gradual expansion of her business size.

loans.use: to purchase fruit seeds/seedlings to grow and trade

loans.name: Jusu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very please to present to you this group of teachers from a primary school in Kenema, eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 7,000,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, they can buy or invest in things that their salaries alone cannot cover. 

Jusu is the leader of this group of teachers. The 52-year-old was born in Kenema city. He is married and has 5 children – 2 in primary school, 2 in secondary school and 1 in college. Jusu has been a professional teacher for 35 years now. He has joined his colleagues to request a loan of 1,000,000 SLL in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Dalia Asunción

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Mujeres Activas.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora Dalia, tiene 45 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, dos mayores de edad y tres de 13, 7 y 3 años dos estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido trabaja en un taller mecánico.
 
Nuestra amiga se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos para lo cual tiene una pequeña graja en su casa. Nos cuenta que mete hasta 100 pollos por temporada y que estos los compra cuando están pequeños en un centro de ventas en el cantón y luego los mantiene por un tiempo y cuando están listos los vende en su casa a personas que llegan hasta allí o si no los pela y lleva a entregar al mercado local a comerciantes que venden por libras, a los chachos su esposo los faena y luego venden la carne en su casa a vecinos y conocidos. Nos cuenta que llevan más de seis años que se dedican a esta labor.
Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimento y medicinas tanto para los pollos como para los chanchos para que estos  tengan un buen desarrollo. Lleva 8 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en: The Mujeres Activas (Active Women) Community Bank meets every 15 days in the village of 24 De Mayo, province of Manabí, which is known for its beautiful landscapes, its forests, the variety of fauna and for its friendly and hard-working people who typically make a living in agriculture and livestock. It is here we find Dalia. She is 45, married and has five children, two of whom are adults and the youngest three are ages 13, 7 and 3 and in school. Her husband works at a mechanic's shop. Dalia makes a living raising chickens and pigs on the small farm she has at her house. She tells us she gets up to 100 chickens a season, which she buys when they're little at a commercial center in the village and then raises them for a time until they're ready to sell. She sells the birds out of her home to people who come there and if not she plucks them and takes them to the market to sell to the local merchants. Her husband takes care of the pigs and then they sell the meat out of their home to neighbors and acquaintances. Dalia tells us that she has six years of experience with this job. She plans to use the loan to purchase chickens as well as feed and medicines for both the chickens and the pigs to ensure they have a good development. She has been with the community bank for eight years and she enjoys it because the loans have helped her a lot. Her goals are to keep making headway and to have good health.

loans.use: to purchase chickens as well as feed and medicine for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Kayelye Group

texts.fr:
Mme Salamata est la représentante du groupe KAYELYE. Elle est mariée et mère de 1 enfant. Il a 10 ans. Il va à l’école. Elle a 4 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des layettes et des pagnes depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionnement à Lomé au TOGO. Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter 30 complets pagnes simples et 15 pagnes bazins.

Mme économise pour l’éducation de son enfant et pour la construction de leur maison d’habitation. Elle ambitionne épargner pour agrandir son activité et s’occuper de son enfant.
texts.en:
Mme Salamata is the representative of the group called KAYELYE. She is married and the mother of one child. He is 10 years old and goes to school. She is supporting four persons. 

She has been selling baby layettes and African print cloth ("pagnes") for 10 years. She buys her wares in  Lomé (TOGO). Her customers are women and men. She wants to buy 30  outfits made of simple African print cloth and 15 made of African print on damask. 

Mme Salamata is saving to educate her child and build a house for them to live in. Her ambition is to put aside savings to grow her business and to take care of her child.

loans.use: to buy 30 simple African print cloth outfits and 15 African prints on damask.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine works hard to support her family. She is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Christine has been in this business for 5 years now.

Christine requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an additional fishing boat.

In the future, Christine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a 33-year-old hardworking business man. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last seven years, he has been selling shoes to make a living. He also runs a green grocer to earn extra income.  Denis has employed three people to help him in the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to become more financially stable. 

Denis is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy tomatoes, onions and cabbages for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to boost his business with the previous loan.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions and cabbages

loans.name: Polina

texts.en: Polina is a 23-year-old married woman with three children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been running a drugstore and bar business for five years. She started with 1,000,000 shillings and now has 5,000,000 shillings as working capital. Her vision is to have a pharmacy and educate her children. Polina needs the loan to buy drugs and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs and beer to sell.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata est âgée  de 55 ans. Elle habite au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le commerce de produits alimentaires comme les oignons, l'ail etc...  Elle a choisi cette activité dans le but de se procurer des revenus. Elle est sociétaire de  l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  et sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de denrées alimentaires en vue de renforcer son stock.  Ce financement lui permettra d’augmenter sa capacité de vente  et  d’accroitre ses bénéfices. Ainsi elle pourra mieux se prendre en charge et soutenir ses proches.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata is 55 years old. She lives in Senegal.

She is active in trading food products such as onions, garlic, etc ... She chose this activity in order to generate income.

She is a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches and is requesting a credit of 200,000 francs to purchase food products so that she can increase her stock supply.

This funding will allow her to increase her sales capacity and consequently her profits. In this way she will be better able to control her activity and support her family.

loans.use: purchase local grain cereals for retail sales

loans.name: Venera's Group

texts.en:
Venera is the leader of this group.  She is 26 and married to a farmer.  Together they raise three children who attend school. 

The family is engaged in cultivating agricultural products and livestock breeding.  They started to breed livestock eight years ago with an initial investment of 10000 Soms.  

In order to cover the family expenses, the couple resells livestock after fattening and also sells part of their harvest.  With money received from the loan, Venera wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and reselling.  

In the future she wishes to save money to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Ronelio

texts.en:
Ronelio is 38 years old and is a married man with 3 children. The oldest child is 11 years old. Ronelio has been a fisherman for 15 years. He earns 8000 PHP per month with this business. Ronelio works hard to provide for his family and improve their living situation.

Ronelio has requested a loan to purchase a fishing boat and paint. Ronelio hopes to have an improving business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat and paint

loans.name: Sujey Johanna

texts.es:
Sujey Johanna tiene 41 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los papás en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

La VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El caimito, Perteneciente a la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo Corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul.

Sujey se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz hace 5 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para trabajar en la agricultura comprar semillas, abonos agrícolas.

Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá comprar más insumos. El sueño es poder tener una casa, no se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a la iglesia.

Con la ayuda del CREDITO ANTERIOR HA MEJORADO EL ESTILO DE VIDA DE LA FAMILIA, Los ingresos han aumentado para el beneficio de la familia.
texts.en:
Sujey Johanna is 31 years old.  She is unmarried and has two children, ages 9 and 3.  She lives with her parents in Ventanas canton, Ríos province.  The Jersusalen communal bank is located in the El Caimito precinct, Puerto Pechiche, Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this communal bank work in agriculture growing short cycle corn, rice, and pole beans.  
Sujey has been growing corn for five years.  She purchases her supplies and sells her products in Ventanas. She is requesting the loan to buy seeds and compost.  With the help of the loan, she will buy more supplies.  She has not faced any problems with her business.  Her dream is to own a home. She enjoys spending her free time in church.  The previous loan helped her improve her family’s lifestyle as she used the increased income for their benefit.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and compost  for  agricultural work.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a married woman who has three children. Helen is 48 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Helen owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living, and she's been in this business for eight years. Each month, she earns 15,000 Philippine pesos doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 30,000 pesos to purchase products to resell. Helen has been a member of GDMPC for seven years. In the future, Helen wants to have a big house and buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell

loans.name: Don Bosco Group

texts.es: Jene es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Don Bosco” grupo conformado por 10 socios comprometidos con el Programa- Prosperidad. Hace  más de 04 años Jene trabaja en un consultorio dental como asistente, gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo ha podido aportar con los gastos del hogar, y de este modo apoyar a su madre ya que nos manifiesta que le ha  comprado  una salchipapera la cual trabaja vendiendo frituras (alita broster, hamburguesas, salchipapas). Uno de sus sueños de Jene es de instalar en su domicilio un restaurante donde pueda brindar variedades de platos típicos pues así asegura que tendrá  mayores ganancias. Con el crédito que solicito piensa seguir apoyando a su mamá con los insumos como papa, pollo, aceite y cubiertos. La Alcancía Comunal “Don Bosco” están muy agradecidos con el Programa- Prosperidad ya que hacen posible su progreso. En la fotografía podemos apreciar a Jene, ella es la que viste una chompa blanca y  está ubicada en la parte posterior.
texts.en:
Jene’s a member of the “Don Bosco” communal bank, a group of ten members committed to the Programa-Prosperidad.  Jene has worked for four years as an assistant in a dental office.  Thanks to her work and her effort she’s been able to contribute to household expenses and help her mother.  She tells us that she bought her a “salchipapera” [cart to prepare and sell salchipapas-fried potatoes with fried potatoes] that she uses to sell fast food (Broaster-style chicken wings, hamburgers, salchipapas).  

One of Jene’s dreams is to set up a restaurant at home where she can offer a variety of traditional dishes because she is sure her profits will be better that way.  She plans to use the requested loan to continue to help her mother with ingredients like potatoes, chicken, oil and place settings.

The “Don Bosco” communal bank is very grateful to the Programa-Prosperidad because it makes their progress possible.  In the photo we can see Jene wearing a white sweater; she’s located in the rear.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, chicken, oil and place settings.

loans.name: Celso Noel

texts.es:
Celso, es soltero vive con su madre y su hermana, él tiene en su casa un taller de bicicletas, lo comenzó por iniciativa propia, no tiene un horario establecido y ya tiene experiencia en el negocio.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar los repuestos como: rines, bombas, llantas, tubos y parches, solo a si teniendo lo necesario podrá darles un buen servicio a sus clientes y los ingresos mejoraran cada día.
El sueño de Celso es mejorar su taller y tener los repuestos necesarios para mejorar su negocio y ayudar a su familia con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Celso is single, lives with his mother and sister, he has in his home a bicycle workshop that he began by his own initiative. He has no set hours and has experience in the business.

The loan will be used to buy spare parts like: rims, pumps, tires, tubes, and patches to give his customers good service and improve his income each day.

Celso’s dream is to improve his workshop and have the necessary spare parts to improve his business and help his family with the household expenses.

loans.use: buy rims, pumps, tires, tubes, and patches.

loans.name: Bozorboy

texts.ru: Бозорбой 33 летный двоих отец. Он житель района Кубадиен. Его жена занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Бозорбой целеустремленный человек. Его родители занимались животноводческой деятельности. И его этому деятельности научил его отец. Сейчас он решил заняться животноводством. Бозорбой планирует покупать скотов и откармливать их несколько месяцев, потом перепродавать их на скотном рынке. Он запрашивает кредит для купли несколько скотов. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ему начать новый бизнес. Он надеется на Вашу поддержку.

loans.use: Для купли несколько скотов и начать деятельность.

loans.name: Reina  Suyapa

texts.en:
Hello I am Reina Suyapa, I have a small business where I sell new clothes, located in the center of my community. I have several years experience working at my business, which creates earnings to cover supplier costs and the cost of food, education and health for my family. Now, my future plans are to rent a site near the fixed marketplace so that I will not have to regularly carry my products.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola soy Reina Suyapa, tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa Nueva, ubicado en el el centro de mi comunidad, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los compromisos con los proveedores y gastos de alimentación, Educación y salud de mi familia. Actualmente mis planes futuros es poder alquilar un local donde la mercadaeria quede segura y no tenga que estar acarriandola a diario.

loans.use: To buy men\'s shirts, women\'s blouses, men\'s and women\'s pants, underwear and women\'s skirts.

loans.name: Eynulla

texts.en:
Eynulla has run this business for 4 years.
He wants to offer all this children an education that allows them to continue their own life and to be an honest and hard-working people.
He needs to work very hard every day to cover family expenses.
Having borrowed $600 he repaired this car.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy this car, which he has rented.
Eynulla is a 40 year old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. He is marriedand has 3 children.

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Mrs. Caroline O. is married with eight children, and hails from Ubiaji, Edo State of Nigeria.  She started her business of selling bags of garri in her community years ago to help take care of her family.  She is requesting a loan of $250 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Mrs. Chim K. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and her two school-aged children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia
Mrs. K. is a laborer, while her husband works as a construction foreman. Together they earn approximately $6 each day. This loan  will be used to purchase a motorcycle for her husband because it would be better for him not to spend so much each day on public transport.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to to use go to work

loans.name: Laura Virginia

texts.es:
Laura is 41 and started her family when she was 19. She now has 4 children and since then she has dedicated herself to different occupations and activities with the help her life long companion, her husband. Five years ago she decided to dedicate herself to the sale of packaging, and products that she distributed and offered exclusively during the times of fairs in different towns and to villagers that lie around the city. She started selling in small quantities. Little by little due to the good service she provided and her charismatic character she continued increasing the quantity of her clients, therefore increasing her income for her home. In addition to this activity, the days she has free she dedicates herself to offering sewing services and the sale of chocolates. This generates an additional income for the education of her children. What Mrs. Lourde hopes is to have a packaging wholesale distribution store. This work would permit her to be much more close to her family, generate more income, and offer them a better quality of life. This is why Mrs. Laura is soliciting a loan of $425 dollars, money that she will use to refurbish the location she is trying to open for the packaging wholesale distribution store, and she is promising to pay back the loan in 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora laura actualmente tiene 41 años formó su familia a la edad de 19 y fruto del matrimonio ahora tiene 4 hijos, desde entonces se dedicó a diversas ocupaciones y actividades siempre con el apoyo de su compañero de toda la vida, su esposo.Hace ya 5 años decidió dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes, productos que distribuía y ofrecía exclusivamente en los días de feria por los diferentes pueblos aledaños a la ciudad donde radica, empezó vendiendo en pequeñas cantidades y poco a poco por la buena atención que brindaba y su carácter carismático fue incrementando la cantidad de clientes y por ende aumentando los ingresos económicos para su hogar adicionalmente a esta actividad los días en los que dispone de más tiempo se dedica a ofrecer los servicios de costura y venta de chocolates trabajo que le genera un ingreso adicional para la educación de sus hijos. El deseo de doña Lourdes es tener una tienda de distribución de abarrotes al por mayor, trabajo que le permitiría estar mucho más cerca de su familia, generar mayores ingresos y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.Para esto, doña Laura, esta solicitando un préstamo de 425 dólares, dinero que utilizará en refaccionar el local en el que pretende abrir el negocio de venta de abarrotes al por mayor además les extiende el compromiso de su devolución en un lapso de 6 meses.

loans.use: She wishes for a loan to amplify her business and generate a greater economic income for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his stock.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
With over a decade's experience running small companies, 38-year-old Saumu M. is a veteran businesswoman. In 1995, she started a company that sold bed sheets. In 2000, she established a chicken-raising business. And this year Saumu diversified further and bought a dalla dalla (a minibus, the main form of public transport in Tanzania), which is driven and managed day-to-day by an employee. Saumu requires a loan of $1,050, which she plans to use to expand the chicken-raising business. She is married to husband Nurunidi and has three children, Aziza, 14, Alfani, 8 and Rashidi, 4.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not credit-worthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Aisha's Imani Group

texts.en:
Aisha, age 25, is married with 2 children (ages 7 and 3). She and her husband also take care of her 60 year old father.

Aisha works as a food vendor between 7am and 6pm daily. She began this business in 1992, and now makes a monthly profit of about $65 from this business.

She and her subgroup hope for a loan to increase their businesses. Aisha's subgroup members, Zainab and Tausi, have chicken businesses.

loans.use: To buy cooking stock

loans.name: Ulugbeck

texts.en: K. Ulugbeck was born in 1967 in the J.Rasulov region and he is married and has 3 children.   He sells his products at the nearby bazaar where his store is located. He has an assortment of meat products, canned food, spices and small wares that he sells at competitive prices. Now Mr. K. Ulugbeck requests the loan of 2500 STJ for 5 months to purchase a specialized refrigerator and increase his inventory (he wants to sell milk-sour products).

loans.use: To purchase a specialized refrigerator and increase his inventory

loans.name: Vidosava

texts.en: Vidosava is a 57 years old woman from Pale. Her wish is to improve her business and so she asks for a loan of $950. Vidosava and her husband are going to use it  for purchasing material for their bookstore and invest in  carpenter activities. This is her second  loan from MCO WWI and she hopes that she will, with  help of this loan, open  her own carpenter shop.

loans.use: Purchasing material for the bookstore and opening carpenter shop

loans.name: Ana Maria's Group

texts.es:
Ana Maria and Vitma have belonged to the Florecer Communal Bank for 8 months and 11 years, respectively.

Ana Maria is 37 years old and separated with four children. Ana Maria has a small cafe in the Father of Miracles school, where she sells sweets and food. Ana Maria also sells "salchipapas" (a traditional sausage and french fry dish) at night out of her home.

Vitma is 30 years old and separated with an 11-year-old son. Vitma sells clothing and shoes in the Vilcas Huamán market. She buys her wares in the city of Lima.

Ana Maria and Vitma need loans of 600 and 1000 soles, respectively, to be spent on cookies, candy, soda, soda, oil, rice, pants, shoes and sneakers.

Ana Maria and Vitma dream that their children will be working professionals, of having their own homes, of having bigger businesses and of owning a minimarket.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Ana Maria y Vitma pertenecen al Banco Comunal Florecer hace 8 meses y 11 años respectivamente.

Ana Maria es separada, tiene 37 años y 4 hijos, Ana Maria tiene un cafetín en el colegio Señor de los Milagros, donde vende golosinas y comida. Además Ana Maria vende salchipapas por las noches en la puerta de su casa.

Mientras que Vitma es separada, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo de 11 años, Vitma vende ropa y calzados en la feria de Vilcas Huamán, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.

Ana Maria y Vitma necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, caramelos, gaseosas, aceite, arroz, casacas, pantalones, zapatillas, zapatos.

Los sueños de Ana Maria y Vitma son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener casa propia, un negocio más grande y un minimarket.

loans.use: Puchase cookies, candy, soda, oil, rice, jackets, pants, sneakers and shoes.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
In one of the main streets of the urban community of Huancayo, you will find Nelly, who exemplifies hard work. She creates deliciously seasoned local dishes by hand. Hoping to improve her sales, Nelly has in mind a project to rent a commercial space, meanwhile continuing to work as she does now. Her loan request is intended to improve her work space and the facilities of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

En una de las calles principales de la comunidad urbana justicia paz y vida verán a una mujer ejemplo y símbolo de trabajo, sus manos y su exquisita sazón dan como resultado platos típicos deliciosos. El deseo de Nelly es mejorar sus ventas y tiene como proyecto en mente arrendar un local comercial, mientras tanto seguirá trabajando de esta manera. Su solicitud de un crédito atiende a la necesidad de mejorar su espacio de trabajo y las instalaciones de su hogar.

loans.use: Implemention of a work space.

loans.name: Rober

texts.es:
Rober, is an excellent father and farmer who is dedicated to his work, his goal is to better his farming techniques that way he fulfills the needs within his home especially for his wife and daughter. He travels daily without delay to his agricultural lands and is aware of every change that occurs. Due to high demand for his products, because of their excellent quality, size and flavor, Rober has decided to plant more and apply for a loan to purchase natural compost and fertilizers that will contribute to an excellent harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

ROBER, es un excelente padre agricultor que se dedica por entero a su actividad con el propósito de mejorar cada vez más sus procesos y así incrementar las satisfacciones dentro de su hogar para su amada esposa e hija. A diario se desplaza sin demora hacia sus tierras de cultivo y esta pendiente de cada cambio. Debido a la gran demanda de sus productos por la excelente calidad, tamaño y sabor de los mismos ha decidido incrementar su siembra y solicita un préstamo para adquirir abonos y fertilizantes naturales que colaborarán para obtener un excelente resultado.

loans.use: To purchase natural compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sita T. lives with her husband and four children in the town of Kuleshwor. Her husband's name is Shyam T. and he works in a private office. Mrs. T. has three daughters, and they are studying in grade 6, 3 and 2 respectively. And her son is in primary school.  She has four children, and in Nepal the cost of education is very high. So they have to spend a huge amount for their children's education, and the economy of her family is not so good. So to overcome this problem, Mrs. T. opened her vegetable shop five years ago. She sells different types of vegetables in her shop. She buys vegetables from Kalimati Market. 
Now Mrs. T. is requesting a Rs 15,000 (US$225) loan to buy various types of vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes, etc. for her shop. She also wants to purchase new furniture for her shop. Sometimes her husband also helps her in her shop

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida baji is the wife of M., and she has been living in the city of Riwind, Paksitan for the last 12 years. She lives in a house which is situated in an area known as Bhai Kot within Riwind. She is the mother of six children: two sons and four daughters, all of whom are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her husband, meanwhile, drives a tractor for a living, and he has been doing so for the last 10 years.

Notably, Sajida baji successfully repaid her three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Currently, she is requesting another loan in order to repair a tractor (both the engine and the body of the vehicle).

loans.use: To repair the engine and body of a tractor

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Thú tham gia vào quỹ từ năm 1997. Vốn là những người dân chăm chỉ, chịu khó ngoài thời gian làm nông nghiệp  vợ chồng chị Thú còn đi T. mua phế liệu về bán cho các đại lý tại địa phương. Qua hơn 10 năm vay vốn đến nay từ hộ gia đình khó khăn về kinh tế gia đình chị đã trở thành hộ có T. nhập ổn định trong thôn với mức T. nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.Vòng vốn tới anh chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để  tiếp tục đầu tư vốn  đi T. mua phế liệu
texts.en:
Ms. T. has been a part of this organization since 1997. She is considered to be a very focused and hard-working individual. Besides working as a farmer with her husband, Ms. T. also buys recycle items to sell to the local businesses in her area. After 10 years of borrowing and struggling financially, her family finances have evolved and since been stable with a monthly income of 3.000.000d/month. This next loan, she is requesting an amount of 15.000.000d as capital in which she plans to purchase more recycle items.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.ru: Гурезов Музафар житель района А.Джоми.Возраст 39 лет.,женат, имеет 5 детей.Образование средне-техническое,по специальности бухгалтер. Работает в крестьянском хозяйстве бухгалтером.Так же занимается посевом пшеницы и картофеля.Собрав урожай он обеспечивает свою семью самыми необходимыми продуктами питания.На кредит Музафар хочет закупить качественные семена пшеницы и картофеля.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muzafar G. lives in the A. Jomi region. He is 39 years old, married and has five children. He has secondary technical education and is an account by profession. He works as an accountant in the village. He also sows wheat and potatoes. The harvest allows him to support his family with the necessary food. Muzafar wants to use the loan to buy quality wheat and potato seeds. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat and potato seeds

loans.name: Progress I Group

texts.en:
This is the Progress Group: Thaimu C., Fatmata M., Fatmata B., and Mahawa C.. They are requesting a loan of Le 3,200,000.00 to help them expand on their businesses.

Thaimu is the leader of this group. He is 42 and married to a businesswoman. They have two children, who are both attending primary school. Thaimu sells medicine and has been in the business for the past twenty years. 

He will use this loan to invest in his business by increasing his stock. He usually travels to Freetown (570 miles round trip) to buy stock of medicine. With more goods to sell, Thaimu will not have to travel to Freetown as much and he will also likely see more profit. With increased profit, Thaimu's life will become better. He will be able to pay his children's school fees and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Anibal Gonzalo

texts.es:
El caballero Anibal M. es originario de la ciudad de Chnandega desempeñándose en la venta de plátanos en el mercado Central donde labora desde hace cuatro años. Es importante destacar que esta actividad la lleva a cabo apoyándose de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel el cual los ha invertido directamente en la compra de los plátanos para su venta.

Hoy en día una vez más ha acudido al apoyo de Ceprodel para obtener un crédito debido a que sus plátanos se le han agotado y le urge comprarlos para venderlos. Por esta razón él espera muy confiadamente que su crédito será otorgado y logrará mejorar la condición de su negocio.
texts.en:
Anibal M. originally comes from the city of Chnandega, working in the sale of plantains in the Central Market where he has worked for four years. It is important to mention that he is able to carry out this activity by supporting himself with credit from Ceprodel which he has invested directly in buying plantains to sell them.

Now, once more, he has turned to Ceprodel for support to get a credit as his plantains have run out and he urgently needs to buy more to sell more. For this reason he confidently waits for his credit to be approved and he will be able to improve the condition of his business


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plantains/Compra de plátanos

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Nhạn tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1995. Sau 13 năm tham gia Quỹ và sử dụng đầu tư cho kinh doanh rất  hiệu quả đến nay chị Nhạn đã là chủ một của hàng chuyên kinh doanh chăn ga gối đệm tại phường Đồng Xuân Thị xã Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập ổn định cho gia đình chị Nhạn trong thời gian qua.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Nhạn has been a member of the TYM Fund since 1995. During the 13 years that she has participated in the Fund, Mrs. Nhạn has used her loans very effectively and has become the owner of a store that sells bedding supplies (blankets, pillows, mattresses) in Đồng Xuân ward, Phúc Yên town, Vĩnh Phúc province. This business has been able to provide her family with a stable income. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 12,000,000 VND (725 USD) to invest in the family business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bedding supplies business

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es: Norma Isabel es madre soltera de 28 años de edad, tiene 2 niños de 6 y 11 años, ambos estudian la primaria, trabaja en la zona rural de Santo Tomas en la comarca El Guabo, se traslada los domingos regresando el viernes por la tarde, esta solicitando su primer credito, el que destinara para la construccion de un dormitorio (levantar paredes), esta estudiando el 3er año de la universidad los sabados en Santo Tomas, su mamá le cuida los niños mientras trabaja y estudia, plantea que desea superarse para en el futuro poder dar mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos, ademas se ha comprometido a pagar su credito de acuerdo a lo pactado, pues desea demostrar a la institucion que es una persona responsable y buena pagadora.
texts.en:
Norma Isabel is a single mother aged 28. She has 2 children aged 6 and 11, both of whom are in primary school. she works in the rural zone of Santo Tomas in the region of El Guabo,travelling on Sunday and returning on Friday afternoon. She is asking for her first loan, which will be used to construct a bedroom (putting-up walls). She is studying in the third year of university on Saturdays in Santo Tomas: her mother looks after the children while she works and studies. She explains that her overwhelming desire for the future is to be able to give her children a better quality of life. She has promised to repay her loan in accordance with the terms and conditions, because she wants to show the institution that she is a responsible person and a good payer.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabrics for her seamstress business

loans.name: Toch's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four members. Its leader, S., is 49 and has six children: One is married and lives separately, and the other five are attending school. S. is married to Mach, 49, who has a truck he has used to provide transport services to the whole community since 1991. S. owns a sewing machine and has been sewing clothes for the villagers since 2000. She has earned a good income from this business because she is famous for the good job she does.

Recently, S. faces difficulty with transportation. So she is looking a loan to buy a motorbike for her business' transportation.

The other three members are: S., 41, who owns a laundry shop and is looking for a loan to renovate her shop; N., 48, who sells traditional cake in the market and is looking for a loan to rebuild her kitchen; and S., 30, who works in the Apsara's garden and is looking for a loan to buy a motorbike for her work's traveling. They all live in the Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her business' transportation

loans.name: Omolara

texts.en:
Omolara sells hair extensions, makeup and hair cream. Omolara goes to Idumota (within Lagos) to purchase her goods in large quantities and sells retail in the Okoko market in Lagos. Omolara has been a LAPO Microfinance client for the past two years. Omolara is 33 years old and married with three children.

Omolara needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more hair extensions, hair creams and hair relaxers to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions, creams and relaxers

loans.name: Guillermo Jose

texts.es: El señor Guillermo tiene 67 años de edad, hombre trabajor que desde muy joven comenzó su jornada y ahora esta gozando de los beneficios recibe una pensión mensual que le da el Inss. Reside en barrio Laureles Norte en la ciudad de Managua, su esposa es ama de casa, la cual tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, en Afodenic este es su séptimo ciclo y lo va invertir en comprar repuestos para reparar su microbús el cual hace viaje de acarreo, que la tiene en mal estado, sus planes es poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Guillermo, 67, is a hard working man who started working at a young age. Now he is enjoying the benefits. He receives a monthly pension from Social Security. He lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the city of Managua. His wife is a housewife. They have three adult children. This is his seventh loan with Afodenic. He will buy spare parts to repair his minivan, which he uses to transport merchandise. The minivan is in bad shape. His plans are to be able to continue helping his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts to fix his vehicle to be able to keep working

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya de l’association Lafia est constitué de cinq  femmes (dont quatre mariés et une  célibataire) qui ont en moyenne 32 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Ouayerma II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso troisième région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur cinquième  prêt solidaire, tous les précédents se sont bien dénoués. Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de tissus, de  pagnes wax et bazins,  des fruits, du bois de chauffe,  des prestations  avec la teinture etc. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 3chargements de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 7 pièces de pagnes  wax,  5 complets de bazin, 6 régimes de bananes, 10 paniers de fruits, 20 complets de tissus et 4 paquets de colorants et ingrédients pour la teinture. Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Bamako, de Médine à Sikasso ville et dans les localités avoisinantes.
 Les marchandises sont vendues dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso et dans les familles à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant. Elles font leur prestation de teinture  dans leur famille.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines femmes du groupe Danaya ambitionnent acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation et d’autres évoluer en solo.
texts.en:
The Danaya group of the Lafia association is made up of 5 women (four of them married and one single) who have an average age of 32 and 2 children. They mostly live in monogamous families in Ouayerma II, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele and are on their fifth solidarity loan, all the preceding loans having been reimbursed correctly. They have various businesses, among others selling cloth, high quality "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) and damask fabric, fruit, firewood, dyed products, etc.

With this new loan they expect to buy 3 wagonloads of firewood, 7 bolts of "pagnes", 5 outfits made out of damask, 6 stalks of bananas, 10 baskets of fruit, 20 cloth suits and 4 packs of coloring and ingredients for doing dyeing. They buy their goods at the market in Bamako, in Médine in the town of Sikasso and surrounding neighborhoods.

The merchandise is sold in the various markets of Sikasso and out of their families to a clientele composed of men and women, mostly for cash. They do their dyeing in their families' homes. They each expect to make an average monthly of 22,500 F CFA of which part will be used for family needs and the rest reinvested in their businesses.

The ambition of some of the women of the Danaya group is to be able to buy a lot on which to build a house; other members would like to start up businesses on their own.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en:
Rosina O. is married and has three children. Her husband is a teacher. She has received schooling through tertiary level.

Rosina sells detergents, smocks (a native clothing which originated from the northern part of the country) and creams at Ola in Cape Coast, which she has done for seven years. Rosina uses her income to pay for taking care of her children.

Rosina will use the loan to purchase inventory for her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rosina plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more detergents, smocks and creams

loans.name: Chi

texts.en: Chi T. V. was born in 1946. There are five member in her family. She mainly works in the fields of agricultural, animal and vegetable.  Chi also makes paper pockets at home.  Her husband is a construction worker.  The average family income is about 2,500,000 Vietnamese Dong.  She wants to borrow 4.548.000 VND to buy paper and food for domestic animals.

loans.use: Buy paper and food for domestic animal.

loans.name: Rose Nasubuga‘S Group

texts.en:
Rose is the leader of a 4-member group. She is 42 years old, married, with four children aged between 3 and 10 years. Her children go to school. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she is staying with four people. Rose takes care of additional family members. There is no electricity or piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala.

Rose sells fruits and vegetables in Ndeeba market and so she incurs no extra transport costs as she buys from her place of work. She sells to an average of 30 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for business, and feeding the family. Besides fruits and vegetables, she sells charcoal. She has been in this business for the last nine years.

Rose has been with MCDT for over seven years and is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more commodities for her shop. Rose is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning permanent business premises. .

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Gavharoy

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Гавхарой - молодая женщина 1972 года рождения. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Занимается продажей детской одежды на рынке Адрасман города Кайракума. Она закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Гавхарой ездит за товаром 2 раза в неделю. Ей помогают сыновья. Гавхарой кредитуется у нас впервые. Она очень надеется, что кредит поможет ей в расширении бизнеса. Гавхарой просит кредит на закупку летней партии детской одежды.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Gavharoy is a young woman born in 1972. She is married and is a mother of three children. She sells children's clothing on the market Adrasman in the town of Kairakkum. She buys the merchandise from the wholesale market in Istaravshan. Gavharoy travels for the merchandise twice a week. Her sons help her. This is a first loan for Gavharoy. She is hoping that this loan will help her expand her business. Gavharoy is asking for a loan to buy summer batch of children's clothing.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a batch of summer children's clothing

loans.name: Mrs. Sophath Bou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people living in Thma Kor Village in Kandal Province comprise this village bank loan group. They will use the loan for various purpose. Mrs. Sophath B. is the 39-year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who grows mangoes near her house. She is requesting a loan to buy pesticides to kill insects in the mango field. Her husband, Mr. Vorn Ra, is a mango middleman. This couple has five children, four of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Mrs. Ny L. is not borrowing, but her husband is, so he is shown in the picture instead. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy pesticides to kill insects in the mango field.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona H. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 24 years old. Chona is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Chona owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) store. The primary source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Chona is just starting this business.

In 2009, Chona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services, and to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Chona from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Tay

texts.en: S. is a single woman, 22-year-old, who currently resides in the best territory of Siem Reap town, in Cambodia Country. She is a local chef. She is always hired by neighbors to cook meals for their wedding parties and their other ceremonies. She now lives with her older father who appears in the picture above. Her father works fishing in and around Tunle Sap Lake. S. will be used her first loan to buy additional fish tools, such as nets and traps for her father's fishing activities.

loans.use: To buy additional fish tools

loans.name: Fredrick's Group

texts.en:
Fredrick is the married father of eight children, four of whom are still in school. He is a member of a group in Embu but owns a charcoal business in Ngong Kajiado.

Fredrick runs one of the largest charcoal stores in the area. He buys bags of charcoal, and supplies to retail outlets at Kshs 800 a bag, and is thus able to make a profit. He has applied for a loan of Kshs 50,000 to get more stock.

loans.use: To buy charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Ntinda F Nasubuga Salima Group

texts.en: N. Salima is forty years old married with five children schooling. She is a tailor carrying out tailoring services which she has been doing for over four years. She is requesting for the loan to purchase material clothing’s’ for making different designs for sale to customers and more so she buys and sells already made clothes too. She hopes for improvement in her business. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase material clothing’s’ for making different designs for sale to customers and more so she buys and sells already made clothes too.

loans.name: Vilma De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Vilma de los Ángeles F. L. desde que era niña conoce el trajín de tener una pulpería ya que esta perteneció a sus padres que luego se la heredaron. Ella invertirá el crédito en comprar granos básicos y otros productos de uso en el hogar como jabones, champú, crema, carne, pastas de diente y de lustrar, especies y verduras.

El deseo de F. es convertir la pulpería en una miscelánea y con la ayuda de los préstamos y el apoyo familiar que tiene pronto lo lograra.
texts.en:
Vilma de los Ángeles F. L. has known the hectic lifestyle of owning a grocery store since she was a girl, since she inherited the grocery that her parents ran. She will invest the loan in the purchase of basic grains and other products for the home, such as soap, shampoo, creams, meat, toothpaste, polish, spices and vegetables. F.' wish is to convert the grocery into a miscellaneous goods store and with the help of the loans and the support of her family that she has, soon she will achieve this wish.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou N. gére une boutique d' habiles prêt à porter à Grand Yoff, Dakar.  Elle vend des habiles de la mode dans sa petite boutique.  Depuis le bas age, elle accompagnait sa mère qui faisait le commerce.  Comme beaucoup d' autres commerçants d' habiles, elle envisage une demande forte grace à la veille de la fete de Tabaski, la celebration Islamique du sacrifice.  Donc, elle voudrait renforcer ses stocks des habiles pour répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.  Madame N. a 36 ans et elle est mariée.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou N. runs a ready-to-wear clothing store in Grand Yoff, Dakar. She sells stylish clothing in her small shop. Since she was young, she has accompanied her mother who used to work in commerce. Like many other clothing merchants, she anticipates strong demand ahead of the Tabaski Festival, the Islamic celebration of sacrifice. She would therefore like to bolster her stock of clothing to respond to the demands of her customers. Ms. N. is 36 years old and married.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her stock of ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Alternativa Group

texts.es:
Alternativa  un grupo de 9 mujeres y 1 varón  se reúnen cada dos semanas  en el Centro Focal Los Andes, trabajan con la familia de Pro Mujer hace aproximadamente 12 años.
