Cuentan con diferentes negocios que van desde el tejido de prendas de vestir,  elaboración de pan, producción de muebles, comercio de ropa, bolsas y venta de comida. Necesitan el préstamo para incrementar  su capital de trabajo, algunos comprando mercadería otras adquiriendo  material de trabajo.
Como son socias o clientas antiguas les gusta asitir al consultorio para hacerse un examen general, específicamente el Papanicolau, tambien  llevar a sus hijos para el control de peso y talla.
texts.en:
Alternativa is a group made up of 9 women and 1 man. They meet every two weeks at the Los Andes Communal Bank. They have been associated with the Pro Mujer family for the past 12 years. They have different lines of work which range from weaving clothing, to baking bread, to making furniture, clothing sales, bags, and sales of prepared meals. They need financing to increase their working capital, some to buy merchandise, others to get work supplies. Since they are long-standing clients, they like to come to the health center for general check-ups, specifically the Papanicolau test. They also bring their children in for weight and height monitoring.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work material and merchandise.

loans.name: Maric

texts.en:
Maric began selling gasoline four years ago because there was no business that provided fuel in her immediate area. Before she started her business, people had to drive a distance to one of the bigger cities. Maric says that the business continues to grow, even though more competition has arisen and now there is a gas station in the area. She says that she has built up a good customer base and her customers are loyal and, for various reasons, her business continues to grow. The dangerous nature of her work worries Maric, and she dreams of opening her own small general store to complement her fuel sales business.

Maric is married and has two children, ages 7 and 4. She says that they are very lucky to be healthy, to have a roof over their heads, and to have food to eat.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Dédé

texts.en: Mrs. M. owns a general grocery store in Agoé. She has been running her business since 2000. Her husband is a taxi driver and they have 2 children. This will be her first loan with WAGES. She will use the funds to purchase rice, oil, spaghetti, and a variety of shoes to resell. She plans on repaying her loan in installments over the course of the next 12 months. This loan will help her maintain a profitable and prosperous business.

loans.use: Various grocery products

loans.name: Elizabeth Genoveva

texts.es: La Sra. Elizabeth  tiene como actividad la venta de pollos broaster en su snack donde vende tambien almuerzos, hamburguesas y salchipapas, su snack esta ubicado en la zona de Miraflores, esta atividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su hija quien estudia y a la ves ayuda a su mamá, el destino del credito es para pagar un saldo que tiene de la compra de un vehiculo, que trabaja como radio taxi constituyendose en otro ingreso para su hogar.
texts.en:
Ms. Elizabeth sells Broaster chicken at her stand, in which she also sells lunches, hamburgers, and "salchipapas." Her stand is located in the Miraflores district. This is the main source of income for her and her daughter, who both studies and helps her mother. This loan will be used to pay the balance on a vehicle, which she uses as a taxi for secondary income.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying off auto payment for use as taxi service

loans.name: Elvis Antonio

texts.es:
Elvis es un padre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de tres y un año de edad en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 10 años trabaja transportando carga y pasajeros en su mototaxi. El nos comenta que empezó alquilando mototaxis y que con sus ahorros pudo adquirir la suya hace cuatro años. Usualmente trabaja dentro de la ciudad aunque a veces también en rutas que unen la ciudad con sus caseríos aledaños.

Por otro lado trabaja eventualmente como obrero. El es consciente de que si quiere ver a su familia progresar tiene que dar todo de si para sacarlos adelante. El continuo uso otorgado a su vehículo ha hecho que presenta algunas fallas que requieran de reparacion urgente, por ello se encuentra solcitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Elvis es un padre honrado, empeñoso y trabajador. Su más grande anhelo es poder instalar una bodega en su casa para brindarle a su familia ingresos estables con los cuales puedan mantenerse. Ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nosotros y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Elvis, 27, lives with his wife and their two children. He has a three year old and a one year old. They live in the Paiján distict, Ascope province, in the La Libertad area. It is located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked transporting cargo and passengers in his “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) for ten years. He tells us that he started by renting mototaxis. Four years ago he was able to get his own with his savings. He usually works within the city, although at times he also works routes that run from the city to the neighboring areas. He sometimes works as a workman. He is aware of the fact that if he wants to see his family progress, he needs to give all of himself to get them ahead. The continual use of his vehicle has caused some defects that need to be repaired urgently. That is why he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 800 PEN. Elvis is an honest and hard-working father. His greatest desire is to be able to set up a convenience store in his house in order to give his family stable income to be able to support themselves. He has worked with us previously, and he has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay expenses of repair and maintenance for his vehicle

loans.name: Lweza Intergrated Group, Kampala

texts.en:
N. Nulu is a hard working and devoted lady who has had a retail shop business in Lweza for six years. She is married with three children who are all in secondary school. From her shop sales, Nulu, highlighted at lower left in the photo that accompanies this profile, is able to make 125,000 Ugandan shillings as weekly profits, although she is faced with challenges like the late payments of debtors.

This is Nulu’s first time to seek for a loan from Kiva field partner Pearl Microfinance.  She hopes to expand her shop, and in future to turn it into a wholesale shop. She also hopes to have a reputable and educated family so that they all become self reliant. She needs this loan to help with increasing stock at her shop, and hopes it will result in increased profits.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
el sr. Juan Francisco G. F. se dedica a la venta de leña y a veces se dedica a la caficultura. tiene 5 años de vender leña, es casado tiene 2 hijos que dependen de El.   
con los ingresos  que le genera este negocio cubre  todos sus gastos personales y familiares.
La Zona donde vive el sr. G. es una zona boscosa de un clima fresco lo que le permite realizar estas actividades sacando un buen provecho de los recursos naturales que estan a su disposicion, la venta de leña en estos lugares es bien comun ya que se necesita para uso domestico para la cocion de alimentos y de uso industrial en lo que es hornos de panaderia y secadoras de café.
ahorita quiere abastecerse de leña porque se pone escasa en los siguientes meses y asi el podra tener producto para vender.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Francisco G. F. sells firewood and occasionally grows coffee. He has been selling firewood for five years. Juan is married and has two dependent children. With the income generated from his business, he is able to cover his personal and family expenses.

The neighborhood where Sr. G. lives is in a wooded area that experiences cool climate. His business is made possible because the conditions allow him to make good use of the natural resources at his disposal. The sale of firewood is very common in this area because it is needed for domestic use, such as preparing food. It also has commercial uses, since it is used to fuel bakery ovens and coffee dryers.

Sr. Juan wants to stock up on firewood right now because supplies will be limited in the coming months. He wants to be sure that he will have enough product to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero is 52 years old and married with 2 children. Her husband is a transporter and he also supports their home. Vero sells building materials like sharp sand, granite and blocks. She loves this business because it is highly profitable. She has been in this business for 3 years. Vero is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more building materials to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is 22 years old and for the last three years he has been employed as a motorbike rider to transport people and goods around Naivsaha town.  

While on this job he has learned the benefits of the occupation and he wants to operate his own motorbike. With this in mind, he started looking for a financier and that’s when a friend introduced him to KADET.  This will be his first loan, which he will use to buy his own motorbike and create his own employment.

He plans to save the profits from his motorbike operations, which he will use to open up a wholesale shop in Naivasha town dealing with basic home commodities.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock her store with the essentials

loans.name: Awate

texts.en:
Awate M. is currently in the business of selling both fresh and dried fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase pulses and beans to sell. Awate is 41 years old. She is married and her husband is a retired army captain. She has 7 children, 3 of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase pulses and beans to sell.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Садыкова Мохира проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст, 29 лет. Разведена, имеет одного ребенка. Живет вместе с родителями. Отец работает в России. Сама Мохира имеет среднее образование. У нее салон свадебных платьев. Она продает и дает напрокат  платье. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 12 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения свадебных платьев.
texts.en:
Mohira S. lives in the town of Qurgan-Tube. 29 years old, divorced with one child. Her parents live with her. Her father now works in Russia. Mohira herself has finished secondary school. She keeps a bridal salon. She sells and rents bridal dresses. She has been in this business for over 12 years. She is taking out this loan in order to purchase a supply of bridal dresses.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wedding dresses [for resale]

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es: Juana Antonia de 38 años, vive en una zona bastante lejana. Hace 12 años que se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, productos como cucharas, tenedores, tasas, electrodomésticos entre otras cosas. Ella siempre se ha esforzado por tener un tramo en donde puede ofrecer diferentes productos y que sus clientes observen con mejor comodidad. Poco a poco fue incrementando su tienda, aunque no cuenta con muchos productos ella sigue trabajando para incrementarlos. El sueño de ella es mejorar su vivienda. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Juana Antonia is 38 years old and lives in a remote area. For twelve years she has been selling general merchandise such as spoons, forks, cups, household appliances, and other products. She always strives to keep her vending station stocked with a variety of different products so that her customers will find it more convenient to shop there. Gradually over time she has expanded her store. Although she does not have many products, she continually works toward increasing her inventory. Her dream is to make improvements to her home.

This loan will be used to buy more materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Graciela Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Graciela L. tiene 27 años de edad, esta casada desde hace tiempo, tiene dos hijos pequeños y vive con su familia en su casa del Barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de Encarnación.
La señora Graciela es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir desde hace mas de 5 años, además de esta actividad ella junto con su esposo se dedican a la venta de pollos casero, y tienen mucha clientela de la zona de San Pedro y Encarnación. Mediante esta actividad ellos han podido mantener su hogar, educar a sus hijos y salir adelante, así también solventar cualquier gasto del hogar.
Ella hoy día esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de mas mercaderías tanto de prendas de vestir como pollos.
texts.en:
Sra. Graciela Lopez, 27, has been married for several years. She has two young children and lives with her family in the San Pedro neighborhood of Encarnacion. Sra. Graciela has earned an income selling clothing for 5 years. She and her husband also operate a business selling chicken that they prepare at home and sell to customers in the San Pedro and Encarnacion area. Thanks to this business, they have been able to pay everyday bills, educate their children and do a little better than their parents. Sra. Graciela is applying for a loan so that she can buy clothing for her clothing business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy goods for resale.

loans.name: Ntoboase Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Adwoa describes herself as a faithful woman. She is 41 years old and the leader of the “Ntoboase” (translated as Patience) borrower group made up five members. Adwoa is a merchant who has been selling gari, produced from cassava dough, for the past 5 years. She also engages in farming as her second business to make extra income. She is excited to be taking out this loan, which she plans to invest in purchasing bags of gari to serve her customers. She hopes to expand her market.  Adwoa is married to a farmer and she is the mother of four children aged 5-23. 

The other members of her group are also petty traders who sell fish, food, etc. As the leader of the group, she ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase bags of gari

loans.name: Fuzlan's Group

texts.en:
Fuzlan lives in a small city in Pakistan called Borewala, which is famous for its shrines.  She is a young lady who is 29 years of age and the mother of five children. Two of her children are going to school while the others are very young.

Her husband is a laborer and also involved in an animal selling business as well.  He started this business 2 years ago by receiving a loan from Asasah and it proved to be a profitable one for him. Now he wants to buy buffalo which he will sell for profit.

Fuzalan has applied for a loan to financially assist her husband in expanding his animal selling business.  She is hopeful that this time her experience of receiving a loan will be good as well. 

In the previous two years she never gave any complaints to Asasah regarding repayments and attended meetings regularly.

loans.use: Purchase animals for selling

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married man with three children from Lebanon. He is the main income provider for his family. He has 27 years of experience working as a farmer, having had his own farm since 1995. He uses plastic tents to grow his products. These tents also allow him to better monitor product quality as well as to grow his products for more months during the year. He works independently in his business. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed supplies for his farm and a special machine to cultivate the land. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: purchase needed supplies for his farm and a machine to cultivate the land.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old married man with two young children. He has five years of experience working with mobile phones. He began as an employee in a mobile shop and opened his own store in 2007. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his merchandise selection and purchase prepaid telephone cards to sell. The majority of mobile phone users in Lebanon purchase these prepaid cards. In the future, he is looking to further expand his business and increase his capital. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (for example, blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture and not indicating his name and location). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To increase his merchandise selection and purchase prepaid telephone cards

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is 40 years old and married with two children who attend school.  For two years, he has been operating a boda-boda (motorbike) transport business where he has employed one person.  He also grows vegetables to earn more income.  He was previously selling building materials for a living.  He appreciates Faulu Kenya for previously supporting him with capital for his business. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy another motorbike.  He hopes to own a fleet of motorbikes in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Zikriyo

texts.ru: Сайвалиев Зикриё проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 60 лет. Женат, имеет 8 детей. Сыновья на заработках в России. Сам Зикриё имеет среднее образование. Более 7 лет занимается растениеводством. Имеет земельный участок, где сеет пшеницу и выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа семян. На полученную прибыль хочет женить своего сына.
texts.en:
Zikriyo S. lives in the Yavan district. He si 60 years old, married and has 8 children. His sons work in Russia. Zikriyo has a secondary education. He has been involved in agriculture for over 7 years. He has a plot of land, where he sows wheat and grows vegetables. Zikriyo is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds. He wants to use resulting profits to marry off his son.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds

loans.name: Juana Bertha

texts.es:
la señora Juana Bertha M. tiene 50 años de edad, es soltera y tiene una hija, Juana se dedica al comercio desde hace dos años, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de verduras y otras cosas.
doña juana es una mujer seria, sencilla y honesta en sus compromisos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de zapatos, sandalias y ropa de dama y caballero.
doña Juana vive en el barrio La Ceiba de la ciudad de Nacaome.
su pasatiempo es hacer manteles, los borda con hilo de colores y le quedan muy bonitos.
texts.en:
Juana Bertha M. is 50 years old, she is single and she has a daughter. Juana has had her business for the past two years. Previously she sold vegetables and other merchandise.

Juana is formal, simple woman who is honest with her commitments. The loan will be used to purchase shoes, sandals and ladies' and gentlemen's clothing. Juana lives in the district of La Ceiba in the city of Nacaome.  

Her past-time is making tablecloths. She embroiders them using colors of various colors, making the final product very beautiful.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen M. is from the village of Bog-ong, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Helen is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, buying and selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and snack foods, in the local community. Aside from the new business of selling food and a variety of products, she also makes and sells charcoal. Helen has been in business for over 11 years, and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Helen is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase wood, sandpaper, plywood, paint, sealant, and other supplies needed to finish his work

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS DIAMANTES”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; La socia tiene 65 años de edad, ella es casada, y tiene 8 hijos, la socia tiene una tienda abarrotes desde hace 8 años; la socia atiende su tienda y ella suele levantarse a las 5 de la mañana a esperar que le traigan el pan fresco y limpiar su tienda hacer su desayuno, luego ella para esto ya tiene abierta su tiendita y coloca todo en su lugar y comienza su jornada semanal, ella descansa los domingos y cierra su tienda  a las 10 de la noche. La socia requiere comprar champan, vinos, galletas, pasas y todo lo que suele salir en la época navideña, también comprará panetones. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de sus productos navideños.

 La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “LOS DIAMANTES” community bank. The community bank is located in the the Huanchac district, located in the Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member’s name is Juana. She is 65 years old. She is married and she has 8 children. Juana has had a grocery store for 8 years. She looks after her store and usually wakes up at 5 in the morning to wait for the fresh bread and clean up around the store. She makes her breakfast, opens the store, makes sure everything is in order and starts her day. She closes the store at 10 pm and on Sundays, she rests.The member wants to buy champagne, wine, cookies, raisins and other products for Christmas. She will also buy Panettones. She is requesting the loan to invest in her Christmas product purchases.

She appreciates and values the loan and she promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of Christmas items

loans.name: Edith Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Edith Elena; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, blusas, chompas y polos, ella trae de lugares como Bolivia en forma independiente y lo lleva a las diferentes tiendas para vender la ropa, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender la ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Edith Elena, 39, is a member of the “RICCHARY CUSCO” communal bank located in Cusco district which is part of Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is single and has a son.  She alternates her daily chores with clothing sales.  She sells pants, blouses, sweaters and polo-type shirts.  She brings the merchandise from places like Bolivia independently and takes it to various stores to sell.  She’d like to have a store to sell the clothes in.  She is asking for funds to buy clothes at wholesale.

She thanks those who are part of her dream and promises to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TERESA DE JESUS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Edith; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agencia de viajes, ella tiene una agencia que atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar la agencia de viajes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Edith belongs to the 'Teresa de Jesús' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Edith is 38 years old and lives with her partner.  She has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her travel agency business.  She has a travel agency where she serves from 8.00am to 7.00pm.  Through this business she is getting her children ahead in life.  Edith would like to improve and expand her business.  She is requesting this loan to keep her travel agency running.

Edith is happy to be receiving her loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To keep her travel agency running

loans.name: Odsuren

texts.en:
Odsuren T. lives with her mother and sister in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her mother is retired and her sister helps in her consumer goods trading business. 

In 2008, she started her consumer goods trading business out of a rented stall at the local market in her town. In 2009, she moved to the central market and bought her own stall. Over the years, she has gained much business experience and has built a positive reputation among her customers and suppliers. 

Odsuren graduated from a finance university, and in the future she is planning to work for a finance company. Also, she hopes to buy a car. She is an educated businesswoman.  

Odsuren is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more goods at wholesale price to increase the inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase goods at wholesale price

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo D. is from the village of Baybay Liloy Zamboanga Del norte. He is 49 years old. Alfredo is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Alfredo owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community. Alfredo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alfredo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfredo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Alfredo from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Topurchase raw ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Juan Moisés

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Moisés S. A. él es trabajador activo del colegio público “Los Espinoza” de san pablo  desempeñándose como Docente de Educación tiene  siete  años  de trabajar para esta institución es casado  actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  siete créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para sufragar unos gastos personales de su hogar, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Juan Moises S. Aleman is an active employee of the public school named "Los Espinoza" in San Pablo. He works as a teacher and he has been working with this institution for seven years. He is married and has a school-aged son. He has had seven previous loans and they were used to purchase construction materials to expand and improve his house.  He requests this current loan to provide for some personal household expenses. The loans granted through Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) have been a great help because he has been able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: To cover some personal expenses.

loans.name: Secundino

texts.en: For the last 20 years, Mr. Secundino R. has made a living selling clothes. His wife has been in the same line of work for the last decade and specializes in women's sportswear. Mr. R. is applying for a loan to buy more clothing to sell to his customers, and wishes to thank Fundación Paraguaya  and Kiva lenders for the good service and assistance they provide to small businesses such as his.

loans.use: To buy shirts, pants, t-shirts, jeans and women's sportswear to sell to his customers

loans.name: G.s. Los Coquitos Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Los Cocos está conformado por Ery Neftali y Paz Catalina. Se han unido para realizar financiamientos, para la compra de materia prima necesaria en sus negocios. Ery se dedica a brindar el servicio de triciclo con muchos esfuerzos, tiene que realizar este negocio todos los días pues tiene que mantener a sus 2 hijos que están a su cargo. Hace más de 12 años que tiene este medio de vida, pues siempre ha trabajado con mucho sacrificio.
texts.en:
The Los Cocos communal bank’s members are Ery Neftali and Paz Catalina.  They have joined together to take out loans to buy needed raw materials for their businesses.

Ery provides tricycle services with much effort.  The work has to be done daily because there are two children to support.  He has had this means of support for over 12 years because he’s always worked with much sacrifice.

loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Betania Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha S., who is in her mid-thirties is married with two children.  She is a food vendor at a place called Ilala, some few kilometres from the small town called Kariakoo. She has been in this business for 10 years.  She works from 5:00am to 4:00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Mwanaisha's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She hopes for a loan to increase her food stock.  Her dream is to one day open a wholesale food shop.

Mwanaisha will share this loan with her loan group Bethania, which has total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable is paying back their loans.

In the picture, Mwanaisha is just in the second row, 1st from the right.

loans.use: To increase her stock of foods.

loans.name: Keng's Group

texts.en:
The four members of this group loan have selected Mrs. Keng to be the group leader. They will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Keng and her husband, Mr. Khor, are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land where they grow rice. They sell part of the rice and the rest of the rice they use to support their family. They also sell ice cream door to door. They have three children who are studying in local public school. 

Although they work hard, they can earn only a little income, so to improve this condition, Mrs. Keng is applying for a loan. She wants to buy some piglets and pig food for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy some piglets and pig food

loans.name: Nubia

texts.es:
Nubia Pérez H. es vecina de Upala de Alajuela, una de las zonas con mayor cantidad de mujeres emprendedoras.
Ella se ha dedicado siempre  a la agricultura, principalmente a la ganadería   de doble propósito.  Y es por eso que ella quiere solicitar un préstamo de ₡400 000 (cuatrocientos mil colones) para la compra de 3 toretes para cuidarlos  y luego venderlos en Subasta, aprovechando  los buenos precios. 
Asegura que con este negocio, crecerá personalmente, y con los resultados mejorara su situación económica.
Dona Nubia es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Bansuperafe, una de las 110 empresas socias de Edesa en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Nubia Pérez H. lives in Upala, in Alajuela.  This is an area with a lot of entrepreneurial women.

Nubia has always worked in agriculture, mainly raising livestock.  She would like to request a loan for 400,000 colones to buy three bulls which she will care for and then sell in Subasta, taking advantage of the good prices.  She assures us that this business will enable her to grow personally and the results will enable her to improve her financial situation.

Nubia is a member of 'Empresa de Crédito Bansuperafe', one of Edesa's 110 member companies in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, natural del distrito de Palmapampa de 42 años, es un hombre muy veraz y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Demetria de 42 años y sus 02 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano, Juan sale a trabajar a su chacra, sabe que tiene que poner todo su esfuerzo en hacer más fértil sus tierras, para poder obtener una buena cosecha. Sus productos, como la hoja de coca, el café y el cacao, los vende a los centros de acopio en la ciudad de San Francisco, donde tiene cuantiosos compradores, debido a la buena calidad de sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha paciencia, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, ya que siempre corre el riesgo de que los productos químicos le causen alguna enfermedad en lo futuro. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros para que de esa manera tenga mayor avance en cuanto a su trabajo. Con el tiempo desea comprar nuevas tierras, para aumentar su producción. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, en su primer pago fue muy puntual y espera poder serlo ahora también, es de los pocos varones de su banco comunal, por lo cual es muy apreciado por el resto de las socias. Con el crédito solicitado comprara trampas y mallas para combatir la plaga de insectos que asechan sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Juan is 42 years old and from Palmapampa district.  He is a very truthful and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 42 year-old Demetria, and his two beloved children who are the reason for all his efforts.

Every day, very early in the morning, Juan goes out to work on his farm.  He knows that he has to put all his effort into making his land fertile so that he can obtain a good harvest.  He sells his produce, such as coca leaf, coffee and cacao, in the warehouses in the city of San Francisco where he has lots of buyers owing to the good quality of his crops.

What Juan most enjoys about his work is sowing his land and he does this with a lot of patience.  He has been in this business for 20 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be spraying his land with chemicals since he runs the risk of some of the chemicals making him sick in the future.

At harvest time, Juan has the support of day laborers so that he can advance more quickly in his work.  Over time, he would like to buy new land so that he can increase his production.

This is Juan's third loan from MFP.  He was very punctual in repaying his first loan and he hopes to be punctual in repaying this loan too.  He is one of few men in his community bank, for which reason he is very much appreciated by the other members.  Juan will use his loan to buy traps and netting to fight the pests that are threatening his crops.

loans.use: to buy traps and netting

loans.name: Flores Magon Group

texts.es:
Doña Clementina pidió un préstamo a la financiera para comprar productos de abarrotes como papel higiénico, refresco, aceite, chiles en vinagre, huevo, arroz, también vende un poco de carnes frías, y dulces de diferentes sabores; comenta que los días jueves y viernes vende cenas como pozole y corundas (comida de la región) ella tiene su tienda desde hace baproximadamente 13 años y emprendió este negocio por que una señora que era su vecina vendía abarrotes y se cambio de casa y no había cerca de ahí otra tienda entonces doña Clementina se le ocurrió poner una mesita de dulces y poco a poco fue invirtiendo en sus abarrotes y de ahí fue surtiendo, dice que gracias a los prestamos que le ha realizado la financiera ella a incrementado sus ganancias ya que ha surtido artículos que no vendía. Ella surte sus productos en diferentes tiendas de su población, ella esta casada con el señor Leonel el cual es empleado de una empresa panadera, ellos tuvieron 3 hijos todos ellos ya casados. La meta que tiene doña Clementina es poner un local especial para su tienda de abarrotes ya que tiene unos anaqueles en la sala de su casa.

Las otras diez integrantes del grupo son Maria Socorro, Reyna, Isabel, Stephanie, Patricia, Magdalena, Rocio, Vianey, Teresa y Marisol ellas pidieron sus prestamo para invertirlo en una tienda de ropa,compra de dulces para su venta,venta de comida,invertir en tienda de abarrotes,compra de material de hacer prendas de vestir, zapatos por catalogo,joyeria fina, antojitos mexicanos y para comprar ropa por catalogo.
texts.en:
Clementina requested a loan from the financial institution to buy groceries such as toilet paper, soft drinks, oil, chilis in vinegar, eggs and rice.  She also sells some cold meats and different sweet treats.  She tells us that on Thursdays and Fridays she sells dinners such as 'pozole' and 'corundas' (meals from her region). 

Clementina has owned her grocery store for approximately 13 years and started the business because a neighbor of hers used to sell groceries.  Her neighbor moved house and there wasn't another store nearby.  Clementina therefore thought to set up a table selling sweet treats.  She gradually invested in groceries and stocked her business.  She says that, thanks to her loans from the institution, she has increased her profits as she has managed to stock up with items that she didn't used to sell.  She supplies her products to different stores in her town.

Clementina is married to Leonel who works for a company that makes baked goods.  They have three children who are all married.  Clementina's goal is to open special premises for her grocery store since right now she only has some shelves in her living room.

The other ten members of the group are Maria Socorro, Reyna, Isabel, Stephanie, Patricia, Magdalena, Rocio, Vianey, Teresa and Marisol.  They requested their loans to invest in a clothes store, to buy sweet treats to sell, to sell meals, to invest in a grocery store, to buy materials for making clothes, to buy catalog shoes, to buy jewelry, to make Mexican snacks and to buy catalog clothes.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is a widow with a teenage son. Natalya lives in Novomoskovsk. She is a market vendor selling boots, galoshes, rubber boots and valenki (felt boots). Natalya owns a kiosk in the central marketplace in her hometown. She has been in this business for 10 years. Her investment in inventory amounts to 50,000 Grivnyas. Her net profit is about 6,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Natalya is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase summer footwear. She is hoping to attract new customers with additional merchandise. Eventually she hopes to save enough to help her son through college. Her son lives with her at the moment. Natalya is the only breadwinner in her family.

loans.use: to purchase summer footwear

loans.name: Samarik

texts.en: Samarik has been a farmer for the last three years. He is 23 years old, single, and supports his parents. He learned about KADET from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area. This is his third loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to us it to purchase farm supplies. He intends to use the returns from the loan to reinvest in farming and buy a bigger farm. His dream is to be the best farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Kholisakhon

texts.en:
An honest and hardworking woman, Kholisakhon has been processing dried fruit for three years, assisted by her family. In season she purchases about 6000-6500 kg of fresh fruits and after processing gets 1200 kg of dried fruit and 600 kg of ossicles (pits). From profits earned last year she purchased furniture for her house. Kholisakhon is now requesting a loan of 5000 TJS to purchase fresh apricots for processing.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fresh apricots.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Mariama. She is married and has two children aged twelve and nine. She has three additional dependents, her younger sisters, who live with her because they are going to school.

In 1996, Mariama established her palm oil business. Before this she had sold ginger cake, then food stuff items, then finally landed in palm oil sales. Working seven days a week and thirteen hours a day, she serves between five to twenty customers a day. She earns about 700,000 SLL every month.

Mariama would like a loan of 3,500,000 SLL to buy additional palm oil. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Mariama plans to be an agent for one of the soap-making factories in the east.

She comments, “I was nervous that the high cost of palm oil would bring few profits, and that there was so much competition for the same commodity. But with my training at the A.R.D. workshop before acquiring my loan, I will put in practice what I have learned. I have the confidence that my profit margin will increase, thus taking me to a brighter future.”

Mariama thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for additional palm oil.

loans.name: Muwoyia Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Muwoyia” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Kenema city in eastern Sierra Leone.  They are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to further improve on the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Pictured in the right is Fatmata, who is the leader of this group. Fatmata was born in Segebana. She is married to a trader and the couple has 4 children attending primary school.

Fatmata sells clothes and has been a businesswoman for many years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying large quantities of clothes to add to her business.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 24 years old, married and has three children.

Hanaa has been a tailor since 2009. She makes and repairs women’s and men’s clothing. She has a deep understanding of the local consumer, good experience and is well known in her area.

She decided to apply for a $2400 loan to purchase a tailoring machine and to add more inventories such as tissues and sewing supplies. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine, tissues and sewing supplies

loans.name: La Alborada Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad D. Santaní se unen 10 amigas y vecinas con el objetivo D. generar ingresos para que D. esa manera cada una D. ellas puedan ayudar o sustentar los gastos D. la casa. Ellas se definen como mujeres muy luchadoras y trabajadoras, el sueño D. todas ellas es que sus familiares tengan un mejor estilo D. vida y que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro del que ellas tuvieron.
La Señora Rosa se dedica a la cría D. cerdos, ella se dedica a esto hace ya muchos años. Gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar con la manutención D. la casa. Comenta que tiene mucha clientela, ya que a la hora D. faenar los cerdos vienen muchas personas. Uno D. sus sueños es tener una granja granD. donD. pueda tener más animales.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. animales y también para la compra D. balanceados para los mismos. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, ya que D. obtener el crédito, este le será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
In the city of Santaní, 10 friends and neighbors have come together with the purpose of creating income so that that way each one of them can be able to help with or proviD. for their home expenses. They define themselves as strong, hard-working women. Each one dreams that her relatives will have a better way of life and that her children will have a better future than she did. 
Sra. Rosa raises pigs, and has spent many years raising them. Thanks to this work, she has been able to get ahead and help with household costs. She comments that she has many customers, since many people come when it is time to slaughter the pigs. One of her dreams is to have a large farm where she can have more animals.
She requests the loan to buy animals and also to buy healthy feed for them. She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity this loan gives her, since the loan will proviD. her with lots of help.

loans.use: To buy animals and healthy feed for them.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a 51-year-old woman. She is married and has three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a municipality employee with a decent salary. In addition, he works as a taxi driver to improve the family income. Nawal has a taxi that takes internal and external requests. She wants to pay the taxi insurance fees and make some internal finishing to her house such as putting down tiles, painting the walls, etc. The money Nawal has isn't enough to pay for all these expenses, so she is in need of a loan of 2,000 from FATEN.

When Nawal gets the FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will pay the insurance fees for the taxi. That will help her husband who is the taxi driver to work extra hours and take more requests, which will improve the family's source of income. In addition, Nawal will pay to make some finishing to her house. Then she and her family will live in better conditions. Nawal is a religious conservative woman so her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: To pay for taxi insurance fees and house finishing expenses.

loans.name: Divina Misericordia Group

texts.es:
El comité Divina Misericordia se conformo gracias a la iniciativa de una de las miembros del comité. Actualmente cuenta con 12 miembros, y se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya. Ellas se denominan como mujeres luchadoras, trabajadoras que diariamente luchan por el bienestar de sus familias. Ellas han aprendido a valorar la comunicación en el grupo y en la sociedad, son incentivadas a realizar actividades para aumentar más sus ingresos económicos, y para ver el fruto de sus sacrificios están aprendiendo a ahorrar un poco de sus ganancias para usos futuros.
Una de las miembros es la señora Elsi, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles desde hace ya mucho tiempo, gracias a este trabajo ella ha logrado salir adelante y mantenerse y mantener a su familia. Comenta que tiene una clientela bien definida que siempre compran de ella, ya que siempre le dicen que tiene muy buena sazón.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, pollo verduras y otros para la elaboración de los alimentos que venderá. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
The Divina Misericordia committee was formed thanks to the initiative of one of the committee members. Currently it has 12 members and is in the first cycle of the women entrepreneurs program of Fundación Paraguaya. They define themselves as fighting women, hard workers that fight daily for the well-being of their families. They have learned to value the communication in the group and in society. They are motivated to undertake activities that will augment more their monetary income and, to see the fruits of their sacrifices, are learning to save part of their income for future uses.
One of the members is Elsi. She has sold food for a long time already. Thanks to this work, she has managed to get ahead and support herself and her family. She says that she has a well-defined customer base that always buys from her, since they always tell her that she is an excellent cook.
She is requesting the loan to buy meat, chicken, vegetables and other items to prepare the food that she will sell. She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity that it provides her.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables and other items to prepare food.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man who has 5 children ranging from 8 to 24 years old.  He describes himself as efficient and trustworthy. 

He operates a metal shop where he makes and sells gates, doors and windows.  He has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 2 staff members. 

He says his biggest business challenge is financial.  He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase steel to grow his business and to meet the demands of customers. His goal is to grow into a big welding business.  Joseph also plans to purchase a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: to buy steel.

loans.name: Abesamihigo/ Nybshnj Group

texts.fr:
Private fait partie du groupe Abesamihigo. Le nom du groupe signifie « performers ». Il a 64 ans et il est marié avec 7 enfants de 14 à 42 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 

Private est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est l’utilisation d’engrais chimiques. Dans les prochaines années, Private voudrait être vendeur de riz dans son district. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Private is part of the group Abesamihigo/Nyabishunju. The group's name means "performers." He is 64 years old and is married with seven children between the ages of 14 and 42, three of whom are in school. His education level is six years of elementary school. 

Private is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming.

His strategy for the growth of his business is the use of chemical fertilizers. In the coming years, Private would like to be the rice salesman in his district. With the profits, he foresees educating and caring for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante 1, 2 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Xiomara is the coordinator of Con Dios Adelante 1, 2 & 6 (Forward with God). This group is made up of fifteen micro-entrepreneur women and it is located in the city of La Romana, a rural area of the country dedicated to the harvest of sugar cane, in a batey founded for sugar cane workers, especially for Haitians.

Xiomara lives with her long-term partner and her three children. She says that her most important challenges are to continue improving her business and to provide change for her family. By having the loans and investing them, she is expanding her business and getting more clients. She enjoys working and cooking for her family.

She is running a miscellaneous sales business where she sells cosmetics, shoes, clothes, and other items. She will use her loan to purchase many items to increase her business’ inventory. She is excited to receive her fifth loan with Esperanza. She has been part of this group for almost 3 years and with each loan she has been able to improve her business. With her business profits, she has been able to save and reinvest in her business when she needs to buy bigger orders. Xiomara thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, shoes, clothes, and other items.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa De Jesús tiene 28 años se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo. Tiene más de 10 años con esta actividad, pues gracias a su gran esfuerzo es que ha obtenido lo necesario para brindarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cerdos que son necesarios para su negocio. Ella es una mujer muy responsable espera que su negocio mejore cada día. Sueña con brindarle a su hijo lo necesario para que pueda ser una persona de bien.
texts.en: Teresa De Jesus, 28, operates a business raising and selling pigs.  She has operated the business for more than 10 years and, thanks to her efforts, has managed to earn enough to support her family.  She will use this loan to buy more pigs.  Teresa is a responsible women with high hopes for her business.  What she most wants in the world is to give her son whatever he needs to become the best he can be.

loans.use: to buy pigs for her animal-sales business.

loans.name: Sengetiti Facal Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sengetiti Facal Group in Western Kenya! Carol is the facilitator of the Sengetiti Facal group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Carol takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Carol had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Carol was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Carol and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance

With income from his maize sales, Carol will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Sengetiti Facal group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The person standing on the far left in the photograph is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Chambikwe Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Chambikwe Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Francis is the facilitator of the Chambikwe Group. He takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Francis had an excellent maize yield harvesting sixteen bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Francis was only able to harvest four bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Francis and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Francis will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Chambikwe Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
The photograph shows Francis and his group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is a married mom of two children and a successful entrepreneur, too. 

She sells women's clothing merchandise in one of the Novaya Kahovka malls called "Central." Svetlana has assorted inventory and always tries to introduce unique items to her selection of products to keep a stable position in the market competition. Svetlana has been in this business for 11 years. 

Currently, she has 26,000 UAH in working capital. Her net profit amounts to 5,000 UAH. Svetlana is seeking a loan of 20,000 UAH to increase assorted merchandise. Svetlana is a very energetic person. She finds time for family, business and personal growth.

loans.use: to increase assorted merchandise,

loans.name: Ilyn

texts.en:
Ilyn is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Ilyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Ilyn became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Ilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Yenni Asuncion

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita está llena de muchas historias aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Yenni, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos,  dos mayores y uno de 11 años de edad, todos viven con ella y estudian dos en universidad y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es jardinero.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que además tiene una pequeña ferretería, allí vende productos   como tubos, material para instalaciones sanitaras, eléctricas, de arreglos de casa y muchas otras cosas de ferretería,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan cuando están desocupados,  tiene en su negocio ya por 10 años y dice que  este negocio lo heredo de su papá que falleció y después de esto le dejo su negocio.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su negocio, va a comprar, tubos, materiales eléctricos, sanitarios y materiales para construcción. Es fundadora del  Banco Comunal,  es la fiscal de reglamentos del grupo y le gusta porque sus compañeras son excelentes personas.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Picoaza is listed in the books as one of the aboriginal towns in the Manteña culture. This urban parish is located only ten minutes from the capital of Portoviejo. Manabita is full of many stories. The members of Banco Comunal María Asunción meet here every 2 weeks. 

In this place we meet Yenni, who is 47 years old and married. They have three children, two older ones and one who is 11 years old. All of them live with her and are students, two are in university and the youngest is in school. Her husband is a gardener.

She is a good housewife and she also has a small hardware shop. There she sells products such as pipes, supplies for bathroom installations, electrical goods, and household repairs and many other hardware items. She works every day from 6:00AM until 10:00PM and sometimes later. Her children and her husband help her when they are unemployed. She has had her shop for ten years and she says that she inherited this business from her father who died and left it to her.

The money from this loan is going to be used to supply her store. She is going to buy pipes, electrical goods, bathroom and construction materials. She is a founding member of the communal bank. She likes the financial regulations of the group because her partners are good people.

Her goal is to get ahead in her business.

loans.use: to buy pipes, electrical supplies, bathroom and building materials

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es una mujer luchadora de 33 años de edad, el vive en la ciudad de Nasca, Perú. La ciudad es famosa por la legendaria Líneas de Nazca, una serie de antiguos, inmenso e inexplicable geroglíficos  grabados en el desierto que rodea la ciudad, generalmente atribuidos a la cultura Nazca, que habitaron en la región de 300 a 800 AD. Como tal, la ciudad atrae a una cantidad considerable de turismo. Pero Nazca también es conocida por su gente trabajadora, que han conservado  la calma a pesar de los frecuentes terremotos, tsunamis, y un alto nivel de pobreza en la región. Delia es conviviente, su pareja trabaja actualmente como recepcionista en un Hotel de su ciudad, el cual la apoya mucho en todo lo que ella emprende y sobre todo que juntos aportan en los gastos del hogar, asimismo juntos tienen 2 hijos, el mayor tiene 9 años de edad y cursa el segundo año de primaria y el menor tiene 2 años, no va a la escuela por lo pequeño que es pero es muy travieso y jugueton, nos comenta Delia.

Delia se dedica a su negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas y cervezas, viene trabajando en este negocio alrededor de 1 año, el cual ha tenido el apoyo constante de su esposo, quien fue que la animo ya que esta clase de negocio tenia acogida en su barrio, y porque quería un trabajo que le permitiera estar cerca a sus hijos ya que quería estar muy al pendiente de ellos. Delia labora en su negocio alrededor de 8 horas diarias, pero los fines de semana labora hasta 12 horas ya que hay mayor movimiento en la venta de estos productos por estos días.

Delia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá compara materiales para construir un Kiosco (bodega) en las afueras de la casa de su suegra, esta mejora ayudara mucho en su negocio ya que tendrá un mejor espacio para colocar sus productos y sean mejor vistos por los clientes, asimismo le generara mayores ingresos y con ello seguirá ahorrando para mas adelante cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia y sobre todo darle una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Delia is a determined 33-year-old woman who lives in the city of Nasca, Perú.  The city is famous for the legendary Líneas de Nazca (Nazca Lines), a series of ancient, immense and unexplainable hieroglyphics carved in the desert that surrounds the city.  Generally they are attributed to the Nazca culture that inhabited the region between 300 and 800 AD.  As such, the city attracts considerable tourism.  But Nazca is also known for its hard-working people who have remained calm despite the frequent earthquakes, tsunamis and high level of poverty in the region.  Delia's common-law husband who works as a receptionist at a hotel in the city.  He supports her in everything she does and together they take care of the household expenses.  They have two children, the eldest of which is 9 and in second grade.  The youngest is 2 and too young for school but, according to Delia, he is mischievous and playful.

Delia sells sodas and beer for a living and has been in business for about a year.  She has had constant support from her husband who encouraged her to get started since this type of business is well received in the neighborhood.  Her work also allows her to be near her children.  She works about eight hours a day and on weekends sometimes up to 12 hours because of the high demand.

Delia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since their support has helped her buy materials to build a convenience store outside her mother-in-law's house.  This will enhance the business greatly since there will be much more space for product display for the benefit of the customers.  It will also increase her income so he can continue to save for her future goal which is: "To have her own house and, especially, give her children a good quality of life".

loans.use: To build a convenience store.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: La señora Graciela de 33 años es madre de 2 hijos que solo dependen de ella, ya que por razones ajenas a ella se tuvo que separar de su marido. Graciela inicio con un negocio de agua Purificada que vende en galones de 5 litros y distribuye por toda la ciudad, este negocio es su única fuente de ingresos por tal motivo quiere comprar mercancía como tapones, plásticos, desinfectantes profesionales para que su agua tenga las mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Graciela is 33 years old. She has 2 children and she alone is economically responsible for them, as she and her husband are separated because of circumstances that lay outside of her power. Graciela started an activity selling purified water by the gallon, and she distributes water all over her town. This activity is her only source of income, and for this reason she wants to buy products such as caps, plastic bottles and professional disinfectants to keep the water she sells in the best conditions.

loans.use: To buy caps, plastic bottles and professional disinfectants.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en: Benon used the previous loan to buy goats, maize and pay school fees for his children. He has been dealing in maize sales for a long time and this has enabled him to buy land to grow crops and provide basics to his family. He says that the maize business is still lucrative since there is a ready market in South Sudan and Congo. His major challenges are high transportation costs and taxes while his dreams are setting up a food store in town and educating his children.Benon is requesting a loan facility to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Balcones Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO BALCONES ESTA INTEGRADO POR 5 INTEGRANTES,ELLAS SON CLIENTES DE DE HACE VARIOS CICLOS EN CREDITUYO, 
ELLAS SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO.
ESTE GRUPO ESTA INTEGRADO POR DORA,GLORIA,LIDIA ANEL Y MARTHA EN ESTE CASA HABLAREMOS DE MARTHA, 
ELLA SE DEDICA ALA VENTA DE ROPA USADA EN LOS MERCADOS, EL PRESATAMO LO PIENSA UTLIZAR EN COMPRAR UNA ESTRAUCTURA MAS GRANDE, YA QUE QUIERE AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO,EL SUEÑO DE MARTHA ES, LLEGAR A TENER UNA BOUTIQUE GRANDE EN EL CENTRO DE LA CIUDAD. YA QUE AL ESTAR VENDIENDO EN LOS MERCADOS RODANTES, NO VENDE LO QUE ELLA QUISIERA COMO EN EL CASO DE TEMPÓRADA DE LLUVIA.
texts.en:
The group “Balcones” has five members.  They have been clients of Credituyo through several loan cycles.  They are merchants.  The members of this group are Dora, Gloria, Lidia, Anel and Martha.
                
In this case we will talk about Martha.  She sells used clothing in markets.  She is planning to use the loan to purchase a larger stall because she would like to expand her business.  Martha's dream is to acquire a large boutique in the middle of the city. Given that she sells in street markets, she doesn't sell as much as she would like, especially during the rainy season.

loans.use: to purchase a large stall.

loans.name: Nonvigbe Allodo-Allome 3 Group

texts.fr: NONVIGBE ALLODO-ALLOME 3 est un groupement composé de quatorze personnes qui sont résident dans un même quartier. Joséphine, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 55 ans a très peu fréquenté l’école. Joséphine est mariée à un certain Pierre. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Joséphine vit seule avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Joséphine vend divers produits (savon, sucre, lait etc) et des produits vivriers dans sa boutique depuis dix huit ans environ. De façon secondaire, Joséphine vend également des sacs de charbon de bois ; ce qui lui permet de répondre facilement aux besoins de ses enfants. Joséphine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Joséphine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGBE ALLODO-ALLOME 3 un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des divers produits et des produits vivriers.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha is 28 years old land lady at Mwamlai, Mombasa Kenya. A mother of four, she has been in this business for the last two years doing well and the husband provides her with additional income.

This is her first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business, she will use the money to purchase water cans for storing water, the anticipated  profit to expand her put  up additional tanks. She hopes to own a successful business in future.

loans.use: to purchase water cans for storing water

loans.name: Narish

texts.en:
Narish has an ability to buy the best  perfumery. Her clients are very pleased to buy the  perfumery from her shop. She is very polite with all her clients. Narish settled in the building of Sevinj  nursery school in Khirdalan town. She is 44 year old, married, has 2 children, Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Jabrail region . She supports to her family to be engaged in this business for 7 years. 
Narish decided to apply for a loan $300 in order to busy with retail trade. 
For the second time she borrowed the loan of $600 and varied the perfumery.
For third time she borrowed the loan $1000 in order to rent the shop.
Now she wants to open her own  perfumery. She is optimistic that her business will improve.

loans.use: To open her own  perfumery

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Mrs. Nancy A. works selling children's shoes. She has worked in this field for more than 30 years. Her sales stand is located in Graneros Street in the city of La Paz, a popular commercial street where all types of products are sold. She lives in her own house in the Villa Nuevo Potosí area. She lives alone. The income from her business allows her to cover her living expenses. She has one employee with her in the business.

Mrs. A. has worked with Impro for 10 years and with her existing credit history she is able to access another loan, since her experience in her business will give her the earnings with which to pay back her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Nancy A., se dedica a la venta de calzados para niños, trabajando en esta actividad hace mas de 30 años; su puesto de venta esta ubicado en la calle Graneros de la ciudad de La Paz, una calle de comercio popular donde se comercializan todo tipo de productos. Vive en casa propia en la calle 3 de mayo de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí, y vive sola, esta fuente de ingreso le permite poder cubrir sus gastos de subsistencia. Para el desempeño de su trabajo cuenta con una empleada.

Trabaja con Impro 10 años, y de acuerdo a su antecedente crediticio puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Akhigbe

texts.en: A young dynamic Mrs. Akhigbe B. speaks with zealousness when talking about the impact of LAPO loan on her business. According to her, ‘money is business.’ She knew this from the changes she had when she got her first loan from LAPO. She disclosed her desired to have the above amount for her business

loans.use:
To buy more drink & plastic
coolers to sell

loans.name: Saidahon

texts.ru:
Hakima has an unusual profession for her age – she embroiders with gold thread. People call her profession “gold seamstress.” The process of sewing is difficult and requires special effort. Hakima learned this skill as soon as she finished school by becoming an apprentice to one of the masters of the neighborhood. Her persistant character helped Hakima to quickly learn the profession and she can now embroider complicated patterns independently. She makes women’s cardigans, national Tajik hats, pillows, etc. Demand for her goods is very strong and she earns good profits.

A year ago, after having learned about MLF MicroInvest, Hakima came with her mother and after studying the loan terms decided to take a loan to expand her business. She used the loan to get supplies. Since then she has regularly taken loans and has expanded her business substantially. Recently, she bough an extra sewing machine and grew her production of finished goods. She would like to use the new loan to get additional supplies.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

Хакима занимается необычным для ее возраста делом - она вышивает золотыми нитями. В народе ее профессия так и называется «золотошвея». Процесс шитья сложный и требует особого старания. Хакима научилась этому сразу же после окончания школы поступив в ученики к одной из мастериц района. Хваткий характер позволил Хакиме быстро научится этой профессии и сейчас она самостоятельно вышивает сложные узоры. Наименование изделий несколько – женские кофты, национальные таджикские тюбетейки, подушки и т.д. Спрос на ее изделия очень хороший и Хакима получает от этого занятия хорошую прибыль.
