Год назад узнав о Микроинвест она пришла вместе с матерью и изучив условия кредитования решила взять займ на расширение своего бизнеса. Займ она потратила на приобретение сырья для своих изделий. С тех пор регулярно получая займы она значительно расширила свой бизнес. Недавно она купила дополнительную швейную машинку и выход готовых изделий возрос намного. Новый займ она опять хочет потратить на приобретение сырья.

loans.use: for the further expansion of business

loans.name: María Yolanda

texts.es:
37 year old María B. is an enthusiastic, cheerful entrepreneur who has had a tough life. She lost her parents when she was 3 and was raised by an aunt and uncle, but because of her adventurous spirit she decided to leave her native village, Taraco, at the age of 13 with the intention of making a prosperous future for herself.

She has been working in different activities but at the present Doña María is living in Juliaca where she has been selling the products of Omnilife (nutrition) and Unique (cosmetics) for the last two years. She works on her own, she has no specific schedule or place to sell her products from and the loan of $325 will be used to set up a sales stand so she can offer the products in comfortable and secure surroundings. The loan will be repaid in 6 months and your generosity will really help Doña María to move ahead and improve her life quality.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

María B. tiene 37 años de edad es entusiasta, alegre y muy emprendedora desafortunadamente la vida la golpeó mucho, perdió a sus padres a la edad de 3 años y desde entonces quedó al cuidado de sus tíos, cuando cumplió 13 años como toda adolescente con un gran espíritu aventurero decidió salir de su pueblo natal Taraco con la intención de labrarse un futuro más próspero. María, desde que llegó a Juliaca, ciudad donde actualmente radica, tuvo que esforzarse mucho para salir adelante; se dedicó desde muy joven a diversas actividades y oficios y hace aproximadamente 2 años incursionó en la venta de productos nutritivos de la prestigiosa marca Omnilife. Actualmente también se dedicada a ofrecer productos de belleza de la línea Unique con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos personales. No tiene un horario establecido de trabajo, ofrece sus productos en forma ambulatoria, y su mayor deseo es ampliarlo y tener un puesto seguro de venta para sus productos con el fin de desenvolverse de manera cómoda y segura. Para poder cumplir con sus objetivos solicita un préstamo de 325 dólares, dinero que invertirá en su negocio y promete devolver este préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses. Tu generosidad puede ayudar a María.

loans.use: Desea el préstamo para  ampliar su negocio ..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a shed for unfired bricks and to buy wood used in firing the bricks

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María Magdalena D. is a single woman with five children, four of which are of school age. Her children have been her reason for living and it is for them that she has striven, providing them an education so that they will have a better standard of living in the future.

Seventeen years ago, she sold tortillas, nevertheless she found a better opportunity in her path and through this she began her business selling clothing. She buys at wholesale and sells at retail.

This business is one of the most prominent today. Her sales have increased over the years. Currently, with the revenue she has earned, she has a fixed spot which she has been expanding and improving considerably. Her initial capital was C$20,000.00 (Cordobas) which came from savings.

María Magdalena has worked with CEPRODEL for two years. She feels very satisfied since the credits she has been granted were provided at an opportune moment helping her fulfill necessities for the business and satisfy her customers daily. She has a record of 20 credits.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

María Magdalena D. es una mujer soltera con cinco hijos, de los los cuales cuatro se encuentran en edad escolar. Sus hijos han sido la razón de vivir y por ello es que ella se ha esforzado, brindandoles asi una eduación para el futuro de ellos mejorando asi su nivel de vida.

Hace 17 años se dedicaba a venta de tortillas, sin embargo logro una mejor oportunidad en su camino y fue asi que ella da inicio a su negocio de venta de ropa donde compra al mayorista y vende al detalle,.

Este negocio es uno de los más destacados hoy en día sus ventas han incrementado al paso de los años antes colocaba el producto con abonos diarios, actualmente tiene puesto fijo con los ingresos obtenidos ya que ella ha ido ampliandodolo y mejorando considerablemente. Su inicio capital fue C $ 20,000.00 (Córdobas)los cuales eran de ahorro.

María Magdalena trabajo con CEPRODEL desde hace dos años y se siente muy satisfecha ya que los creditos que se le han otorgado brindados estos en momento oportuno ayudandola asi a suplir necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un recor de 20 creditos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is into the sales of clothes. She is 44 years old, married with 2 children. She is the secretary of her union. She is asking for the loan of $450 to buy more clothes to sell. She learned the business for 12 months and has been in it since 1998.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more hotel equipment

loans.name: Hotensia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 40 year old Hotensia M.. She is married with five children, between 8 months and 19 years old.

In 2006, Hotensia established a cake business. Working seven days a week for more than 16 hours a day and assisted by her sister and one employee, she earns about $520.00 per month from this business. She now requires a loan to purchase aprons and ingredients, such as eggs, butter, and sugar in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $175.00. In the future, Hotensia also plans to diversify her business, and employ more staff. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients in bulk to make more cakes

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria is a young entrepreneur. She is 32, married and the mother of three children - the oldest being a 16 years old girl and two boys aged 12 and 2 years old. The girl and the oldest boy are attending school and they are distinguished students due to their sense of responsibility and good grades.

They have lived in their own home for over ten years. They were able to own this house thanks to her effort and her husband dedication to succeed in life and provide a good education for their children. Her husband sells different kinds of merchandise in the city's local market, while Maria sells men's and women's clothing through orders.

Since Encarnacion borders the city of Posadas, Argentina, her main customers belong to the neighboring country. They place the orders and she takes the merchandise to them in either small or large quantities.

Maria says that profits have helped her save and cover family's expenses, that is the reason she constantly wishes to increase merchandise stock so that she can fulfill the orders placed by her growing clientele. This time she is requesting a credit line in order to purchase more merchandise such as, jeans pants, skirts, t-shirts, blouses, socks, shoes and others.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Maria es una joven mujer emprendedora de 32 años, casada y madre de tres hijos, la mayor de 16 años y dos varones de 12 y 2 años. Los hijos mayores ya van al colegio, y se destacan por su responsabilidad y buenas calificaciones.

Ellos viven en su casa propia hace mas de 10 años, casa que pudieron adquirir gracias al esfuerzo de ella y su marido que lucha día a día junto a ella para salir adelante y darle la mejor educación a sus hijos. Su marido se dedica a la venta de distintos tipos de mercaderías en el mercado municipal de la ciudad, mientras que María se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas y caballeros bajo pedido. Ya que la ciudad de Encarnación limita con la ciudad de Posadas – Argentina, sus principales clientes son del vecino país, ya que ellos le realizan los pedidos y ella los lleva para venderlos ya se en poca o en grandes cantidades.

María dice que sus ganancias la han ayudado bastante a ahorrar y con los gastos de la familia, es por eso que constantemente ella desea ampliar su stock de mercaderías de modo a abastecer los pedidos de su creciente clientela. Hoy día ella esta solicitando un crédito con el que podrá comprar mercaderías como jeans, faldas, camisas, remeras, ropa para otoño, medias, algunos calzados, entre otros.

loans.use: Purchase clothing for retail.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Mrs.Martha belongs to the Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, located in the Calleria District of Ucayali Department. She is 46 years old, a mother of two, married, and her husband is a gym instructor. The income from her husband was insufficient to make ends meet so Martha decided to invest in a small gym with a loan from Manuela Ramos.

With the loans she has been able to equip her gym and her clientele has increased. She offers flexible operating hours and payment schemes which have turned her gym into one of the busiest in her city. She is able to do this with the support of her husband and her children.

Her loan will be payed back in four months and she will use it to purchase more equipment to perform the various exercises needed by her clients.

Martha feels at ease in her communal bank because they help her to purchase the equipment needed for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Purchase equipment for her business

loans.name: Epenesa Auega's Group

texts.en:
Gautavai Center was started in April 2008. These ladies heard from the group at their
neighbor and then they came to the office for requirements. They are one of the largest 
groups in the programme the number of 19 and they already received their first loans. 
They are starting well and some of them have businesses started and getting more. They 
have different businesses like (sewing, shop, vegetable garden, pancake, etc…. and they 
are making good of the opportunity.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, wheel barrow, weed killer, weed spray, bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa Maria is married and has two children, ages 19 and 10. She started her business when her son entered high school, and they had no money to cover his expenses. It was then, 4 years ago, that she decided to open a small store in her home with the help of her sisters but was not selling much. Little by little, she started purchasing merchandise and her sales began increasing. Her store is now bigger, and she generates a higher income.

She needs a loan for US $500, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase more merchandise and maintain her store stocked. With your help, Rosa will continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Maria es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 10 años. Inició el negocio porque su hijo entro a la preparatoria y no tenían dinero para solventar los gastos por lo que haced 4 años decidió poner una pequeña tienda en su casa ya que inicio con ayuda de sus hermanas pero vendía muy poquito, poco a poco fue comprando mercancía y sus ventas se empezaron a incrementar, ahora su tienda es mas grande y le genera buenos ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar más mercancía y tener surtida su tienda. Con tu ayuda rosa seguirá haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise and maintain her store stocked.

loans.name: Bakusekamajja Women's Group

texts.en:
L. Maritine has been the chair of Bakusekamajja women's group in Jinja for the last eight years. She is 50 years old, married with four children and also cares for eight orphans. For a living, she makes malwa, a local brew and delicacy among the people of her tribe. She also sells dried fish at her home.

Making malwa takes times and begins by mixing millet flour with water and putting it underground for several days to ferment. Then it is boiled and dried in the sun to rid it of any water. More mixing, drying and grinding is required before it becomes a beverage which is placed in pots from which people drink with straws. This is a good business to be in because people prize the way in which malwa creates a spirit of togetherness and sharing.

Maritine needs a loan to buy more dried fish to sell at her stall and more materials for making malwa. She dreams of starting a business making and selling waragi, another local drink, with a future loan.

loans.use: Lulua Maritine needs a loan to be able to buy more dry fish for sell at her stall as well as buying the malwa making materials like millet flour and a metallic basin for roasting.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a 38-year-old married mother of 3 children. She lives with her family in Likoni, Mombasa, Kenya. She is the proprietor of a salon, which she started in 1993 out of her small savings. Owing to the increase in the number of clients served, Catherine has applied for US$500 to enable her to renovate her salon to create more space.

loans.use: To renovate her salon to create more space

loans.name: El Hato Group

texts.es:
hola nosotras somos el Grupo el HATO, yo Griselda Argentina P. de 45 años de edad soy la coordinadora del grupo y tengo un gimnasio en la colonia el Hato el cual me genera recursos para poder asumir los compromisos de mi hogar y otros compromisos que tengo, junto a mi negocio esta la Sra. Maria A. de 49 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de pasteles los cuales ella elabora en su casa de habitacion y los vende de forma ambulante. 
La. Sra. Ingrid B. de 30 años de edad cuenta con un negocio de venta de tortillas las cuales las vende en la colonia villanueva, junto a ella esta la Sra. Eduarda Concepcion F. de 47 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de helados y paletas en un local de la colonia el Hato y la Sra Sonia P. de 45 años de edad cuenta con  una cafeteria ubicada en las instalaciones de la Anafut en la colonia tepeyac, cabe mencionar que cn el esfuerzo que realizamos todas hemos logrado darle a nuestras familias el sustento de alimentacion, salud y educacion, nosotros tenemos mas de 10 años luchando como comerciantes y mas de 5 años como vecinos de nuestra comunidad.
texts.en:
We are the group El Hato. I am Griselda Argentina P., 45 years old. I am the coordinator of the group and have a gym in the colony El Hato which generates income that allows me to attend to the needs of my home and my other obligations. With me is Mrs. Maria A. who is 49 years old. She sells cakes which she makes in her home and sells as a street vendor. Mrs. Ingrid B. is 30 years old and has a business selling tortillas in the Villanueva colony. Next to her is Mrs. Eduarda Concepcion F., 47 years old, who sells ice crean and fruit popcicles in a the El Hato colony. Mrs. Sonia P., 45 years old, has a coffe shop located in in the locales of Anafut in the Tepeyac colony. It is worth mentioning, that with the efforts that we all put forth, we have been able to provide for our families the necessary support for food, health and education. We have more than 10 years of experience struggling as business people and more than 5 years as neighbors in our community.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for various businesses

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny M., 35, and her husband, Mr. Sopheap Chea, 39, who live along National Road Number One about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1990 and have four children, one son and three daughters. All their children study in local school.

Mrs. Ny has been farming for many years. She grows cabbages and spinaches in the farm near her house. She sells her products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband cooks for wedding ceremony and other ceremony in the village and in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Ny is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a water pumping machine, seed, fertilizer, and pesticide for her vegetables farm.

loans.use: To purchase one water pumping machine, seed, fertilizer, and pesticide for faming business.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del centro poblado de Chimbo del distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo. Tiene 44 años, es casada y madre de 4 hijos, 2 viven con ella, estudio el sexto grado de Primaria. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro 01 ganado vacuno (vaca) para engorde. Antes de iniciar con este negocio trabajaba en la venta al por mayor de galletas en Tacna, cuando se caso a los 17 años decide empezar con el negocio de crianza de ganado vacuno junto a su esposo. Actualmente sigue con la crianza de ganado vacuno, ovino y porcino. 

Con el préstamo que solicitara de S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles comprara 01 toro a S/. 2.200, el cual será pagado en 5 cuotas.

Su anhelo es que su hijo sea profesional y poder vivir tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Guillermina is a member of the Community Bank "Espiritu Santo" in the center of Chimbo, in the district and province of Yunguyo. She is 44 years old, she is married and a mother of 4 kids, 2 of which live with her and are in the sixth grade of primary school. With the first loan of 300 soles she bought a calf for raising. Before starting this business she worked selling biscuits in bulk in Tacna. When she got married when she was 17, she decided to start a business raising cattle with her husband. Now she still does this, raising cows, sheep and pigs.

With the loan she has asked for, of 2,500 soles, she will buy a bull for 2,200 soles, which she will repay in 5 installments.

Her wish is that her son will be a professional and be able to live peacefully.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bull/Compra de 1 toro.

loans.name: Hamida Nakkazi’S Group

texts.en: Hamida is the leader of a four-member group. She is a 50-year-old widow with eight children, age 10 through 38 years old. Three of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (three grandchildren and her elderly parents). She owns a two-room house, where she resides with ten people. They have electricity but no piped-in water at home. The family receives two meals a day and rarely takes tea. She works in a semi-urban area, which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Her food kiosk is in Kalerwe market, which is located in one of the city's suburbs. Her monthly rent is 25000/=. She doesn’t incur extra transport costs for the food goods she sells because she buys them from the Kalerwe market. Hamida works seven days a week and has been with MCDT for six years. She is servicing her tenth loan. She wants to use the loan book to buy produce for the Christmas season. Hamida aspires to own a permanent place for her business at home.

loans.use: To buy and stock more food for the festive season.

loans.name: Ni Nengah Ngalis

texts.id: Setelah pelunasan dari periode pertama pinjamannya, Ni Nengah Ngalis kembali mengajukan pinjaman kedua yang jumlahnya sebesar Rp. 2. 000. 000,-. Dana yang diperoleh akan dimanfaatkan untuk biaya produksi yang meliputi : ongkos tukang panjat kelapa dan memperbaharui alat untuk produksi gula merah ( wajan dan alat cetak ). Dengan  alat- alat produksi yang baru, Ni Nengah Ngalis berharap, produksi gula merahnya dapat meningkat serta bentuk/desainnya sesuai dengan yang diminta oleh pasar. Dari keuntungan usaha gula merah yang ia lakukan, Ni Nengah Gelis akan menyisihkan setengahnya untuk biaya renovasi rumah dan setengahnya lagi untuk membeli sebuah kendaraan bermotor yang dapat dimanfaatkan sebagai alat angkut gula merahnya ke pasar.
texts.en:
After paying off her first loan, Ni Nengah Ngalis is requesting a second loan for 2,000,000 IDR. The fund will be used to cover production costs such as the fee for the coconut tree climber and to renew her palm sugar production equipment (pans and baking tins). With new production equipments, Ni Nengah Ngalis hopes to improve her production capacity and to be able to offer palm sugar in shapes/designs that the market wants. Ni Nengah Gelis will set aside half of her profit to purchase a motor vehicle that can be used to transport her palm sugar to the nearby market.

Translated from Indonesian by Arliadi (Ludi) Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay her employees and to buy new equipments

loans.name: Flor De Oriente Group

texts.es:
las señoras antes mensionadas son integrantes del Grupo Flor de Oriente, ubicado en la comunidad de la Montañita, el Chichicaste, en la actualidad ellos no cuentan con capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir sus negocios, razon por la cual estan solicitando un credito. las actividades del grupo son las siguientes:
Marisela S.: se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de rosquillas desde hace 5 y medio años, ella es viuda, tiene una hija la cual depende de ella al 100%, con los ingresos que le genera el negocio cubre todos los gastos del hogar y tambien los gastos de sus estudios. el producto que ella elabora lo vende de manera ambulante en el lugar donde ella reside, su condicion de vida cada vez va mejorando.
Martha A.: ella se dedica al comercio tiene una pequeña tienda de productos de consumo popular ubicada en su casa de habitacion, tiene 4 años de tener su negocio, tambien ella se dedica a la produccion y venta de rosquillas, ella es casada y madre de tres hijos los cuales dependen de ella, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura (siembra maiz y frijoles) con los que le generan ingresos para salir adelante con su hogar.
Dilcia S.; ella se dedica a la elaboracion de rosquillas tambien, tiene 6 años de realizar esta actividad, ella vende su producto de forma ambulante y principalmente a pulperias y mercaditos de su comunidad, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos que toda via dependen de ella, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y juntos los dos sacan adelante su hogar.
texts.en:
The women mentioned here are members of the Flor de Oriente group, located in the Montañita community of Chichicaste. Currently they do not have enough capital to continue with their work—for this reason they are asking for a loan. The different jobs of the group are: Marisela S.—For the past five years has made and sold rosquillas (a type of doughnut). She is a widow and has a daughter who depends on her 100%. With the income she generates with this work she pays for all household expenses as well as her daughter’s studies. She sells the doughnuts on the streets where she lives and every day her life is improving. Martha A.—For the past four years she has run a small store with everyday goods from her home. She also works making rosquillas. She is a married mother of three children who all depend on her. Her husband works in agriculture (planting corn and beans) and they both generate income to help their family get ahead. Dilcia S.—For the past six years she has also made and sold rosquillas. She sells her product on the streets and also to grocery stores and small markets in her community. She is married and has 4 children who depend on her. Her husband works in agriculture and the two of them work to improve their home.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: materials for making rosquillas (a type of doughnut)

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en: Vugar is 27 years old and single. He lives in the Khachmaz region, in the village of Bagbanli. Three years ago he started a general store. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy food for expanding his business.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Iris

texts.es: Iris tiene 32 años, es natural de la Ciudad de Ancash, vive con su esposo Jose Carlos, el cual es de la Ciudad de Puno, ambos viven en su casa propia con sus hijos Brenda de 8 años y Marco Antonio de 2. Ellos son una familia muy unida, tanto es así que Iris y su esposo trabajan juntos en el servicio de trasporte, con diferentes rutas a los distritos de Lima, él es chofer y ella se dedica a la cobranza de pasajes. Con esta labor ambos mantienen los gastos de su hogar desde hace 8 años, y les gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que les permite estar juntos durante todo el día, pero el trabajo es cansado y muchas veces los pasajeros no son amables, pero son dificultades que saben afrontar de muy buena manera, además los ingresos son buenos, ya que la ruta que ellos siguen es muy concurrida y siempre tienen el minibus con muchos pasajeros. Lamentablemente esta unidad no es propia, y es por eso que ambos esperan con el tiempo comprar su propio minibús. Iris se encuentra en su primer préstamo con MFP, alentada por una amiga para sacar un crédito en un grupo, es así que espera ser muy puntual en los pagos. Con en dinero que está solicitando refaccionará las pequeñas averías en los asientos del minibus en el que trabaja, para poder brindar un mejor servicio. Con otra parte del dinero desea comprar los útiles de su pequeña que ya comienza el año académico en la escuela.
texts.en:
Iris is 32 years old and is from the city of Ancash. She lives in her own home with her husband Jose Carlos, who is from Puno, and their children Brenda, 8 and Marco Antonio, 2. They are a very close family and Iris and her husband work together. They have a transportation service with different routes around Lima. He is the driver and she collects money from the passengers. With this work they have supported their household for the past 8 years and they both like the work since it allows them to be together the whole day. However, the work is tiring and many times the passengers are not kind. These are difficulties that they have learned to overcome and they earn decent money, since the route they drive is very busy and their minibus is always full of passengers. Unfortunately they do not own the minibus and they hope to purchase their own minibus in the future. This is Iris’ first loan with MFP, she was encouraged by a friend to take out a loan with the group. She hopes to be very punctual with her payments. With the loan money she will repair some damages and tears to the seats in the bus, in order to offer a better service for their customers. She would also like to buy some school supplies for her daughter since the school year is beginning.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make repairs to her minibus

loans.name: Getruda M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 32 year old Getruda Mpiyila from Mbeya. She is married with 2 children, between the ages of 2 and 5. Getruda has been running a salon business since 1997. Gertruda's beauty salon is a place where her friends and fellow women can gather and literally let their hair down.  Most beauty salons in Tanzania are places where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own.  Gertruda works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week and currently earns about 160USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 375USD in order to purchase rastas and cosmetics for her salon. In the future, she plans to start a new business. Getruda thanks you for your support!


ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rastas and cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Eupricina

texts.en: Eupricina M. a 51-year-old fish and vegetable vendor. She lives in Navalan Village, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married to Felix M. who works as a farmer. She has six children; two are studying and four are married.  Her fish and vegetables are displayed in the village market everyday.  She applied for a loan of PHP 14,000.00 to purchase more kinds of fish and vegetables. She plans to sell every morning to other villages. Her business income helps them meet their daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fish and vegetables

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi A. est un jeune homme de 32 ans, marié et père d’un petit garçon. Il est conducteur de taxi moto à Wome, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Pour mieux épargner afin de subvenir aux besoins de la famille, Komi souhaite avec ce crédit acquérir sa propre moto. il compte sur cette aubaine pour améliorer les conditions de sa vie
texts.en:
Komi A. is a young man, 32 years old, married, and a father with a young boy. He is a moto taxi driver in Wome, a village located about 130 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. To save more money for providing for his family, Komi would like to use this loan to acquire his own moto. He is counting on this huge opportunity to improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Khursheed Muhammad Siddique Group

texts.en:
Khursheed baji is the wife of M. S. and has lived in a mid-size city named Riwind, Pakistan for the past ten years. She is a very hardworking and caring lady. She has a business making pitchers that she sells in the community and markets. She does this work to pay for her utilities. Her husband sells clothing in Riwind that he buys from famous cities (Lahore and Multan).

Khursheed baji is applying for a loan to buy clothes to expand her husband’s business. She is the leader of a group of five other women from her locality. Sajida parveen and Sadaqat baji each want a loan to buy a lath machine. Anwar baji wants a loan to buy bangles to sell. Rukaiya baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Hamidan baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Kemi is 23 years old and married with a child. She sells baby things like pampers, cream, etc. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more baby things to sell.She says thanks to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more baby things to sell

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Гулчехре 36 лет. Она замужем и мать 3-х детей. Занимается переработкой шерсти и производством шерстяной нити. Её муж пастух. Он пасет свое маленькое стадо и стадо соседа за дополнительную плату. Гульчехра закупает шерсть у других пастухов, потому, что ей не хватает шерсти из своего стада. Гулчехра хочет закупить большую партию козьей и овечьей шерсти, пока они дешевле. На зимний сезон они подорожают. За этим Гулчехра просит займ.
texts.en:
Gulchehra is 36 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. She processes wool and produces yarn. Her husband is a shepherd. He keeps a small herd as well as the herd of a neighbor for additional pay. Gulchehra purchases wool from other shepherds because she doesn’t have enough from her and her husband’s herd. Gulchehra wants to purchase a large quantity of goat’s and sheep’s wool, as they are cheaper. But in the winter, they gain in value. For this, Gulchehra requests a loan.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wool processing and yarn production

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna I. is from the village of Yahong. She is 39 years old. Edna is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Edna operates a business venture raising pigs for sale. Edna has been engaged in her business for three years and earns approximately Php1,600.00 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Edna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a loan amounting to 3,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Edna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed & other supplies

loans.name: Rozigul

texts.ru: Джуманазарова Розигул проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 58 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Дети уехали на заработки в Россию. Сама Розигул более 6 лет занимается бизнесом. Она имеет торговую точку, где торгует продуктами питания. Ее муж также помогает ей с закупом ассортимента. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Rozigul J. lives in the Rumi region. She is 58 years old. She is married and has five children. Her children went to Russia as migrant workers. Rozigul has bee doing business for more than six years. She has a vendor slot where she sells food stuffs. Her husband also helps her with buying of the inventory. She is asking for a loan to increase the turnover.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Leipu

texts.en: Leipu P. (0) is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Lotofaga Aleipata A. She is married and has four school-aged children. Leipu owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 450 WST a month. Leipu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Leipu is now requesting a new loan of 1,250 WST which will again be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Kibiimba Group

texts.en:
Alice B. is the president of Kibiimba Group. She leads the women of the group by using innovative ideas for fighting poverty. She is forty-seven years old and single. She is a hardworking business woman who is blessed with six children, one of whom is in school. She is also looking after three dependents, two of whom are also in school.

Alice deals mostly with charcoal although she also sells firewood and milk. She has been operating these businesses for over twenty years. She is using the loan to purchase more inventory including charcoal, firewood, and milk to improve her business and generate more profits. She is always trying hard to encourage her group members to be successful. Her future hope is to construct a house for her children where they can at least feel comfortable.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory including charcoal, firewood, and milk

loans.name: Mrs. Chrev Horm Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of 16 people, is located in Thmei village in Takeo province. Mrs. Chrev H. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Teng Khloung, is a farmer and he also helps his wife in her current business. Mrs. Chrev H. is 39 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. All the members are presented in the picture. 

Fifteen members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans and one has a monthly payment loan. The fifteen members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy piglets and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Help with his livestock

loans.name: Modern Preparatory School Of Science And Technology Group

texts.en:
The Modern Preparatory School of Science and Technology is a private school established in 2005. They have a staff of 24 serving 393 pupils. With no additional payments from the government, many of the school's teachers invest in other side-businesses -- which are usually maintained and managed by relatives or friends -- to supplement their incomes. 

Twenty-one of the professors at Modern Preparatory are seeking a loan of 16.5 million LE from SMT and Kiva lenders to invest in many of their personal businesses. Augustine G. S., a senior teacher, is the group’s leader. He has been a teacher for seven years, and is married with one young child. In addition to his teaching, Augustine owns a small business selling ready-to-wear clothing and jeans, which he would like to expand by using his share of the loan.

loans.use: To expand the inventory of his clothing shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing haberdashery products

loans.name: G.s Las Mesitas Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Las Mesitas está conformado por Belma, Reina Margarita y Luisa las 3 se dedican a la misma actividad económica por lo que quisieron reunirse para formar un solo grupo y juntas realizar un financiamiento que le ayudara a salir adelante con cada uno de sus actividades económicas. Por lo que Luisa tiene 8 años de tener este negocio de pulpería que nació por medio porque ella anteriormente tenía la responsabilidad de mantener a sus hijos. La edad de Doña Luisa es de 71 años y debido a su edad decidió seguir adelante con este negocio. Por lo que el financiamiento que solicitan es para comprar en productos como golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan y granos básicos. Ya que son necesarios para mantener a sus clientes. Ellas sueñan con obtener estabilidad económica y debido a esta temporada es que ellas quieren invertir en su negocio lo suficiente para mantenerlo.
texts.en:
The Las Mesitas Communal Bank is comprised of Belma, Reina Margarita, and Luisa. The three of them work in the same economic activity. They wanted to get together to form one group and get a loan together. That will help them get ahead in each one of their activities. Luisa has had her business, a mini market, for eight years. It blossomed because she previously had to provide for her children. Luisa is 71. Due to her age, she decided to continue with this business. The loan they are asking for is to buy products like sweets, natural soft drinks, bread, and basic grains. These are necessary to keep their customers. They dream of getting economic stability. Because of this season they want to invest in their businesses sufficiently to maintain them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nakazadde Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
Margaret N. is a hardworking lady. She is married with four children ranging in age from 4 to 11, all in the primary section of school. She takes care of her siblings. Margaret has had a retail shop in Nakazadde for eight years and although her business has a lot of competition, she is able to make about 150,000 Ugandan shillings as profits a week. 

In the future, Margaret plans to become a wholesaler to make more profits to be able to educate her children at the best of school for a much brighter future. Margaret needs a loan to be able to restock her retail shop with more goods to increase sales.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Salvador Group

texts.es:
El banco D. Emprendimiento "SALVADOR " es un grupo  que se encuentra en su tercer  ciclo, demostraron ser  personas responsables, puntuales  y trabajadoras, este grupo esta representada por las siguientes socias: Como Presidenta esta la Sra. Sonia quien es la lider y fundadora del grupo, tiene el negocio D. venta D. masitas ambulando por las calles D. la ciudad, Es casada  y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo la abandono pero ella es muy trabajadora y mantiene el hogar sola. 

Como Tesorera esta la socia Bezaida quien es soltera, tiene su Farmacia, es una persona muy responsable y puntual con sus cuotas.

La Sra. secretaria es la socia Noemi quien es soltera y no  tiene  hijos tiene su Farmacia, es una persona joven  activa, responsable y respetada por sus compañeras
texts.en:
The "SALVADOR" communal bank is a group that is currently in its third cycle. They have shown themselves to be responsible, punctual and hard-working people. The group is led by the following members: Sonia, president and group founder; she peddles masitas (little cookies) throughout the city. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband left her but she is very hard-working and supports her family alone. Bezaida is treasurer. She is single and has a pharmacy. She is a very responsible person and very punctual with her repayments. Noemi is secretary. She is single, childless, and has a pharmacy. She is young, active, responsible, and respected by her fellow group members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Johana Del Transito

texts.es:
Doña Johana tiene 38 años de edad, reside en un bario que se llama 380
Madre de familia de tres hijos, que junto a su esposo trabajan para poder dar  a sus hermosos hijos una buena educación para que en el futuro puedan tener mejores oportunidades. Su esposo trabaja en una distribuidora de ropa como jefe de almacén y ella su negocio es una pequeña librería que a mucho esfuerzo de ambos ahorrando para poner poner un pequeño negocio. Por temporada las ventas se ponen bajas pero no se deja de vender ya que el estudio es lo que mas el país como los padres nos esforzamos para que sean nuestros hijos de bien. Con este préstamo desea comprar: cuadernos, lápiz, crayones, borradores, correctores, reglas, cartulinas, muchila, calculadoras y cosméticos.
Y muchos productos más para poder ofertar  en este año escolar a sus clientes todo lo necesario para estudio. Este financiamiento es con el fin de poder invertir más para ganar mejores utilidades e ir creciendo cada día lo cual espera obtener una librería bien surtida en corto plazo. Agradece Afodenic por el apoyo de este financiamiento el cual será de mucho benéfico para su negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Johana, age 38, lives in a neighborhood known as “380”. She is the mother of three children. Her husband and she work together in order to be able to give their beautiful children a good education so that in the future they can have better opportunities.

Her husband works for a clothing distributor as a merchandise manager. Her business is a small bookstore. After much effort from both of them they saved in order to establish this small business. Seasonally, sales drop off, but Johana doesn’t stop selling since education is what most of the country’s parents strive for so that their children succeed.

With this loan she wants to purchase notebooks, pencils, erasers, liquid paper, rulers, poster board, backpacks, calculators, cosmetics, and many other products in this school year so that she can offer her customers everything necessary for school. The goal of this financing is to be able to invest more in order to improve earnings and to progress each day, little-by-little, towards her goal of having a well-stocked bookstore. She is grateful to Afodenic for the support provided by this loan, which will be of great benefit to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of notebooks, pencils, crayons, erasers, liquid paper, rulers, poster board, backpacks, calculators, and cosmetics

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. C. tiene 60 años, esta casado con la Sra. Maria Fiore, tienen cuatro  hijos mayores de edad, todos trabajando.
El Sr. C. tiene una Herrería hace 22 años en ciudad de Capiatá, localidad muy cercana a centro de San Lorenzo  sobre la ruta principal Nº 2, su domicilio esta a tres cuadras de su negocio. Su Sra. tiene una pequeña librería en su domicilio hace 5 años.
Gracias al esfuerzo de ambos terminaron de construir su vivienda propia y  de solventar sus gastos familiares y también esta creciendo comercialmente.
Este crédito invertirá en la compra de mercaderías e insumos para su herrería.
texts.en:
Antonio is 60 years old. He is married to Maria and they have four adult children, all working. Antonio has had a blacksmith shop in the city of Capiata for the past 22 years. The city is located along Route 2, very close to the center of San Lorenzo. His home is three blocks from his shop. His wife has run a small bookstore from her home for the past five years. Thanks to their efforts, they’ve managed to build their own home, save some money and grow their businesses. This loan will be used to buy supplies and provide working capital for the blacksmith shop.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for blacksmith shop

loans.name: Victor Enrique

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo, el señor Victor R. tiene su propio negocio de venta de pollo y embutidos habiéndolo desarrollado gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos por mejorar dicho negocio y por estar persistente en dicho trabajo.

Actualmente el señor Victor ha ganado varios clientes que debe de aprovecharlos y siempre ofrecerles los productos para que estos los sigan consumiendo.

Está solicitando un crédito para la compra del pollo y embutidos y por esta razón es que espera que le sea otorgado para la compra del producto y así satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Victor R. sells chicken and cured meats in the Mayoreo market. He has developed his business thanks to his efforts to improve it and for being persistent in his work. Victor has won over many customers so he must capitalize on this by always offering them product so that they will continue to consume from him. He is asking for funds to buy chicken and cured meats; he hopes they will be granted so that he can buy the product and satisfy his customers' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken and cured meats.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: Jacqueline F. est âgée de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DAROU-KHOUDOSS depuis 3ans et demi et y a reçu 7 prêts qui lui ont permis de développer un petit commerce d'huile de palme. Une activité qu'elle mène depuis plus de 3 ans jusqu'à nos jours. Les bénéfices générés par son petit commerce lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jacqueline F. is 44 years old. She is married and mother to three children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Darou-Khoudoss for three and a half years. She has received seven loans which allowed her to develop a small palm oil business, a trade she has worked in for three years. The profits generated from her small business allow her to help better the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her capital to buy and resell palm oil and peanut butter

loans.name: Kafayat

texts.en: Kafayat is 38 years old and married with four children. Her husband also works to support their home. Her children are excelling in their school and this gives her joy. She is a friendly and hard working woman. To make a living in Ibadan, Oyo state, she sells electrical materials at retail prices to her customers. She has a stall where she sells her electrical materials. Her customers are usually friends and residents. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more electrical materials to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory to grow her clothing business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam A. is currently in the business of selling food at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock irish potatoes, bags of rice, beans and cassava flour to cook and sell. Mariam is 31 years old. She is married to a builder. She has 4 children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock irish potatoes, bags of rice, beans and cassava flour to cook and sell.

loans.name: Heremakono Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Hérémakono ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans,  4 enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Mamassoni, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait en général le commerce d’articles divers tels que les tissus  avec Adjaratou D., les fruits, les condiments alimentaires, le lait etc.
Adjaratou D. qui est la présidente du groupe  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente au même  marché de Sikasso et en   famille, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant en détail et souvent à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Hérémakono group average 38 years of age and have an average of four children each; the majority of them live in polygamous families in Mamassoni, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They are on their sixth loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, which they are taking out in order to satisfy their customers' needs; all their previous loans have been repaid on time. This group of women generally trade in a variety of items, such as fabrics (as is the case for Adjaratou D.), fruits, condiments, milk etc. With her loan, Adjaratou D., who is the president of the group, is planning on buying 10 pieces of "pagne wax" (a West African term for highly decorative and colourful fabric). She gets her supplies from wholesalers at Sikasso's large market and sells them at the same market and within her family to a customer base made up of men and women, on a retail basis for cash and often on credt. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 23,000FCFA, of which part will be used to help out her husband with the daily expenses and the rest invested in her business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva pertenece al Banco Comunal Suni que significa Abundante en quechua, Genoveva es viuda y tiene 2 hijos, vende leña en su casa, producto que adquiere de los productores que le traen a su casa. Además Genoveva vende golosinas, bebidas de manera ambulatoria en la puerta del Colegio Abraham Valdelomar. Su préstamo será para la compra de leña, galletas, caramelos.
Genoveva sueña con tener una tienda y sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Genoveva belongs to the Communal Bank Suni, which means abundance in quechua. Genoveva is a widow and has two children. She sells firewood in her home, a product that she gets from the producers who bring it to her house. Also, Genoveva sells candies and drinks to passer-bys in the entrance of Colegio Abraham Valdelomar. Her loan is to buy firewood, cookies and candies.

Genoveva dreams to own a shop and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood, cookies and candies

loans.name: Calle Ocho Group

texts.es:
El grupo Calle Ocho está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es María del Carmen A. quien desde hace cuatro años puso una verdulería y comercializa leche, queso etc. El sueño de María es mejorar su casa la cual se encuentra en mal estado especialmente necesita un cambio de techo por las goteras.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Juana Isabel Martínez quien inicio hace diez años vendiendo nacatamales y luego invirtió en el comercio de cosméticos y Ileana del Carmen Q. quien tiene una tortilleria.

Este grupo ha participado en el proceso de capacitación de autoestima y empoderamiento empresarial donde según expresaron aprendieron hacer optimistas, la atención al cliente y administrar el negocio.
texts.en:
The group “Calle Ocho” (Eighth Street) consists of three hardworking women. One of them is María del Carmen A. who has been operating a produce stand for four years and also sells milk, cheese, and other products. María dreams of making improvements to her house since it is in bad condition. Specifically, she needs to replace the roof because it leaks.

Her fellow group members include Juana Isabel Martínez, who started selling nacatamales ten years ago and later invested in a cosmetics business. Ileana del Carmen Q. produces and sells tortillas.

This group has participated in self-improvement and business empowerment classes in which they learned positive thinking, customer service, and business management.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, cheese, cream, and other products

loans.name: Guerrero (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Guerrero (Flat) es un grupo conformado por cuatro personas las cuales decidieron este nombre por que les gusta luchar para poder alcanzar sus metas y se identifican mucho con el. Ellos se ubican en la comunidad de Valle de Chalco Estado de México. Es un grupo unido el cual tiene mucha comunicación entre si.

El representante del grupo es el señor Valentín García García (el de chamarra azul) de 32 años de edad y orgullosamente originario del estado de Oaxaca, el es soltero y se dedica a la venta de tacos, comenzó de trabajador en un puesto en el cual duro dos años pero después decidió independizarse y comenzar con su propio negocio en el que actualmente lleva seis años, el  sale todos los días a vender con su carrito de tacos comenzando desde las seis de la tarde, entre semana las ventas son pocas pero sus días de mayor venta son los fines de semana ya que es cuando sus tacos los acaba a veces en tres horas. Siempre trata de conseguir buenos precios en sus insumos y dar buena calidad. Sus sueños son poder comprarse una pequeña casa para el y en algún momento para su futura familia al igual que desea abrir un nuevo puesto de tacos en otra colonia y crear un empleo para alguien ya que el ve lo difícil que es conseguirlo en este tiempo. Con el crédito solicitado va a darle mantenimiento a su puesto y también va a comprar un comal, bancos y mesas para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio. 

Los otros tres integrantes se llaman: Trinidad García López quien (Venta de Tacos), Juan B. P. (Taller de Bicicletas) y María Félix P. Hernández (Venta de Abarrotes y Lácteos) y aunque es un grupo pequeño tiene muchos deseos de superarse y quieren invertir en sus negocios para cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Guerrero (Flat) is a group made up of four people. They chose this name because they like to fight to achieve their goals, and they very much identify with it. They are located in the community of Valle del Chalco in the State of Mexico. It is a close-knit group with a lot of communication among the members. The group representative is Mr. Valentín García García (the man in the blue jacket), who is 32 years old and is proudly from the state of Oaxaca. He is single and sells tacos. He began working in a position that lasted two years, but he later decided to become independent and start his own business, which has been in operation for six years. He goes out each day with his cart to sell tacos, beginning at six o'clock in the evening. During the week he makes few sales, but his best days for sales are on weekends when he sometimes runs out of tacos in just three hours. He always tries to get good prices on his ingredients and provide high quality. His dreams are to be able to buy a small house for himself and, at some point, for his future family. He also wants to open a new taco stand in another community and create a job for someone, given that he sees that it is difficult to get a job right now. With the requested loan, he will do maintainance on his stand and also will buy a griddle (comal), benches, and tables to be able to offer better service. The other three members of the group are Trinidad García López, who sells tacos; Juan B. P., who has a bicycle shop; and María Félix P. Hernández, who sells groceries and dairy products. Although it is a small group, they have a great desire to excel and want to invest in their businesses in order to achieve their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of benches, banners, bicycle spare parts, groceries such as beans, rice, sugar, and dairy products

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Oseas

texts.en:
Oseas A. is from the village of Lintugop, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 59 years old. Oseas is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Oseas owns & operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing a passenger pump boat in the local community. Oseas has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Oseas joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oseas has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Oseas is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Oseas from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand the passenger pump boat services

loans.name: For Help Group

texts.en:
Meet with the members of the “For Help” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to help them develop their businesses.

The leader of the group, Isatu K. (pictured in the left), is 27 years old. She is married with two children.

Isatu sells cosmetics, clothes, jewelry, toothpaste, etc., and has been doing this business for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy more of the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics, clothes, jewelry, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is 26 years old. He is married and has been blessed with 2 children, ages 4 and 2. His eldest child is currently attending school.

Meshack is a hardworking farmer from the town of Kisii in Western Kenya. He has been farming for the last 6 years. His main products are maize, beans, sugarcane, bananas, tea leaves and vegetables, which he sells to both Kenya Tea Development Authority and the local market. He also earns income from his masonry business.

Meshack has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase a dairy cow. He plans to use the proceeds from this loan to open a workshop and educate his children. His primary challenges have been fluctuating weather patterns and disease, which affect his dairy animals.

In the future, he plans to open a big workshop and purchase several machines for use in that workshop. He appreciates all that Juhudi has brought him.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora lives in the town of Mukachevo, where she makes a living selling footwear for women and children in a local marketplace. She is committed to run her business in a stable way, avoiding risks and expanding sales steadily and consistently. She has been in business for 10 years and makes about 12,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Leonora is applying for a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to buy seasonal items and her stay competitive with other vendors. She is very diligent and runs her business with great integrity, which explains why it has grown and become such a success.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kiteera Basubuzi Kweterana, Mubende Group

texts.en:
John T. is a 39 year old pharmacist who is hard working and determined. The married father of 4 children has been running a clinic and a medicine shop from Kiteera Trading Centre in Mubende District for close to 14 years. From this he is able to educate his children who are still attending different institutions of learning. 

With this loan, John wants to restock medicine business with more drugs. He hopes to turn it into a big pharmacy because his customer numbers have increased. This will enable him earn more revenue and also be able to sustain his family's requirements.

John belongs to the Kiteera Basubuzi Kweterana, Mubende Group.

loans.use: To purchase of more stock of drugs

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es: El Sr. Pascual  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz en la localidad de San Carlos tiene 2 hijos el es soltero el es de Cochabamba hace 12 años que se vino de Cochabamba por que allá no se podía progresar pero tuvo la suerte de conseguir una parcela en villa San Carlos en la cual el se dedica a la agricultura juntamente con sus hijos quienes le ayudan a su Papa, pero trabajan medio día por que ellos estudian, el Sr. Es muy trabajador el dinero del crédito lo utilizara para el Chaqueo y la compra de semillas para plantar maiz, yuca y también cítricos, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Mr. Pascual works in agriculture, growing corn in the area of San Carlos. He has 2 children and is single. He is from Cochabamba, where he came from 12 years ago because he couldn’t go forward there. He has been lucky enough to find a parcel of land in the village of San Carlos, where he, with the help of his children, works in agriculture. His children work half of the day while they are in school. Mr. Pascual is very hard-working, and the money from this loan will be used for the Chaqueo (a prevalent practice in Bolivia, where farmers burn grasslands used for cattle grazing to enrich and fertilize it). He will also use the loan to buy seeds to plant corn, yucca, and citrus. He is very thankful for Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have in him.

loans.use: For the Chaqueo and to grow corn

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita A. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Angelita is widowed and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Angelita owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling coconuts and also running a retail store selling biscuits, coffee, detergents and snack foods in the local community. Angelita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Angelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2010 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Angelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Beatriz Katherine

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Constructoras Del Éxito, esta ciudad se la conoce desde hace mucho con el nombre de Ciudad Del Valle por estar encerrada por muchos cerros que rodean la urbe.

La señora Beatriz lleva en el Banco Comunal ya siete ciclos y está muy contenta y agradecida por los beneficios que ha recibido en este tiempo. Ella tiene 20 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 5 años y otro de 10 meses, la mayor esta en primero de básica. El marido es comerciante.

Ella además de atender a sus hijos y su hogar también se dedica al comercio, vende productos naturales, trabaja de lunes a viernes de dos a tres horas al día, visita a sus clientes que ya tiene y le lleva los productos, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, lo que mas vende son productos para los riñones y el hígado, también las personas compran bastantes  adelgazantes y energizantes.

Este crédito es para comprar sus productos para luego llevarlos a entregar ya que la mayor parte ya los tiene encargados. Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the Communal Bank “Constructoras del Éxito” (Builders of Success) meets every fifteen days. This city has long been known as the “City of the Valley” because of the many surrounding hills.

Sra. Beatriz has already participated in seven loan cycles with the Communal Bank. She is very pleased and grateful for the benefits she has received during this time. Beatriz is 20 years old and in a common law marriage. She has two children, ages 5 and 10 months. Her oldest child is in first grade while her husband works as a merchant.

In addition to caring for her children and looking after her household, Beatriz sells natural products. She works Monday through Friday, two to three hours each day, visiting her customers and delivering products. Beatriz extends credit and collects payment every fifteen days. The products she sells most are for the kidneys and the liver. Her customers also buy weight loss remedies and energy supplements.

This loan will be used to buy more products for delivery since she already has a large number of orders. Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: Purchase weight loss remedies, energy supplements, and other natural products

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es:
Maria Jose tiene 18 años, estudia II año de Ingenieria Agropecuaria, vive en Jalapa, decidio estudiar esta carrera porque le gusta mucho el campo, y siente que ella puede poner su propio negocio. Su Mama es Maestra y su Papá es Conductor, sus padres y un tio le ayudan a pagar sus gastos, la Universidad le dio una beca para su carrera.

Ella realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Cultivar Repollo.

Su meta es seguir estudiando para terminar su carrera, y crear su propio negocio.
texts.en:
María José, 18, is a second year Agronomy and Cattle Raising student.  She lives in Jalapa.  She decided on this career choice because she enjoys the countryside and feels she can establish her own business.

Her mother is a teacher and her father is a driver.  Her parents and an uncle help her pay her expenses.  She also got a scholarship from the university for her career.

She negotiated this loan to buy supplies for the university project:  to grow cabbage.

Her goal is to continue studying to finish her career and create her own business.

loans.use: Agronomy Student Project: Vegetable (Cabbage) Farming.

loans.name: Monserrate Encarnacion

texts.es:
Monserrate de 45 años, vende ropa y peluches recorriendo las calles del Guasmo. Vive  en una zona periurbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales. 

Comenzó a vender ropa desde muy joven, confeccionándola y vendiéndola en las calles del Guasmo. Con el esfuerzo de todos los días pudo tener una clientela fija. En la actualidad trabaja vendiendo ropa y peluches muy económicos en un puesto  en la calle ubicado en una zona del Guasmo que es un poco peligrosa. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar peluches y ropa de segunda mano para vender a un mas volumen. En el futuro quiere tener una papelería en su casa.
texts.en:
Monserrate, who is 45 years old, sells clothing and cuddly toys in the streets of Guasmo. She lives on the outskirts of the city, where the majority of people are informal traders. 

She started selling clothes when she was very young, making and selling them in the streets of Guasmo. With time she was able to develop a solid customer base. Now she works selling clothing and very good value soft toys from a stall located in a neighbourhood of Guasmo that can be a little dangerous. 

With the loan she wants to buy toys and second hand clothes to sell in greater volume. In the future she would like to open a stationery shop in her house.

loans.use: Clothing, soft toys

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Sewing clothes is the main part of 36-year-old Mrs. Kung C.’s daily duty in the garment industry. Kung C. has been engaged in her job since 2008 and has a formal salary. She has no life partner because she is divorced from her husband from many years ago. She has four children who currently living under her managing. Two of her children are working in farming business. Presently, Kung C.’s house is broken and she wants to mend it, but she lacks a few cash to repair. So that Kung C. is applying for a loan in order to repair her broken house.

loans.use: To repair her broken house.

loans.name: Yuos

texts.en:
Yuos T., age 55, cultivates a variety of crops on farmland that was inherited from her grandparents. She has financial support in her husband, who is a village advisor. 

For years, they have had a medium-sized house located in a rural area of Phnom Penh, where they live with their family. The couple has given birth to nine children, six of whom are now married, and the remaining three are unmarried. Yuos T. has made an income through her farming work in order to feed their children from the time they were young. At the beginning of the year, it is the good time for doing a dry season rice-field but Yuos T. doesn’t have capital yet for farming. Therefore, Yuos T. is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
To make a living, Anecita J. runs a grocery store selling household items in the local community.  From this activity, Anecita earns a monthly net income of 3500.00. She has been running her business for 6 years. Anecita is 38 years old, married, and blessed with school-aged children. She resides in Napilan, Sapang Dalaga.
 
In 2006, Anecita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anecita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 27,000 PHP from PMPC.  This previous loan was used for personal purposes.  Anecita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used as working capital. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Anecita from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as working capital

loans.name: Zenayda De Jesús

texts.es: La Sra. Zenayda V. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se dedica a laborar como conserje en un colegio de secundaria de la localidad desde hace 10 años. Es casada y con tres hijos a los que trata de brindarles mejores condiciones de vida en el hogar. Una de las necesidades que tiene esta señora es mejorar su vivienda la cual es propia, por tal razón decidió solicitar su sexto crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de materiales de construcción como ladrillos y zinc para empezar a construir un cuarto en dicha vivienda y así brindar un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Sra. Zenayda V. is originally from the Municipality of El Sauce.  For over ten years, she has worked as the custodian for a middle school in the neighborhood.  She is married and has three children, to whom she has tried to provide a better life.  One of her current needs is the improvement of her home.  She has decided to apply for her sixth credit with Ceprodel in order to be able to purchase construction materials, such as bricks and zinc, in order to begin to construct another room in her house and improve her children's circumstances.

loans.use: Purchase bricks and zinc.

loans.name: Marysol

texts.es:
La señora Marysol trabaja realizando tramites en derechos reales y su esposo trabaja con movilidad en el Sindicato de transportes Simón Bolívar; el crédito requiere para la reparación y mantenimiento de la movilidad de su esposo, para continuar trabajando en el transporte de pasajeros.
Marysol vive en alquiler en la zona de Villa Nueva Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, está casada pero no tiene hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Marysol works completing property law paperwork and her husband works in transportation, as part of the Simón Bolívar Transportation Union. She needs this loan for the repair and maintenance of her husband's vehicle, so he can continue his work transporting passengers.

Marysol lives in a rented home in the Villa Nueva Potosí zone in the city of La Paz. She is married but does not have any children.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her husband's passenger vehicle

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es: El Sr C.  labora como conductor  es soltero, tiene dos hijos a su cargo,  es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, da gracia la oportunidad que le brindan esta institución con  este  desembolso, para poder mejorar su vivienda, comprar materiales arena, bloque ,cemento, cinz, piedrín, hierro, mano de obra PARA HACER ANEXO DE CUARTO PARA SU HIJOS YA QUE LA FAMILIA ESTA CRECIENDO.
texts.en: Mr Chavez works as driver. He is single with two dependent children. This is the first loan granted to him by CEPRODEL. He is grateful for the opportunity that the organisation is giving him to improve his house and pay for materials such as sand, blocks, cement, zinc, gravel, iron as well as labour to build an annex room for his children, given that the family is growing.
