loans.use: Buy building materials.

loans.name: Kimanga Group

texts.en:
Clementina J., who is in her late 50s, is married with six children.  She has been running a charcoal business for four years now. She works from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Clementina's fourth motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She hopes to obtain a loan to increase her business. She used the previous loans to increase her stock. She has paid back all her previous loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal stock. Her dream is to one day open a clothing shop. 

Clementina will share this loan with her loan group, Kimanga, which has a total of eight members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. 

In the picture, Clementina is in the back row on the right in a cream dress.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Kheav's Group

texts.en:
The five people who make up this group loan have selected Mrs. Kheav to become the group leader. They will use their portions of the loan in various ways to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Kheav is a widow with a child who is a laborer. She is a tailor at home who is able to earn a small income to support her family. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fabrics to increase her business activities.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics to increase her business activities

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es:
La señora Octavia del Socorro G. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora originaria de Niquinomo.  Ella desde hace 30 años aproximadamente se dedica a la venta de hojas y burrillos (mecate de chagüite) lo cual es utilizado para realizar nacatamales, tamales, yoltamal…etc.
Ella con el crédito comprara maletas de hojas y burrillos con el propocito de aumentar su negocio en especial en semana santa donde se realiza más tamales, yoltamal…etc.
texts.en:
Octavia del Socorro G. is a hard-working, courageous, and enterprising woman originally from Niquinomo.  For about 30 years, she has worked selling leaves and twine made from a local plant, which is used to make nacatamales, tamales and yoltamales.  

With the loan requested, she will purchase bags of leaves and twine to expand her business, especially during Holy Week, when more tamales, yoltamal, and other products are made.

loans.use: to purchase leaves and twine.

loans.name: Maria Yelba

texts.es:
Doña María, es agricultora, tiene 58 años de edad, es originaria de la comunidad El Coyolito, localizado en La Concordia un pequeño pueblo del departamento Jinotega, es madre soltera, tiene solo un hijo de 23 años de edad , su hijo ha sido su mayor apoyo, ella no pudo estudiar debido a que sus padres no tenían las condiciones económicas para pagarles sus estudios solo llego a cursas hasta sexto grado de primaria, aprendió de muy joven a trabajar la tierra, sabe lo que es trabajar bajo un sol todo el dia, sin horario, pero con ganas de sacar adelante su cultivos. Su mama le dejo un pedazo de terreno, el cual trabajo ella misma sembrando maíz, frijoles, además con el tiempo fue adquiriendo conocimientos para trabajar en la ganadería, pues este es su otro medio de subsistencia.
Solicita el préstamo para fortalecer la siembra de granos básicos como frijoles y maíz, compra de insumos para cultivar la tierra y pago de mano de obra. Confiando en Dios espera obtener una buena cosecha y sacar una buena producción.   
 Tiene como planes futuros sembrar hortalizas y ayudar a su hija para que termine de estudiar la carrera de contabilidad pues esta cursando su último año. Tiene como meta próxima aumentar el área de siembra.
texts.en:
Maria, age 58, is a farmer; she comes from the community of El Coyolito, located in La Concordia -- a small town in the Jinotega department. Maria is a single mother; her son is 23 years old and has has been her greatest help. 

Maria was not able to complete her studies because her parents did not have the economic resources to pay for them. For that reason, she was only able to study until 6th grade and learned farming at a young age. Maria knows what it means to work all day under the sun, without a schedule but with a desire to see her crops grow strong. Her mother left her a small plot of land, and that is where Maria now grows corn and beans. As time passed, she also learned how to work with livestock, and this became another source of subsistence.

Maria is asking for a loan  to increase her sowing of staple grains such as corn and beans, to purchase supplies for crop cultivation, and to pay labor costs. Trusting in God, Maria hopes to have a good harvest and a strong production of grains. In terms of her future plans, Maria hopes to sow vegetables and to help her daughter finish her studies for a degree in accounting, where she is now in her last year. As her immediate goal, Maria would like to increase the size of her sown field.

loans.use: to sow staple grains such as corn and beans, to purchase supplies for crop cultivation, and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Luisa Vicentina

texts.es:
La ciudad de Urubamba es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Luisa Vicentina que nació en la ciudad de Pisaq (Cusco, Perú), tiene 50 años de edad, tiene su pareja y fruto de esta relación tienen dos hijos. Ella trabaja en un centro nutricional para niños especiales en la  ciudad de Urubamba desde las 8h30 de la mañana hasta las 15h30 de lunes a viernes.   

Ella también tiene una pequeña funeraria en un local alquilado en la cual trabaja junto a su esposo, allí brindar servicios de funeraria y también venden ataúdes, entre otras cosas, el esposo es quien fabrica los ataúdes. Nos cuenta que tiene 5 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

Este crédito lo va a emplear para abastecer más el local, va a comprar madera y otros productos que se necesitan para fabricar más productos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace varios años y le gusta por la confraternidad que hay en el grupo.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y  construir su casa.
texts.en:
The city of Urubamba is known for its beautiful scenic spots which are visited by many local and foreign tourists.  It offers a variety of beautiful places and a rich variety of dishes that are typical of the region.

We met Luisa Vicentina here.  She was born in the city of Pisaq (Cusco, Perú) is 50 years old and has a spouse.  They have two children.  She works in a nutrition center for children with special needs in the city of Urubamba from 8:30am until 3:30pm, Monday through Friday.

She also has a small funeral parlor in a rented locale where she works with her husband providing funeral services.  They also sell coffins, among other things.  Her husband manufactures the coffins.  She tells us that she’s been in this business for five years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into the work. She will use this loan to better stock her business.  She will buy lumber and other products that are needed to make more products.  

She’s been in the communal bank for several years and likes it because of the confraternity that exists in the group.  Her goals are to stay in business and build her house.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan, 32, resides in Kampot province, Cambodia, an area known for fresh seafood. Chan and her husband are recyclers, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 25 on food and USD 40 on the other necessary expenses. Chan is requesting a loan of USD 370 to purchase more recyclable material to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy recyclable material to sell

loans.name: Zephanus

texts.en: Zephanus is a 43-year-old married man with four children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the beer and soda sales business for 16 years. He got his initial capital from rearing goats and crop farming. His hardships are debtors and price fluctuations, and his vision is to have a wholesale beer and soda shop plus a well educated family. Zephanus needs the loan to buy sodas and beers for resale.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beers for resale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has practiced farming in Njabini for the last ten years.  She is 70 years old, married to Moses, and they have two children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Josephine hopes to become a leading farmer in Njabini town.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional chickens and supplies for the chicken coop in her yard

loans.name: Las Conchitas Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama "Las Conchitas" esta formado por 10 integrantes que son mujeres, el grupo se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Concepcion Chico, la comunidad es algo grande pero esta en un cerro, la carretera principal esta pavimentada pero en épocas de lluvia la arena se empieza a deslavar y es lodo por todos lados. La gente del grupo vive cerca una de otra, entonces son buenos vecinos, y esa fue la razon por la que se reunieron y formaron un grupo de credito, lo llamaron "Las Conchitas" porque son mujures de la comunidad Concepción (de cariño es concha).

La señora Maria es la tesorera del grupo y ella nos cuenta su historia de su negocio, la señora tiene una tienda general, vende dulces, refrescos, pan , leche etc, todo lo referente a una abarroteria, su tienda es pequeña, tambien tiene un molino de Nixtamal, como en las comunidades  acostumbran que para comer las señoras hagan tortillas echas a mano,no compran en una tortilleria, y necesitan un molino que muela el nixtamal para poder hacer la tortilla y doña Maria tiene ese molino para que la gente pueda moler el nixtamal, en su negocio tiene poco mas de 8 años y sus dificultades son la competencia de otras tiendas y algunas gentes que tambien tiene un molino; aparte de esto nos menciona que le han llegado casos en los que le pagan con billetes falsos y ella no se da cuenta y pierde mucho dinero, también debe pagar el mantenimiento o las composturas que podría tener su molino, quiere un credito nuevo para poder pagar el mantenimiento de su molino y comprar mercancia para su tienda y quiere vender cosas nuevas, el proposito que tiene es mejorar dia con dia y comprar unos anaqueles para poder tener su tienda bien arreglada y poder vender mas mercancia, espera poder tener mas ganancias ya que tiene una meta fija y es darles el estudio a sus hijos.

Doña Maria tiene 3 hijos en la escuela y quiere apoyarlos con sus pasajes, vive en union libre con su esposo desde hace 15 años, tiene 43 años de edad, tambien vive con su familia en casa propia y su esposo trabaja, por eso doña Maria lo apoya con lo que gana en su tienda. 
Los nombres de sus demas compañeras del grupo son los siguientes y tambien de sus actividades.
1.-Ana Luisa, tiene un molino de Nixtamal
2.-Valentina, cria y vende borregos
3.-Maria Eleuteria, tiene un molino de nixtamal
4.-Maria Modesta, tiene una tienda general
5.-Rosa, tiene una papeleria
6.-Felipa, cria y vende caballos
7.-Maria Guadalupe, vende jugos frescos
8.-Juana, vende verduras
9.-Nicolasa, cria y vende borregos.
texts.en:
The following group is called “Las Conchitas” and has 10 members, all women.  The group is located in the community of Concepción Chico.  The community is somewhat large but it’s on a hill.  The main road is paved but during the rainy season sand starts to wash off and there is mud everywhere.  People in the group live near each other so are good neighbors and this is the reason they joined together and formed a credit group.  They called it “Las Conchitas” because they are women from the community of Concepción (whose lovable nickname is Concha).

María is the group Treasurer and she relates the story behind her business.  She has a general store where she sells candy, soft-drinks, bread, milk, etc; everything related to groceries.  Her store is small but she also owns a nixtamal (dough made from corn used for tortillas, tamales, etc.) mill.  It’s customary out in the communities for the women to make hand-made tortillas and not to buy them at a tortilla shop.  They need a mill that will grind the corn so that they can make tortillas and María has that mill so that people can grind their corn.  She’s been in business a little more than 8 years and the difficulty she faces is competition from other stores and from individuals who also own mills.  Aside from that, she also mentions that on occasion she’s been paid with counterfeit bills and she doesn’t notice and loses a lot of money.  She also has to pay to service and repair the mill.  She wants a new loan to pay to service the mill and to buy stock items for her store; she wants to sell new products.  Her goal is to improve day to day and to buy some shelving to arrange her store nicely and be able to sell more merchandise.  She hopes to have more profits because her fixed goal is to provide schooling for her children.

María has three children in school and she wants to support them with their transportation costs.  She’s lived with her husband in a common law relationship for the last 15 years.  She’s 43 years old.  She lives with her family in her own house.  Her husband works too and this is why María helps him out with what she earns in the store.

The other group members and their activities are:

1.-Ana Luisa, has a nixtamal mill
2.-Valentina, raises sheep to sell
3.-Maria Eleuteria, has a nixtamal mill
4.-Maria Modesta, has a general store
5.-Rosa, has a stationery shop
6.-Felipa, raises and sells horses
7.-Maria Guadalupe, sells fresh fruit juice
8.-Juana, sells vegetables
9.-Nicolasa, raises and sells sheep.

loans.use: to service a nixtamal mill and to buy merchandise for a general store.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 31 years old and is married to Samuel. The couple is blessed with two children. Margaret has been running a hotel for the past three years with a monthly income of 6,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which she uses to support her family's needs.

Margaret is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced to the group by an existing KADET client. She will use the loan to buy cooking fat, sugar, tables, and chairs.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes are to open a restaurant.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, sugar, tables, and chairs

loans.name: Bandu

texts.en:
Bandu is 50 years old and lives in West Point, Liberia. She is married and her husband is currently out of a job. They have children ages 22 and 32.  The younger one currently attends school. 

For the past thirty years Bandu has been selling on a table in the local market. She sells oil, onions and peppers amongst other things. Bandu is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. She hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es: Ligia  de 30 años es una mujer que vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 13 años. Su actividad generadora de ingresos es el comercio de ropa femenina, negocio que desempeña con su esposo quien es pensionado del Ejército de Colombia. Ellos se dedican a distribuir a credito estas mercancías, entre sus clientes que son principalmente mujeres en todas las edades, pues vende jeans, blusas, bermudas, y vestidos deportivos. Sus compras las realiza en la ciudad de Bogotá, capital de Colombia, desde donde le envían la mercancía. Cuando inició su negocio tenia ventas muy bajas, pero gradualmente ha ganado un mercado especializado, con capacidad para comprar este tipo de ropa que son de muy buena calidad y valen lo que cuestan. Es por esto que su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responder a la clientela creciente y esta la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará vestidos para damas, a propósito del acercamiento de una época de mucho repunte en sus ventas, como lo es el día del amor y de la amistad, que se convierte en dos meses de solicitudes. Con su crédito ella sería oportuna con sus clientes y conservaría el buen nombre del que goza, por ser una empresaria que responde muy pronto a sus pedidos. Su meta más adelante es lograr la apertura de un almacén de este tipo de ropa, para lograr un mayor posicionamiento y alcanzar clientes vendedores. Mientras esto ocurre, maneja un margen de utilidad no inferior a un 35%, desde al cual planea su crecimiento y desarrollo empresarial y el de sus esposo
texts.en:
Ligia is a 30-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children, ages 9 and 13. She generates income by selling women’s clothing. Ligia started this business with her husband, who is retired from the Colombian army. They decided to sell their merchandise on credit. Her customers consist primarily of women of all ages. She sells jeans, blouses, Bermuda shorts, and sportswear. Ligia purchases her products in the city of Bogotá, the capital of Colombia, and then has the goods shipped. When she started her business, her sales were very low but she gradually acquired a niche market that has the capacity to buy all types of clothing that are of good quality and worth their value. For this reason, her operating capital is insufficient for responding to her growing customer base. This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

Ligia will use the money to buy women’s dresses so that she can take advantage of the time of year when she sees a spike in sales, such as the Day of Love and Friendship (the Colombian version of Valentine’s Day), which results in two months worth of orders. With this loan, Ligia will be able to respond promptly to her customers and preserve the good reputation that she enjoys for being a businesswoman who fulfills her orders quickly. Her goal for the future is to open a clothing shop so that she can be better positioned and be reached by customers and vendors. Meanwhile she manages a profit margin of no less than 35%, from which she plans her growth and the development of her business with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase women's dresses.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a widowed woman with three children all of whom don’t attend school.  They live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years she has been selling fried fish to her neighbors and passersby.  Her major dream is to expand her business by selling wholesale.

With KES 40,000.00 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Samiye

texts.en:
Samiya is a married mother of two from Akko. She participated in the municipality's special training and advancement program for cultural preservation. As a course graduate, Samiya was given a shop located in an area with high tourist traffic. Samiya has a basket weaving shop and also provides seminars and basket weaving lessons. 

Samiya wants to expand her business and increase her monthly income. She is including additional handmade items such as crochets, rugs and  embroideries, as well as artwork and jewelry.   In addition, she has begun offering a wider number of seminars both for tourists and locals. The seminars are in demand for special events and birthdays.

Samiya needed this loan to make renovations to her shop and display shelves, and to paint her store.

Samiya has created a well-kept shop which draws a strong tourist trade. With the expansion and increased seminars, she is increasing her business potential. In the future, Samiya wants to branch out into artwork, jewelry and handmade product sales further by increasing her inventory.

loans.use: renovate her basket weaving shop and display shelves

loans.name: Rene Eliseo

texts.es:
René, vive con su esposa y su hija de 2 años, él es empleado trabaja en una institucion crediticia, desde hace diez años, todos los días de lunes a sábado.
El necesita el préstamo para reparar su motocicleta (ponerle llantas y otros repuestos) de ese modo la seguirá utilizandola para movilizarse a su trabajo, ya que la zona donde vive es bien retirado de donde trabaja.
El propósito de René es seguir progresando en la institución donde trabaja y ser un buen cliente para otros prestamos futuros y poder ir al día con la cuota.
texts.en:
René lives with his wife and two-year-old daughter.  He is an employee at a loan institution and has been working there for ten years.  He works every day, from Monday to Saturday.  He needs this loan to repair his motorcycle (fitting tires and other spare parts) so that he can continue using it to get to work as the area where he lives is a long way from where he works.

René's goals are to continue making progress in the institution where he works, to be a good client so that he can obtain future loans and to keep up to date with his repayments.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle (to fit tires and other spare parts)

loans.name: Mercedes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MERCEDES” iniciará su primer quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Mary. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejidos de chompas, venta de filtros, venta de frutas y verduras, encuadernación, venta de corderos, costura de mantas, hilado de lana, venta de ganado.

La señora Mary,  indica que hace dos ciclos que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de artesanias que aprendio hace años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de máquina y telas), que comprara la 16 de Julio y posteriormente lo venderá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la puntualidad.
texts.en:
The “Mercedes” communal bank will start its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board headed by Mary.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: sweater knitting, filter sales, fruit and vegetable sales, book binding, lamb sales, blanket weaving, wool spinning and cattle sales.

Mary indicates that she’s been working with Pro Mujer for two cycles having joined thanks to an invitation from an advisor.  She currently has a crafts making business that she learned years ago.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital (to buy a machine and fabric).  She will buy them at 16 de Julio and then sell to order.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family as best she can since she lives with a spouse and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the punctuality.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
Rina pertenece al banco comunal “Qorichaska del Cusco” y las reuniones D. los socios del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco D. la provincia del Cusco. 

Rina tiene 42 años D. edad y es casado y fruto D. esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad D. Calca y vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donD. realiza sus actividades económicas. Rina es profesora  y también se dedica  a la elaboración y venta D. artesanía y manualidades. 

En esta oportunidad Rina requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como papel, lana y tela para hacer artesanía y manualidades.  
 
Rina agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Rina’s a member of the “Qorichaska del Cusco” communal bank and the members meet every thirty days in the city of Cusco, Cusco Province.

Rina’s 42 years old, married and has two children.  She was born in the city of Calca and lives in the city of Cusco where she carries out her economic activities.  Rina’s a teacher and she also makes manual arts and crafts.

On this occasion Rina needs the loan to buy materials like paper, wool and fabric to make manual arts and crafts.

Rina values and is grateful for the loan and commits to make her monthly installment payments.

loans.use: to buy crafts making supplies.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 25 years old and married with no children. She has had a business selling cassava flour in Yei, South Sudan for four years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase cassava flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a store for her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in the Mariakani area of Coastal Province, Kenya.  She is married and has three children. Two of them are in high school and one is in grade seven. Mary is a dairy farmer, and she has been in this business for the last six months. She got the idea from her husband, who is a farmer also.

Mary has been a Milango client for two years. She is applying for a loan of 70,000 KES to buy another dairy cow, since she has received a tender for the supply of milk to nearby schools.

Mary has been facing some challenges, such as animal diseases--like brucellosis and others--and raising capital to buy more dairy cows. 

Since her husband is not working, Mary has provided for the needs of her family from the profit she makes selling milk. She intends now to raise more income in order to be able to pay school fees for her children, who are already in high school. Mary comments that, in the next five years, she will be buying and selling dairy cows by herself.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Alberto De Jesús

texts.es: El señor Alberto a sus 40 años de edad es padre de un hijo de 17 años. El señor Alberto se dedica junto con su esposa a la venta de mercancía tal como artículos para el hogar y de uso personal. El local del señor Alberto esta ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Medellín, gracias a que espacio público le otorgó el local donde no paga arriendo. La jornada de trabajo del señor Alberto es de 9:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m. El señor Alberto desea comprar mercancía navideña y juguetes para suplir la demanda por temporada de fin de año. Lo anterior le permitirá mejorar sus ventas y por ende a su familia.
texts.en: Alberto is 40 years old and is the father of a 17 year old son.  Alberto and his wife sell merchandise such as household and personal use items from their location in the Medellín city center.  Thanks to the public spaces, he doesn’t have to pay rent.  Alberto works from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm.  He would like to buy Christmas merchandise and toys to meet the year end season’s demand.  This will help him increase his sales and help his family.

loans.use: to buy Christmas merchandise and toys.

loans.name: Janit

texts.en:
Janit is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
 
Janit provides motorcycle or habal-habal services. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

Janit has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Janit hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for her motorcycle transport service.

loans.name: Mariles

texts.en:
Mariles is 48 years old and is married with 3 children. She lives in Sapangdalaga. To earn a living, Mariles runs a bakery. She has had this business for five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month. Mariles has been a member of PMPC for two years.

Mariles is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients for her bakery.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw seed.

loans.name: Sweet Honey Group

texts.en:
Joy is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

Joy is 29 years old and lives in Kalasan, Pagadian City. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Joy has a business selling a variety of food. She earns about 5,000 PHP a month doing this type of work. Joy has a requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Joy has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for five years. In the future, Joy would like to have her own carenderia.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 49 years old, married, and has four children. She runs a specialized food stall selling pancit (noodles) in their village. She has been operating for three years now. Her income of PHP 5,000 each month goes on allowances of her children and part of it is used as a revolving capital for the business.

She would like to keep improving sales from her business and ensuring delicious food to sell so she would like to borrow PHP 11,000. She will buy noodles and ingredients (onion, garlic, cooking oil) used in her panciteria. 

Cherry hopes to further develop income from her business so that she will be able to keep her children in education and attain success for the family.

loans.use: to buy noodles and other ingredients (onion, garlic, cooking oil) used in her panciteria.

loans.name: Nyerere Group

texts.en:
Abeid, who is in his early 30s, is married and lives with his wife and two children (a boy and a girl) who go to school. He has been running two businesses for four years now. He sells charcoal and used electronics equipment (TVs, DVDs, radios, etc.). He works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a very good profit per month.

He has requested his tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more sacks of charcoal, to purchase used electronics equipment, and to cover household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He wants to use the new loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and repair on the charcoal store buy putting  iron sheets on the roof and a door (he used to cover the charcoal sacks with a canvas sheets). His dream is to one day be able to build a very big, nice house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Nyerere" which totals 11 members who hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal  and to repair on the charcoal store buy putting  iron sheets on the roof and a door.

loans.name: Kapkatet Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Grace. She is 52 years old, married and blessed with six children. She is a member of Kapkatet Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to gain knowledge and skills on savings, enterprise development and financial management. 
She is a poultry farmer. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy poultry feeds and add poultry stock hence increased income. She will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children.
She is grateful to kiva and its lenders for the financial support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds and add poultry stock hence more income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Agostinha

texts.en:
Agostinha Mucomo, 38 years old, native of Mudada, District of Matutuine, is a mother of 4 children and currently divorced. She was in school through the sixth level, but couldn't continue with her studies due to marriage. She separated from her husband about three years ago. They both lived in the city of Maputo and after the separation she returned to her parents' house. With their help, she built a small establishment where she was lacking capital, so through information from her mother, who was already a client of Hluvuku quite a while ago, she was instructed in how to proceed with a loan request. With the courage of an entrepreneur, she directed herself to Hluvuku where she obtained her first financing. From then until now, she has been able to achieve stability in the business and was able to invest in improvement for the small establishment.

With this loan, she intends to acquire more merchandise and a refrigerator to preserve fresh products.

She acquired her business experience in the city of Maputo, where she sold basic goods in the informal market. She currently employs two young mothers and sustains four children.

She plans to expand the commercial establishment, have her own home and buy her own vehicle.

Translated from Portuguese by Naomi Baer, Kiva Volunteer

Localização : Bela Vista

Cliente : Agostinha M.

Sector : Comercio

Montante : 13.000,00Mtn (500 US$)

Aplicação : Compra de congelador

Inicio : 18/12/2006

Período : 12 Meses

Agostinha M. , de 38 anos de idade , natural de Mudada , Distrito de Matutuine, mãe de 4 filhos e actualmente divorciada, tendo escolarizado até sexta classe, não seguiu mais com os estudos devido ao casamento, separou-se do marido faz cerca de três anos, ambos viviam na cidade de Maputo e depois da separação voltou para casa dos pais e com ajuda destes construiu um pequeno estabelecimento onde lhe faltou capital de trabalho, dai por informação da mãe que já era cliente da Hluvuku a bastante tempo foi instruída como proceder para solicitar empréstimo e ela sem com coragem de empreendedora dirigiu-se a Hluvuuku onde teve o primeiro financiamento. De lá para cá conseguiu uma estabilidade no negócio e conseguiu investir no melhoramento do pequeno estabelecimento.

Com este empréstimo tenciona adquirir mais mercadorias e um congelador para conservação de produtos frescos.

A experiência de negócio adquiriu na cidade do Maputo, onde vendia produtos de primeira necessidade no mercado informal. Actualmente emprega duas jovens mães e sustenta quatro filhos.

Perspectivas , ampliar o estabelecimento comercial, ter casa própria e comprar viatura própria.

loans.use: Refrigerator acquisition

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 55 year old mother of seven children. With only a basic education, she served a three year apprenticeship in sewing. When she completed the apprenticeship, she set up her own sewing shop and began training other less fortunate ones. Along the way Grace has added a general provisions store which has the potential to grow.

As a 'graduate' of KRABAN'S 'TEACH' learning sessions, she plans to use the KIVA loan to expand the inventory of her store.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en: Mrs. Alimatu A. is 40 years old. She is a specialist in sales of foodstuffs, a business she learned from her mother. She is married with six children and needs the above amount for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola is 22 years old and is married with two children. Her husband works in the countryside harvesting sugar cane. Fabiola has a food stand or taqueria, together with Maria Hortensia Moreno Gonzalez. They operate this business every day in their local market, offering tacos, chicken and pork to their customers. She forms part of the group called San Isidro 1, along with Dorisela Guillen L., who sells fabrics, Esperanza Munoz Jaurez, who has a grocery shop, and Maria Hortensia Moreno Gonzalez, who runs the food stand with Fabiola. With this loan, they would like to grow their businesses, buying more fabric, more non perishable items for the grocery shop and be able to improve the the stand where they sell their tacos.

Fabiola tiene 22 años, casada, dos hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo en la cosecha de caña, Ella tiene una taqueria junto con doña María Hortensia Moreno González, este negocio se encuentra funcionando todos los días en el mercado de su localidad, en donde se ofrecen tacos de: pollo, res, puerco. Ella forma parte del grupo solidario llamado san Isidro 1 la integran: Dorisela Guillen López (venta de telas), Esperanza Muñoz Juárez (tienda de abarrotes), y doña Maria Hortensia Moreno González (taqueria en asociación con Fabiola López M.). Con el préstamo quieren hacer crecer sus negocios, comprando telas., alimentos no perecibles para la tienda de abarrotes y acondicionaran el lugar donde venden los tacos .

Translated by Kiva volunteer Emily Charnes

loans.use: food stall vendor

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto is 55 years old and his wife Blasida is 51. They have 2 sons, one of them 21 years old who is studying at the university, and the other 16 years old and studying at highschool.

Roberto has run a business from his home for 6 years. At the beginning, he worked with Itaipu binacional as a bricklayer's helper, learning the business of construction and carpentry while there. Later, he traveled with his wife to Argentina in search of better work opportunities, staying there for 16 years working in what he had learned before.

After saving a little money from his efforts as well as his wife's, they returned to Paraguay and opened a dispensary in their house. In addition to the buying and selling livestock, his wife works in a clothing shop. He hopes to continue growing as a business to be able to offer a better future for his children. He would like the loan to buy livestock, as the sales of the animales generates a good profit margin.

El señor Roberto, tiene 55 años de edad y su esposa la señora Blásida 51. Son padres de dos hijos, un varón de 21 años que ya es estudiante universitario y una joven de 16 que se encuentra estudiando en el colegio. Don Roberto se dedica al comercio, tiene una despensa hace ya seis años en su propia casa. En principio, Roberto, trabajo Itaipú binacional como ayudante de albañilería llegando a aprender allí el oficio de la construcción y la carpintería. Luego viajaron junto con su esposa a la Argentina (país limítrofe) en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales, viviendo por diez y seis años en ese país y trabajando en lo que había aprendido antes. Luego de ahorrar un poco de dinero con el esfuerzo suyo y el de su esposa, volvieron a Paraguay, y abrieron una despensa en su casa, además de dedicarse a la compra-venta de ganado vacuno; y su esposa trabaja en la confección de ropas. Desea seguir creciendo como comerciante y poder brindar un futuro mejor para sus hijos. Desea el crédito para comprar ganado vacuno, ya que la venta de estos animales le genera un buen margen de ganancias.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. U. Sokhom is a widow with two children, one daughter and one son. Since 2003, she has been in the business of buying and reselling vegetables at her house. Her children are construction workers in local communities and sometimes go to work in Phnom Penh. Due to the living conditions of the family, she could not send her children to school in higher education. Her two children did not finish primary school.

She is requesting a loan of $200 from MAXIMA for the first time. She will use this loan to expand her business by purchasing and reselling vegetables at home.

loans.use: Purchasing and reselling vegetables at home

loans.name: Eveligi

texts.en:
Eveligi is a lady of 24 years and married with two kids. She applied for this loan in order to buy new fishing gear for her husband, who is the one who goes fishing and gets sea shells to sell to earn money.

She sells her fish strings at the village three days a week, but on Sunday mornings she sells them to the fish market at Apia (a town) where most people come and buy fish. She usually earns $48 USD ($120ST) per day, but $80 USD ($200ST) on Sundays. She likes to do her business every week, because this is the only way she earns money for her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy fishing gear

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan Francisco started selling some sweets as part of his retirement plans and little by little he obtained clients who are asking for more variety, and presently he has been able to set up a business where he sells his candies.

Nevertheless, don Juan Francisco wishes to increase earnings for his wife and family. Therefore Juan is requesting a loan of $150.00 to be repaid in 6 months in order to purchase more merchandise. With your support Juan may move ahead and obtain an income in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Juan Francisco en el año 2000 pensando en su jubilación, comenzó a vender pocos dulces, y poco a poco fue adquiriendo clientes, los cuales le iban pidiendo más variedad, hasta que logró poner su localito de venta de dulces que tiene actualmente.

Sin embargo Juan Francisco desea superarse más para así poder sacar dinero para su esposa y su familia. Es por eso que Juan está solicitando un crédito de US $150 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Juan podrá surtir más su local y así poderse establecer. Con tu ayuda Juan saldrá adelante y tener un ingreso en el futuro.

loans.use: Purchase of a variety of candy to increase earnings.

loans.name: Nyenga West A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret S.. She is currently in the business of owning a drug store and is requesting a loan to purchase more drugs for sale. Margret is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 2 children aged 18 and 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a commercial house. Margret has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to buy more drugs and the loan was paid back on time.

Margret is joined in her small group by Milly N., Petwa K., Prossy B., and Sarah W.. Milly N. owns a retail shop and wants to stock more goods. Petwa K. is currently operating a business raising poultry and wants a loan to buy more chicks. Prossy B. operates a charcoal selling business and wants to buy more bags of charcoal. Sarah W. is currently owns a bakery and is requesting a loan to buy a bakery mixture machine.

loans.use: To add stock and increase sales to her drug store business

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Mr. Guillermo L. owns his home with his wife, Mrs. Leandra Quispe. They live with their two grandchildren in the Tembladerani area, west of the city of La Paz. Guillermo is retired from the military. This loan will be used to fix a wall that separates his home from his neighbor's and to repair the ceiling in two of his rooms, which currently leak during the rainy season. This is the fourth time he is applying for a loan and he has been approved because his credit analysis has come back favorably. His three previous loans have been fully paid according to the payment terms of each contract.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer

El señor Guillermo L. vive en casa propia con su esposa, la señora Leandra Quispe y sus dos nietos en la zona de Tembladerani ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz. El señor Guillermo es jubilado de de la institución militar de nuestra ciudad. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la refacción de un muro que da al vecino y el cambio de techos en dos habitaciones que por el tiempo de uso presenta filtraciones en época de lluvia. Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Los tres préstamos anteriores han sido pagados de acuerdo a los planes de pago estipulados en cada contrato.

loans.use: Repairing a wall which separates him from his neighbor's home, and to fix the ceiling in two rooms in his house.  (Refaccón de un muro y cambio de techos en dos habitaciones de su casa.)

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
María Angela belongs to the communal bank Santa Rosa de Lima, located in the neighborhood of San Juan Bautista Mz. D Lt. 4, in Callería District in the region of Ucayali. She is 43 years old and has 4 children and her husband is a driver. With the first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles that María received from the Manuela Ramos organization she decided to invest in an auto rickshaw.

Currently she rents out her auto rickshaw in order to earn more income for her family and to be able to educate her children.

With this loan of 1,500 Peruvian Soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in maintenance for her rickshaw and buying spare parts.

María is very happy and is thinking about buying another rickshaw with the support that the Manuel Ramos organization provides to her through the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Angela pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Rosa de Lima, ubicado en el Asentamiento. Humano. San Juan Bautista Mz. D Lt. 4, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es chofer. María con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un motocarro. En la actualidad alquila su motocarro para que genere mas ingresos a su familia y poder hace educar sus hijos. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo invertirá con en el mantenimiento de su motocarro y en comprar algunas piezas. Maria esta muy contenta y esta pensando comprar otro motocarro con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos en los préstamos.

loans.use: For maintenance of her auto rickshaw

loans.name: San Juana Alicia

texts.es:
Little by little, I've been building my house and I recently added a room, the interior of which needs to be finished. It's a bedroom for my daughters because they're young women now and want their own space. That's why I'm applying for a US$900 loan, to finish the interior of the room. I don't have the money needed to complete the work and I want to get it done.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Poco a poco he construido mi casa y hace poco construí un cuarto el cual le esta haciendo falta los acabados del interior, es la recamara de mis hijas ya que son todas una señoritas y quieren su espacio. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $900.00 Dlls. Para los acabados del interior de un cuarto. Por el momento no cuento con el dinero que se necesita para los acabados y quiero ya tener el cuarto terminado.

loans.use: Complete the interior.

loans.name: Orzugul

texts.en:
Orzugul R. is 47 years old. She’s married and the loving mother of 4 children. Her husband works at the Tajik Aluminium Factory. Orzugul is running her own business. She is a farmer. She grows crops, such as wheat, rice, onion, and tomato.

Having worked the land for seven years, Orzugul has gained rich experience. Each day, she works diligently to make sure that she takes good care of her crop. Each year, she grows a yield sufficient for her family's consumption and for selling. She is doing her best in order to give her children a good education and a happy life. With her job, she has been able to pay for the schooling of her 4 young children. This motivates her even more to keep working the land.

Now Orzugul needs to purchase mineral fertilizer and seeds for seasonal planting. She’s asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni ($875 USD) for 9 months. This amount would help her accomplish her goals in a short time. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: At

texts.en:
Mr. At S. is a carpenter. He buys wood and makes tables, chairs, doors, and windows to sell. He has been in this business for ten years and makes about $5 per day. He lives with two children in Pealnhek Village, Pursat Province, Cambodia. All of his children are in school.

To expand his business and increase his family’s income, he now asks for a loan to purchase more wood.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to expand his business

loans.name: Chang

texts.en:
Mrs. Chang D. is a 26-year-old pig raiser earning approximately $2.00 per day, while her husband, Mr. Lat Bunly, 25, produces palm juice that he processes into palm sugar, earning approximately $2.00 per day from sales. They live with one child in Omperl Commune, Siem Reap Province.

Mrs. D. is requesting a loan of $100 to purchase more small pigs to raise so as to improve the family’s income. In the future she wants all of her children to be well-educated and graduate from university in order to secure good jobs and help support the family.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase more small pigs to raise

loans.name: Mr Vet Vy's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Chouy Dang village in Kandal Province, 23 people have formed a village bank and Mr Vet Vy is the village bank president, selected by the group members. He is a construction worker and cow breeder. As well as these businesses, he is a poultry breeder who raises 10 chickens in his house. Since his cow and chicken businesses are going well and they are growing bigger and bigger, Mr Vet Vy does not have enough money to purchase grass for his cows and chicken food for his chickens. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. His wife, Mrs Yin Sok, is a housewife who cooks very deliciously for her household. Mr Vet Vy is 48 years old and the father of four children who are all attending school.

My Vet Vy will share this loan with the other members of the village bank. One member has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. The end-of-term loan member is not required to pay aN. principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments maN. months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy grass for his cows and chicken food for his chickens.

loans.name: Nueva Generación Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Nueva Generación esta ubicado en la comunidad D. Yauli, provincia D. Huancavelica. Esta comunidad es una zona rural muy hermosa, cuna D. chanchos y willcas, zona D. papa y mujeres chopccas con vestimenta multicolor. Su principal actividad es la agricultura, ganadería y el comercio.

MatilD. M., es casada, tiene 5 hijos, su negocio es la venta D. chupetes, MatilD. tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, antes realizaba transporte D. Yauli a Huancavelica, pero se vio paralizado por un accidente. Con los prestamos ha mejorado las ventas que realiza, ahora desea comprar mercadería para su tienda y materia prima para elaborar sus chupetes. Su sueño es tener una bodega granD..

Isabel R., es conviviente, tiene un hijo D. 6 años D. edad, su negocio es la venta D. salchipapas, empezó muy joven, con las ganancia fue implementando su negocio compro una licuadora para vender jugos. Invertirá su préstamo en la compra D. papa para la venta en su negocio. Su sueño es tener una casa D. material noble y tener mas adelante una bodega granD..
texts.en:
The Nueva Generacion communal bank is located in the community of Yauli, Huancavelica province. This community is in a beautiful rural area, land of wild boars and willcas (indigenous culture), of potato growers and of choppca women wearing their multicolor traditional dresses. The community's main economic activities are agriculture, cattle raising, and traD..

MatilD. M. is married, has 5 children and sells chupetes (a kind of popsicles). MatilD. has a small grocery store. She used to proviD. transportation from Yauli to Huancavelica, but an accident stopped that activity. Her store sales have improved with the loans she has received. Now she would like to purchase merchandise to restock the store and raw ingredients to make chupetes. Her dream is to have a large store.

Isabela R., is a common-law wife, has a 6-year-old son. Her business is the sale of salchipapas (a fast food dish, maD. of french fries and sausages). She began her business since she was very young. As the business grew, she was able to buy a blender to sell juice. With the loan that she is requesting she will buy potatoes for making salchipapas. Isabel dreams of having a house maD. out of noble materials and later on a larger warehouse.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nueva Generacion Communal Bank needs 11,900 soles for 14 members to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Zemfira

texts.en:
Zemfira  D. is a 61 year old woman who keeps a small shop.  She is married and has five children to whom she wishes to give the very best.  This business is the only source of income in her family. 

Zemfira has been running her store for 20 years.  She sells different kinds of textiles, bath and bed accessories, etc. Zemfira is very dynamic and cares for her family. She tries to give her family as much money as possible to cover the school expenses of her children because her dream of for all of them to be well educated.  

Today, Zemfira wants to expand her business and increase her working capital for purchasing new goods to sell.  For this purpose, she requests $1,200 to expand her business.  Zemfira promises to manage this loan without any violations.

loans.use: To purchase new goods

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.en:
Mrs. Dao Thi B. is 53 years old. She has been part of TYM Fund since 1999. She lives in Nam Vien Commune, Phuc Yen District, Vinh Phuc Province, with her husband and four children. Her husband is a construction worker. 

Her family’s main income is raising pigs and her husband’s salary. Their business is well-developed and brings in an income to their family of about 3 million per month in the local currency. This time she wants to borrow 9 million (USD$550) to invest in raising pigs

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Juliet Kirwana ‘S Group

texts.en:
Juliet, the leader of a five-member group, is 42 and the mother of eight children ranging in age from 7 to 26 years, all in school. She also takes care of additional family members and resides in a two-roomed house with seven others. 

Working in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala, Juliet rears poultry and is now requesting a loan to purchase more chickens and feed.

loans.use: To buy feed and poultry.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim C. is 35 years old, a widow, and lives with her parents and her young child in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer and sells small freshwater shells in the local market. She makes about US$3 a day.

Mrs. Sim C. would like to take out a loan of US$1,200 to make a new investment. She will rent a yam farm and collect the produce to sell at the market as a wholesaler.

loans.use: To rent a yam farm.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is a vegetable vendor in her community. She roams around their village and goes from one house to another, carrying her aluminum basin full of vegetables that she sells to her customers. Aside from vegetables, she also sells fish. She has been in this kind of business for almost 20 years and is still enjoying it despite her age.

She wishes to improve her business with the hope of increased income to further sustain the needs of their family such as food, clothing, and medicines for herself and her husband. To realize her plan, she is requesting a loan capital of PHP 4,000. She believes that this amount will greatly help to improve her business.

Aurora is 51 years old but is still active in the business. They are living in Barangay Pilitan, Tumauini, Isabela. Their village is located along the other side of the Cagayan River and residents take a ferry boat every time they go to the market to buy their necessities. Aurora's husband is a fisherman and their children are already married and living on their own with their families.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Aygun

texts.en: Aygun is 25 years old and single. She lives in the Guba region, in the village of Yalavadj. Four years ago she started a clothing sales business, and now needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is married with five dependent children. She has received no formal education. Mary sells rice and bread at Abrobiano near Elmina, which she has done since 2008. Her husband is a fisherman. Mary uses her income to help financially support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Mary will use the loan to purchase additional stocks to enable her to increase sales of rice and bread to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to reinvest in order to expand her trade.

loans.use: Purchase additional stocks of rice and bread

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 29-years-old Paulina P.. She is married with a 1-year-old child. Paulina has been running a mobile phone accessories business. It is amazing how many people have mobile phones in Tanzania! This is probably because it is the only form of phone communication available to most people since there are few landlines. Also, mobile phones are relatively cheap.

Paulina works at her business for 4 hours a day, 7 days a week and is assisted by two employees. She currently earns about $210 US. She is requesting a loan of $400 US in order to purchase phone accessories and sell them to customers. In the future, she plans to open another business. Paulina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase phone accessories

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet P. is a store owner in Sto. Niño, Village, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del Sur, where she lives.  Forty-nine years old and the mother of three children, she is married to Elmo P., who works as a mechanic at a shop.  Juliet, who has operated a sari-sari store for almost nine years, is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000.00, her second one with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.  She will use the money as additional capital for her store, extending the space available for her stock of goods.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam tiene 23 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo en una casa  alquilada. Desde hace 4 años se dedica en la atención de su bodega, y a la vez vende comida; su negocio está instalado en su casa, la que se encuentra en una zona muy transitada y comercial de su localidad. Al medio día es cuando tiene mayor cantidad de clientes, es por eso que muchas veces su esposo la ayuda en la atención, pero no es todos los días porque él se dedica a su propio trabajo. Miriam se esfuerza mucho para poder organizar su tiempo, ya que tiene que cocinar la comida que ofrece, atender su tienda, además de llevar y traer a su pequeña hija del jardín de niños. A pesar de este trajín, Miriam está muy contenta con la rentabilidad de su negocio, por lo que no duda en seguir invirtiendo su tiempo y dinero para mejorarlo, tanto en la cantidad de porciones que ofrece al día, como en mejorar la decoración. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal, ya que le permite crecer y pasar tiempo con sus amistades. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de mercadería para su tienda, además adquirirá víveres (sacos de arroz y azúcar) e ingredientes al por mayor para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Miriam is 23 years old, and lives with her husband and small child in a rented house. For the past 4 years she has dedicated herself to attending to her small grocery store, while also selling food; her business is out of her home, which is located in a high traffic and commercial area in her neighborhood. Midday is when she has the most clients, and it is because of this that often her husband helps, however, he cannot do this every day because he has his own work. Miriam works hard to organize her time given that she has to cook the food that she offers, attend to her store, and also has to drop off and pick up her small daughter from kindergarten. Despite her hectic day, Miriam is very happy with how profitable her business is, which is why she does not think twice to continue investing her time and money to improving it as much in the quantity of the meals she offers each day as in better decorations. This is her third loan with MFP, and she is very happy to be part of her communal bank because it allows her to grow and spend time with her friends. The money that she requests will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for her store, and she will also acquire supplies (sacks of rice and sugar) and other ingredients wholesale to prepare the meals she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar Nasar Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Shamim akhtar baji is a wife of N. A. who has lived in a mid-size city named Riwind, Pakistan for the past 15 years. She is an uneducated lady because her parents couldn’t bear her education expenses. She is a very hardworking lady. She runs a dairy business to share the financial burden of her husband. She gets up at 4 o’clock and gets milk from the buffalo, sells the milk to the milk shops and earns income. She saves her income in a committee for rainy days.

Her husband is a delivery man by profession. He delivers items (fruits & vegetables) on his vehicle named “Shahzore”. Shamim baji is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s vehicle because its engine is creating trouble. She is the group leader of six other women from her locality. Sugran baji, Mukhtaran baji and Seema baji each want a loan to buy buffalos for their dairy business. Akbari baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Sajida baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair her vehicle named "Shahzore"

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo is the mother of three children and she is 25 years of old. Taiwo sells foodstuffs and drinks in her shop. Taiwo hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thank you!

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine D. T. makes a living mainly from providing earrings and an ear piercing service in her community. She is 43 years old, married and has five adult children. They are from the village of Purok 24, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. Josephine has been in this business for over 18 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month.

In June 2009, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand ear piercing service

location.town: Purok 24, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao de

loans.name: Mam

texts.en: Mam Y. is thirty-five years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, where she lives with other family members in an old medium-sized wooden house. She currently relies on planting rice to earn a living. One part of the family income comes from her husband, who builds wooden boats. Also, he has been hired by neighbors to build and repair their fishing boat. Their daughter and son are in school and are dependent on Mam Y.'s income. She has a problem with transportation because she doesn’t own a vehicle. Therefore, she is taking out a loan to buy a motorbike for her family’s travel needs. She will use some of the loan to repair her old house that leaks and breaks down when heavy rains fall. Mam Y. and both of her children are pictured here.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her family’s travel needs

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 24 years old and is single. He is living with his parents in Ramallah, Palestine.

Mohammed owns and operates an Internet café in the local community. Now, he is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD to improve his business. Let’s help this young man who, with great care and dedication, fights hard to improve his life.

loans.use: To improve his business

loans.name: Faatafunaina

texts.en:
"Faatafunaina F. (0) is a 57 years-year-old woman living in the town of Vailuutai .  She is married and has 5 children adult -aged children.  To make a living, Faatafunaina owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members.  Faatafunaina has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 450 tala WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Faatafunaina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Faatafunaina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 tala WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided.  Faatafunaina is now requesting a new loan of 1500 tala WST which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Faatafunaina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business
